Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday Again”
Reviews.Author: x10pjc
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we have stayed at the Homewood Suites on I drive over the last 4 years. Yet again delivered what we expected. Good Hotel. Good room. Good Food. Great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Run down and dirty”
Reviews.Author: Fiona B
Reviews.Content: Where to start, this hotel appeared run down from the hallways and reception area to the room itself. Our couch was completely worn out and I actually avoided sitting on it because I was afraid I would catch something. The baby crib they sent up was disgusting and definitely not fit to put a baby in, moldy mattress and general filth. The second one they sent up after I complained was only marginally better and the sink in the bathroom started pouring water out of the bottom when you turned it on. They did send a plumber to fix it but really this is not what you would expect from a Hilton establishment. Even the pool area was grim, seemed to be the place where all the smokers congregated so you certainly wouldn't be taking your children out there. We were so disappointed with this place that we checked out after 2 nights and went somewhere else. For 200 dollars per night this hotel should have been much better.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly staff and great location!”
Reviews.Author: nrs312
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from a five night stay at Homewood. From the moment we walked in the staff was welcoming very helpful. We had several questions about transportation to and from the Disey parks. They supplied us with all of the information we needed. Our room was super clean with extra blankets and pillows for our kids to sleep on the pull out couch. The kitchen had a large refrigerator with a microwave and small stove to cook when needed. The hotel supplied plates, cups and utensils. Breakfast each morning was great and a manager always greeted us when coming out of the elevator. They had everyhting form eggs, cereal, oatmeal and yogurt. The location of this hotel was also perfect! We were able to walk to many different resturaunts, drug stores etc. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Superb choice of hotel”
Reviews.Author: ECB_UK
Reviews.Content: Traveled from London to stay at this hotel last year August for 2 weeks (family of 6). Hotel was great!! Room was very very clean and spacious. The room was cleaned every day without fail, must have had a experienced cleaner! Excellent service from the staff, breakfast was really good and on top of that, restaurants and shops were only a walking distance. Bus-top only a minute away from the hotel and taxi's readily available at any time. Thoroughly enjoyed my stayed, good choice of location for a family to go to. Would definitely go again.. 10 outta 10!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: yarosol
Reviews.Content: This was my third time in this hotel and I really love it. The Hotel is located in a really nice area; easy to go to Universal Studios or any Disney Park; night life is awesome in the neighborhood, so many options of food, drinks, party and family attractions within walking distance. This is a very economic option; the breakfast i good, rooms are clean and neat, quiet place and nice staff. I really want to stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “An eventful moment!”
Reviews.Author: Wanda S
Reviews.Content: I reside in Orlando and this was my first visit to the hotel, and my first event. The staff was extremely accomodating and friendly. Everyone made the event very memorable. There was an incident that was totally the fault of my own, and although I felt bad about mixing the staff flowers with those that were presented to my mother that evening, the manager was very understanding. I felt so bad that we had taken the flowers, not knowing they belong to a staff member, that I wanted to replace the flowers because it was an honest mistake; however, Greg made me feel as though we did no harm. I would recommend this hotel for relaxation and event planning. I felt like I was home. I felt so welcomed and appreciated as a patron. In addition to the hospitality, the rooms were spotless and the bed was like sleeping on a cloud in heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right!”
Reviews.Author: Cumbrian25
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly suprised. The location of this 'hotel' (International Drive) is perfect for guests wishing to visit Orlando's theme parks. Well-timed bus shuttles to/from most venues are well patronised. The suites are on 5 floors, are large and very well furnished. A king-sized bed is very welcome after a 9 hour flight from UK. The usual appliances one expects to find are all there and working. I found the staff professional and willing to help in any way they could. There was definitely an atmosphere of 'excitement and expectation' among its guests. A breakfast (buffet style) was included in the nightly room cost, which, although limited in choices, was good enough to start the day. All in all, the place lived up to its advertising and I've no hesitation in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, but the location was terrible for me”
Reviews.Author: expatsteve
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great, typical Homewood Suites quality which is great. The issues I had were exterior to the hotel itself. Unless you intend to stay right in "Vacationer central" don't go to this location. The traffic, particularly in the evening, is horrid. Also, the restaurant prices in the area are outrageous, and there are very few franchise restaurants within walking distance where you can get a regularly priced meal. Expect every dinner to be $25 per person or considerably more.

Reviews.Title: “yet another wonderful stay at a brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: st2826
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying here (we stayed from the 18th January till the 8th of February) and yet again this hotel was a brilliant base. From the minute you walk into reception with the very friendly staff (always got a good morning or welcome home greeting) to the lovely clean and spacious rooms (i seriously need to get some of your pillows!!!) the place can't be faulted. Breakfast-although very similar most days is good and fills a gap, we didn't try the managers evening reception (Monday to thursday) but it smelt good when we walked past. It's in a brilliant location with loads of good restaurants around and i-ride & lynx stops just a 5 minute walk away. We've stayed at this hotel 3 years in a row & even though we won't be back to Florida until (hopefully)my 40th birthday in November 2013 we will definitely be staying here. Thank you to all the staff there who do an amazing job and made our stay the best it can be.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and family friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Paris1273
Reviews.Content: Our main objective was a great price, ease of travel to Disney and Universal Studios, and space for two adults and one child; this location fulfilled every wish. We had our own bedroom and our daughter was able to sleep on the sofa bed in the "living room" area. This gave us the privacy we wanted and she was able to get a good nights rest after very busy days at the amusement parks. This location also provided a free breakfast every morning, the menu included waffles, cereal, eggs, bagels, and sometimes sausage. This was a nice way to load up before the hectic days ahead. The shuttle to Disney was very easy but keep in mind, it brings you to Epcot Center and then you must get on a monorail to Magic Kingdom; this is quite simple to navigate. The shuttle to Universal Studios brought us right to the park. Pace yourselves at the parks so you are sure you can get your shuttle back to the hotel. What was also nice about this location was it was on a very busy strip with a large variety of restaurants to choose from. All in all for the price of $119 a night, this hotel delivered in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more.”
Reviews.Author: Healsby
Reviews.Content: We got a great price on this hotel through alpharooms paying only Â£23pppn for a king suite. Our room was located on the fourth floor overlooking the pool and was immaculate for the duration of our 14 night stay. The location of the property is ideal for those who don't have a car as everything on I-drive is within walking distance. The free Disney and Universal shuttles were also a big bonus, picking up and dropping off at the hotel at a range of times throughout the day. Breakfast was great, choices of cereal, waffles, fruit, bacon & eggs etc. The staff were very friendly and helpful - always saying hello as we traipsed through reception after a long day out. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone and it will be my first choice accommodation on my next visit to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: LUXST
Reviews.Content: First stay in Orlando as a family. Two adults and two year old. In laws flew in later and booked in this hotel for a few days. When I made the reservation I accidentally booked a smoking room through Expedia. I called and tried to change the room and was told that they would put a note on it but can't guarantee. I was overjoyed at the non-smoking room and quick check in. Pluses - free Internet, breakfast and parking. One bedroom suites were spacious with full size fridge, microwave, pull out sofa and dishwasher. Love the full size fridge! Large safe in room to hold just about anything. They serve a hot breakfast not just continental. Sure you may get bored with it but you can cook yourself or walk right outside to Denny's or other restaurant. They do change it up every other day or so and try to keep everything topped up. Line-ups and seating is the only real issue at meal time. You can't beat waking up, grabbing breakfast and heading to WDW or Seaworld. Saves time and money. My son is a picky eater to boot so grabbing tiny bits of food at the breakfast bar for him to try is priceless really. We made it back for complimentary "snack" one afternoon - it was chicken stir fry. It was salty but probably a good thing since we were sweating all day. We had a rental car but did try out the local tram one day for fun. Tram is just outside the hotel. Not so fun when the trams are packed trying to get back to the hotel with a child and stroller in tow. Nice and friendly staff! Will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “First visit to Orlando / Disney”
Reviews.Author: CookieBec
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel well situated on I Drive, close to all major attractions. Suites are very clean and well equipped. Plus the bonus of having an in room safe. Complimentary breakfast and 5 a 7 will save you some $$$ more so when you have children with you. Very friendly staff and lots of parking. Tourist Information Office a 3 minute walk from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Property - Sloooow Internet”
Reviews.Author: rrakoczy
Reviews.Content: Most of the other reviews seem to cover the basics of this hotel: Large, spacious suites that are clean, comfortable, and close to all sorts of attractions on International Drive. The rooms even have King beds, which is a plus given that many extended stay places usually have Queen beds, or smaller. The only real downside was their wireless internet. Unfortunately, during most of my 3-night stay, their Wi-Fi ran EXTREMELY slow. 56k modem slow. Especially during peak hours (like the evening). Maybe that's not a big deal for most guests, but for me it was pretty important, and the only reason I can't give the hotel an "Excellent" rating. Other then the issues with the internet, the property was a great stay, at an amazing price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for a family or a weeks stay”
Reviews.Author: Mike G
Reviews.Content: Was in Orlando for a trade show. This hotel is very convenient for those working or attending a trade show at the Orange County Convention Center. "free" Hot Breakfast buffet in the morning is a huge plus. Lots of restaurants/bars within walking distance. The suites provide two rooms, fridge, microwave, stove...so perfect for a family or for those that dont want to eat out every meal..good way to save money.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed, good value”
Reviews.Author: holidayaddictUK15
Reviews.Content: Stayed many years ago on a previous visit to the Mouse, thought we'd try it again. Only 15 minutes from Orlando International. Still well up to expectations. Very good space with a living room with kitchen area, good-sized bedroom with separate washbasin and wardrobe area, and bathroom with shower and loo. Pluses - free buffet breakfast so you can stoke up for a long day at the parks, and Monday-Thursday a free 'welcome home' snack - pasta or salads or similar in the early evening. Good location - plenty of places to eat nearby, plus other entertainment at Pointe Orlando, and two minutes driving brings you to I-4 to get to the parks. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “This place rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Barry C
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife spent 8 nights here on our recent honeymoon. When we booked it we had the impression that it would be a no-frills hotel in a convenient location. We were right about the location but completely wrong about it being just another inexpensive place to stay. The location is excellent. You are within walking distance of so many good places to eat (Bahamas Breeze, Millers etc.), there are bus stops almost directly outside, you can rent a car across the road, cheap helicopter tours nearby and free shuttles to Orlando and Disney. There is also a Walgreens less than 5 minutes away. When we arrived we were given such a warm reception by the staff at the front desk (Nancy & Luis I think). It was that greeting (and the bottle of complimentary wine) that set the tone for the rest of our stay. The room was large, clean and comfortable. You get plenty of living area, two HDTVs, a large fridge, 2 hobs and a microwave. One thing that isn't mentioned is the "Manager's Reception" which is essentially free Dinner most nights. It is perfect if you're feeling a bit peckish and it consists of good and honest food. The complimentary breakfast was great too. There were laundry facilities on our floor too, handy for getting your clothes clean before the next part of your adventure. I think it was pretty cheap too, something like 2 dollars for a wash and 2 for a dry. All in all this place is the perfect base for a trip to the Orlando parks. I'll most likely be back and I'll certainly be directing my family and friends in its direction.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Greydan37
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on reviews on Trip Advisor and rating high for hotels in the area. We stayed here as a family while my husband was in Orlando for business. We chose a suite so we would have room to move and a Kitchen so I could fix food for my boys that have food allergies Upon arrival, they told us to park at a certain door which was very far from the room and we eventually found the back side door the next day to be closer (but that is where the employees sit and smoke so you had to walk by smoke with kids every time we went in and out of the hotel- they also kept this door unlocked for anyone to walk in) Con: We walked into our "non-smoking" room to be greeted with an overwhelming smell of smoke, with asthma and a kid who gets sick from smoke (we stayed out of the room as much as possible which is not what we planned because of the smoke smell). So, I walked in further to see a tiny fridge with no freezer and the bottom piece missing which my curious one year old quickly found was missing. The trim on the kitchen floor was all chewed up, so obviously a dog was previously in our room and my one year old once again found it and almost got cut on it. Con: The beds were very hard to me and I didn't sleep well but my husband slept fine, he thought they were a little hard but not bad. Con: The rooms and beds were sorta clean, we found a purple sock and magazines shoved down in the couch cushions so obviously they didn't clean there and there were crumbs in the drawers so we just lived out of our suitcase for the week. Con: They offer Free High Speed Internet which is basically a joke because we could only get service in about 2 spots in the entire suite and it ran S L O W. Hoping it would be faster at the business center...LOL that is a joke of a business center. I can't remember the last time I saw computers that old and that useless, i finally got it to load and get to the page i needed to print only to get an error that it couldn't print so I had to find a local library and pay $5 to use their computers and print one piece of paper. As we were packing up, I put the dirty dishes in the dishwasher to get cleaned and it was soo loud and making noises that when I looked at it when it was done, the dishwasher actually came/shook itself out of the wall. Con: No full size fridge as advertised and pictured on their website. Con: High Speed Internet is a joke. Con: Room smelled horrible of smoke Con: The breakfast buffet- eggs were ugghh and the sausage was fake meat and I am not even that picky on food. It was also extremely packed, as in you couldn't find a place to sit down and eat so be prepared to take it back to your room. Pro: Waffles at Breakfast were super yummy! Pro: Hotel is in a great location! Close to everything! Pro: Staff is very friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: marie1087
Reviews.Content: This was our escape when we needed a break from our 10-day Disney trip. THE GOOD STUFF: We stayed in a King Suite which offered a kitchenette, two t.v.s in separate rooms and a VERY comfortable bed. There is an in-room safe, and the bathroom offers a lot of space (sink is separate from toilet/bathtub). I was very happy with the full-sized fridge because we were freezing water bottles to take with us to the parks. There was no "stove" - it was more of a hot plate, but we purchased a lot of 'easy' frozen meals that just needed to be heated up so it did the job. There is a manager's reception from Monday to Friday (Fridays are the best days) that offers an evening snack and 'free' alcohol (a few select beers and wine), as well as breakfast with a LOT to choose from. On certain floors there's a small laundry room that only takes quarters. You can purchase everything you need in the gift shop next to reception, and get quarters as well. We slept very well in this room and never heard noise from the neighbouring rooms or the hallway. Parking was NEVER an issue. THE BAD STUFF: When we checked in, "something happened" with our reservation (booked 4 months in advance) and we were put into a smoking room because there were no more King Suites available for our stay. If we insisted on non-smoking (which we are), we would end up with something smaller and wouldn't be able to get a refund because we didn't pay through the hotel itself. A few days it seemed like the room wasn't even made-up, the towels were refreshed but they didn't make the bed or give us fresh toilet paper/bags when we changed our own garbage. We never complained to the front desk, but the next day everything would be done. I guess it depends on who's cleaning your room? ***P.S.*** International Drive is one hot mess of a tourist trap, full of restaurants and gas stations. There are a lot of people who don't know where they're going, so pay the extra $$$ to rent a GPS with your car. *** My husband's compliments - "Two t.v.'s were good." My husband's complaints - "There were no hockey sports channels!"

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BagmanNZ
Reviews.Content: Almost everything about this place was great. Clean rooms, friendly staff, good free breakfast and a free dinner. But the we had to use their computers to connect to the internet. They're crap, and that's being kind. Everything was so fantastic except the computers. If this doesn't concern you this is superb value for money and I recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC STAY...... !”
Reviews.Author: chloe c
Reviews.Content: I just want to spread the world about a secret Gem located in the center of International Drive Orlando. The name of this Gem is 8745 Homewood Suites , its truly homely and lives up to its name ! The management and staff are really and truthfully wonderful, they cannot do enough for you. Your wish is their command! We spent 3 weeks there from December 20th -Jan 10th . We stayed in a two bedroom suite which was very spacious and comfortable for our party which was made up of 6 adults and 1 infant, the two seperate bathrooms were very useful , Along with the fully Airconditioned rooms, also plazma T.v's in every room. We really enjoyed our stay , The swimming pool and Gymnasium were also a Bonus ! They helped burn off the surplus calories from the bountyful harty buffet breakfast were we had great choice of hot and cold food.. Also in the evening Monday- Thursday the hotel ran a dinner buffet followed with beer and wine !! I just want to let anybody know who is planning a trip to Orlando to check this little peace of paradise out !! It ticks all the boxes with flying colours...! Thats why we have been going back to the homewood on and off for the past 12 years...... We cant wait for December ! .. Crosbie Family.. Dublin Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Annayet23
Reviews.Content: I booked hotel thru another site that doesn't show the name until you pay (hw) so I was VERY skeptical about what I was getting especially at $53/night. Once I paid and got the name I knew this was a good choice, besides, they were 100% recommended on that site and I see why! I just checked out of this wonderful hotel yesterday and I must say this was a GREAT stay! I would definitely stay here again and recommend to others. Check in was at 4 but just getting off a cruise at 8 am, we had nothing to do. I was traveling with my husband and 2 small kids under age 3. So we went to a mall before driving to Orlando just to kill some time. We still arrived at the hotel early which was exactly at 12:04. They let me check in right away. Check in was fast and the clerks were very friendly. They did require a $50 deposit for incidentals which was no problem and they allowed me to pay that in cash. Upon entering our room...wow! It was a very nice, very, very clean one bedroom suite. It had a nice kitchenette with a 2 burner stove top. The pool area was very nice and peaceful with plenty of lounge chairs. Breakfast was great too! We missed the dinner but I like the fact that they serve dinner Sunday thru Thursday. My only complaint which is very minor is that the hotel is so big, it's very easy to get lost walking around the maze. The staff was very friendly and made sure they go out of their way to make your stay perfect (and it was)!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday help”
Reviews.Author: tiggyLaCrosseWI
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location. I loved having a Bahama Breeze so close-within walking distance. It was a high volume time-so I would not rate the hotel as immaculate. The lobby area seems a little cluttered. The room was very nice-great to have the kitchen area. IT was also great to have an evening meal one of the nights we were there. I can see where this would save a family a lot of money. Breakfast was crowded-and one morning the waffle machines did not appear (even though there were numerous requests for this). The pool is in a shaded area-although we could walk over to the Hampton next door. The staff was so helpful-and worked very hard especially during the breakfast. I also thought it was outstanding that they took the time to put up a big easel listing restaurants that were open on Dec. 25th. It took a lot of effort to do this. Many people would have been searching without it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location”
Reviews.Author: T2Y
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location on International Drive which is close to Sea World and Universal. Breakfast is good and the rooms are a good value. Two factors kept the hotel from being a five out of five. The first night the room was cleaned but not re-stocked (no face clothes, two towels when we had indicated four people where staying) - new ones were requested but they were delivered hours later. The next day the room was not cleaned at all when we got back at 5 pm. When we left for dinner we requested that the room be cleaned - when we returned the beds were made but to say it was cleaned was a stretch. The next day I left a tip and we had a room that was actually cleaned and we had extra towels. Lesson learned - tip if you want your room cleaned. The second annoyance was the Hilton's preferred car service. The black sedans are always out front and the staff even had the nerve to say we should wait inside for their cab because other companies will rip you off. Their company is the one doing the ripping off. All numbers are before tip - i) Airport to hotel with 3rd party cab $36 - hotel to airport with Hilton's service $42, ii) SeaWorld $14 with Hilton's recommended service - return with a regular cab was $7.70 one time and $9.35 on our visit from Discovery Cove, iii) Universal $14, return with a regular cab $10.05. We also went to Animal Kingdom and we had a driver named George - he was terrible. In addition to not paying attention while driving, he overcharged us ($45 there, $36 back with a regular cab) while he ironically told us what a rip off Disney was - don't bite the hand that feeds you - especially when you have two young customers in the back making their first trip to Disney. Stay in the hotel but rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, great value got money!”
Reviews.Author: ToptravellerLondon
Reviews.Content: I'm glad we made the choice to stay at Homewood Suites. My wife and I were sceptical given the price and all that came with it, surely there was a catch somewhere? The answer was no, the hotel was clean throughout, the room (suite) was spacious with a fridge, microwave and cooker as detailed! The complementary breakfast and managers reception was a nice touch, bagel, sausage, eggs, waffles, juice/soda and cereal that was as good a standard as any breakfast buffet diner on i-drive. The staff were all friendly and helpful. There is also a shuttle bus which takes you to the theme parks. If you're going to orlando for theme parks/shopping then this hotel is ideal for couples and families.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: AC213615
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not the easiest to find. Although centrally located on I Drive, it is hidden behind a Denny's parking lot. We had taxis get lost on two different occasions trying to reach us. Other than that, it was a great stay. Rooms are immaculate and nicely equipped. The breakfast is adequate. It is very crowded, but staff does their best to replenish. The evening manager's reception varied from tasty to mediocre, but I don't really factor that into my rating since most hotels in this price range do not even offer an evening reception. The front desk staff, particularly Angelica and Tatiana were phenomenal. They did everything possible to make our stay enjoyable. If you see a special rate on this hotel, grab it! It is about 10-15 minutes to all of the theme parks, and a great comfortable value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: teejaii k
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. Welcoming environment. Excellent rooms. Beautiful breakfast. Couldn't have asked for more for my money! I will be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Homewood Suites our second stay”
Reviews.Author: apogee68
Reviews.Content: First stayed at this hotel in march 2008 and vowed to return. Once again we had a trouble free stay. Have to say its the staff who made it such an enjoyable holiday. Room was always clean and tidy....the maids do a great job. Transport to attractions seemed as good as last time we stayed. Free beer mon-thurs was a big plus and we were well looked after by our Russian friend. The only negative is the hotel decor now appears a little dated....so please update to match the staffs superb service. Will stay here again if we ever return to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: domingos_soares
Reviews.Content: Last month I've spent 20 days in this hotel with my wife and six years old daughter (room 536). Wonderful staff!! Very friendly and always willing to help, both at the front desk and adjacent restaurant as housekeeping. The room was well furnished and very spacious. It was also clean (no bad smell, no bugs and no stains) but it could be even cleaner. There was dust bellow the bed lamp and we found dirty socks lying behind the cabinet drawers, probably left there by some old guest. So on this matter there's still room for improvements but I'm pretty sure the hotel still deserves five stars. The parking lot is clean, spacious and the squirrels are a show by themselves. The food was good, both at the breakfast and dinner, but it would no hurt if they extend the serving time. The Wi-Fi Internet was working wonderfully and very fast (that really surprised me as most hotels lacks good Internet access). I WILL definitely stay there again. As a side note, the hotel was very crowded during the Holidays but the staff could keep the quality of the service all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Robson D Posted by a Despegar traveler
Reviews.Content: We were travelling with family - 8 people in total - 2 children, and after reading all the comments here decided to choose this hotel. When arrived there, felt really happy. Pros: 1- Hotel is well located, surrounded by restaurants, pharmacy, and of course, near the outlets 2- Arrived early, and Miss Nancy from the reception desk made us feel really comfortable with her friendly attitude, showing the things to do around, information about the city, parks, and even speaking a little of brazilian portuguese. 3- For people travelling with family, it is a must. There is a small kitchen, fridge, microwave where you can cook small things or even warm up milk for your baby. 4- There is a swimming pool and a bath, but we didn't use. There are better things to do in Orlando other than staying in a swimming pool in the hotel :-) 5- Breakfast is ok for the american standards, but after 4 days started to get tired of the same things and decided to buy stuff in walmart. Cons: 1- If you wanna do online shopping, they will charge $10 per package 2- As I stated previously, breakfast is ok, but could be better (more variety) 3- They just offer packages to universal, seaworld and busch gardens. Everything related to disney you have to look for other companies. Bottom line: Would go back there for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Tiramisu66
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel in a great location. The suites were very clean but quite dark and dated, the fridge was very noisy for the person sleeping in the kitchen area. Very comfortable bed in the bedroom but the sofa bed is not suitable for an adult to sleep on. Good to hear that they are due for modernization in 2012.The free buffet breakfast every morning was great with plenty of food, and the free evening meal if you are back in time was also great. Free transfers to the parks were a huge bonus. Laundry room was also a great but hard to get a washing machine and dryer as people left their laundry in the machines when their wash/dry was done. Very helpful reception staff. Would definitely stay there again due to the great location and facilities offered at the suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bertha55
Reviews.Content: Pro's: two room suites with two flat screens, full refrigerator, stove, and microwave. Also sleeper sofa. Lots of restaurants and shopping within walking distance. I Ride trolley within walking distance. Free full hot breakfast daily and evening meal with free drinks Mon - Thurs. You can find enough to do in the area to have a great trip even if you don't have a car. Con's: could use some updating. If you are not traveling with kids you will still see a lot of kids in this family friendly hotel. (not really a con) Second time staying here and would come again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice, Inexpensive, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Missesval
Reviews.Content: The suites are compact, but since you're seldom there what does it matter? Full kitchen to heat up leftovers or make popcorn, two large screen TVs, nice King bed quite comfortable, pull-out sofa bed for one large or two small kids only, clean and fresh. Pool and hot tub are just what you need after the trek through Disney. Hot breakfast has enough to satisfy. Internet available as well as a few video games. Transportation to and from Disney worked perfectly. We didn't have to fight the traffic or pay to park. They took us at 8:AM and we caught it to come back at 8:30 PM which was a long enough time for us. I did like being outside the park with this hotel because of the shopping and eateries near-by. Also, we did the trip, including Air from Ohio, Rental Car, Hotel 5 Nights, 3 Day Tickets to Disney for four and food for $2000. To do it with a hotel in the Park would have nearly doubled the rate. Best time to go is when the kids are in school. Take them out, it's Educational! And Enjoy the time of your life.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: WestmeathPat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on honeymoon last September and it really is a great hotel. Its very convenient for I Drive attractions and is 5 minutes walk from TGI's, Millers Bar. Domino's Pizza and more. There is plenty of parking if you decide to rent a car, but if, like us, you don't want to drive on holiday, there are free shuttles to Universal and Disney every morning (you must tell reception and the Universal desk in advance). There is also a corner shop 50 yards from the hotel and an official Orlando tourist information centre beside it. Our room was serviced every day, and the A/C was great. Breakfast was always good, but it can take a few days to see exactly what's on offer because there is so much. The Manager's reception is great for families as eating in the parks is not cheap, so free dinner 4 evenings a week is a pretty good offer. The hotel is situated in the middle of the busy North-South International Drive axis, and this is exactly where you want to be.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving in the Parks”
Reviews.Author: chtddrzy
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Conveniently located to Universal and a short drive to Disney. Easy walk to stores and attractions on International Drive. Breakfast was great as well as the dinner buffet Monday through Thursday. Room was clean and spacious. Housekeeping was very accommodating to time needs. Overall the hotel was great. Would definitely stay again. And Wonder Works, a great little science museum, is a short walk, right down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: bucketandspade73
Reviews.Content: This hotel represented an excellent value for money. The services were excellent and staff could not do enough for you. The rooms were kept clean always and full of the necessary amenities that made our stay a home away from home i.e dishwasher, microwave, iron and board, cooker, fridgefreezer,tv and AC. There was also complimentary shuttle to both universal and disney. I-ride bus stop just few metres away from the hotel likewise shops and restaurants. Complimentary buffet breakfast and managers evening reception removed the need to spend a lot on dinning out. My family and I had a memorable stay and this hotel will be our first choice when next we visit Orlando. A very big thank you to the management team.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay, but...........”
Reviews.Author: Marion
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to the Homewood Suites for many many years and always had a great holiday. I would say this time that the hotel is in need of updating. Still had a geat holiday but several things like the sofa bed, even just sitting on it you sink right down. Cannot imagine what it would be like to sleep on it. The rooms could be doing with brightening up. The curtains and the furniture are quite dark. The pool towels are now thread bare! A couple of times newer ones appeared but most of the time it was the really old ones. The staff are still very pleasant and Mario is always there to greet you at breakfast time. Elita and her team put on a lovely Thanksgiving dinner when we were there - very enjoyable. We will return to the Homewood as its still good value for money and in a great location for many restaurants. Ate several times at Millers Ale House. It can be busy and a bit noisy but food is good and the beer is cheap!

Reviews.Title: “A trip to sea world”
Reviews.Author: scootert2
Reviews.Content: Was able to get a room at the homewood suites,and what a nice place to stay,the staff was so very helpful getting us a room,and that they were able to check us in early.The rooms were clean,comfort,and lots of space,in the suit.And what agreat breakfast they served,eggs,sauage,wafles,just if you went next door to Dennys,So next time you in Orlando, I would recommend that you Book a stay at Homewood Suits you will not be disapointed, 12/5/11 Great Job To The Staff

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for my family”
Reviews.Author: katiej122
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Homewood Suites after leaving WDW resort in order to visit Sea World and Universal. We stayed three nights and it was a good choice. It was right down the road from both SW and Universal and there were many restaurants within walking distance. The free breakfast was great and the dining room was large enough to accommodate everyone. After being in one room at WDW, we liked that the couch folded out into a bed for our kids and they were in a separate room. The bed was extremely comfortable and everything was very clean. The only downside was that the interior hallways were dark and the elevator was slow and loud. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find - but so great”
Reviews.Author: tigtink
Reviews.Content: OK - let me start by saying we are from NY state (not city). We are using GPS and can't find the hotel - LOL - this would be us. Call the hotel and find out it is behind the Bahama Breeze Restaurant - so now we know where we are again. Other than that - this is a great stay. 1) STAFF ARE PHENOMENAL!! Upon check in on Thanksgiving they tell us we have a complete Thanksgiving dinner available to us for FREE!!!!! OK - maybe not mom's but then again who really is other than mom? For the price (did I mention free??) we got turkey, ham, mashed potatoes, green beans, stuffing, gravy, rolls, tossed salad, beer, wine, soft drinks, coffee, hot cocoa - anyone who would complain deserves to starve. Again - staff so gracious and welcoming while working on a holiday instead of being with their own families. 2) room - 2 bedroom (1king and 2 doubles) with two bathrooms. Living area kind of small but adequate for us. Very clean, nicely appointed with microwave, 2 burner electric stove, toaster, coffee pot, (no oven) and plenty of dishes for 6. Now you would not be making your own thanksgiving dinner in the room - but why would you when they offered it downstairs for free? Beds were comfy and the only oddity in our room was that the controler for the air conditioner was behind the door in the master bedroom - took us a while to find that - kind of like a search and rescue adventure though. Other than that great room really. Not huge - so if you were staying in this room with 6 people - you might have to kill one or two of them off - just kidding. 3) did I mention the staff was EXCELLENT?? 4) we went to the pool after eating - no mom we did not wait an hour - hubby and I sat in hot tub while grandson made some new friends in the pool - nice area - the jets in the hot tub aren't too invigorating - but I was in Florida in nice hot water with bubbles and hunny - life was looking pretty good to me. No complaints whatsoever 5) well they say in real estate - location, location, location - had we been up to it and not so lazy after eating - you could walk to a great number of other restaurants and shops - but we did not do this Suggestions - 1) better signage off from International Drive for us directionally challenged - or put it somehow on all reservation sites that you are behind the Bahama Breeze Restaurant (IN BIG LETTERS SO WE DON"T MISS THAT TOO) 2) provide directions on where to find the thermostat - although it was fun searching for it 3) room #331 very nice - but no 'view' 4) Give all staff a huge Christmas bonus - they were so very nice

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff-Ready for Updating”
Reviews.Author: CoasterWarrior
Reviews.Content: During a week long stay for a convention in Orlando, we again picked this Homewood Suites. The staff at this hotel are among the best I have ever encountered. They are friendly, professional, and the manager is absolutely dedicated to patron satisfaction. Like most all Homewood Suites, the rooms are roomy and well-equipped with a fridge, stove, microwave and 2 TV's. My family joined me during my stay, and we were quite comfortable with 2 doubles and a queen pullout. The location is very convenient to Point Orlando and many other restaurants on South I-Drive. Parking is free, breakfast is good and free, and there are numerous elevators and exits making getting in and out very convenient. The rooms are in need of updating, and the manager tells me that the owners will be doing this next year. Like most Orlando and I-Drive hotels, the rooms get a lot of wear and show it. Even so, my room was kept clean and every need was attended to. When these rooms get freshened up a bit, this will be a premium hotel for this area. At $119/night (convention rate), the value was solid. The staff's professionalism and service made up for some small faults. Assuming a room redo, we will be here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Homewood Suites Orlando, Nov 15-18, 2011”
Reviews.Author: paulartt
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth or fifth consecutive year that our company reserved at least four rooms for our business trip for an annual trade show at the convention center. We were there for five nights and once again, they met our exceeded our expectations. You can be sure that we will come back next year as well! The staff is outstanding and the combination of pricing, location, and amenities can't be beat. You are a short walk to all of the great places to eat off of International Drive and just a 10 minute drive to Disney, Seaworld or Universal. Assistant General Manager Mario Magana and other members of the staff greet you each morning in the breakfast area with a smile on their face and are always asking you if there is anything you need or anything that they can do for you. We would recommend this property to our friends and everyone else that asked about a great place to stay in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Tacky”
Reviews.Author: JayDive
Reviews.Content: First off we stayed here because of Tripadvisor. I stayed Nov. 1-5 in ground floor room 144. Would not set in old living room furniture without putting a towel down. The cushions were so flat that you felt the wood frame. Bedroom mattress was no better. The bat tubs were so short, I could only get half my body underwater. The maids service was very good. Breakfast in the morning was the worst, reconstituted eggs, watered down juices then the lite meal in the evening was a cold hotdog with terrible wine or beer. I was in Orlando for business and their business center was under repair another worst for this place. On Saturday morning the elevators where down and my other business partner had to walk down 4 sets of stair with suitcases, checking out. This place is hard to find because it is not on any roads, located behind a big restaurant and behind another hotel, so you have to drive through these properties to get to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Convention Centre”
Reviews.Author: Howardp
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 104 - ground floor. Excellent value, the suite comprised a lounge area with pull out sofa/bed (unused by us) and a small kitchen area with microwave and fridge, the bedroom had a huge double bed and the lead into the bathroom had a washbasin mirror etc (just bath with excellent shower and toilet in the bathroom). Loads of space and comfortable, 2 TVs. The suites offered free wine and beer between 5 and 7 pm for 4 days of the week and a breakfast each day which was a little disappointing, not a lot of variety, hence the rating is only 4 and not 5. Very convenient for the convention centre and other eating places on Int'l Drive. Would happily stay there agaimn

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pampenny
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Oct with my husband and two girls aged 11 and 8. This was our first trip to Orlando and we booked here after much research and review of TA reviews! Right from check in the staff were only too happy to oblige. Nothing was too much trouble. We had a one bed suite with pull out sofa bed, the sofa bed being fine for little ones, but I think for older children its not ideal. The room was clean and was very well equipped. Maid service was faultless. I felt very safe at the Homewood Suites. The location of the hotel is brilliant with a number of restaurants in walking distance. We tried Bahama Breeze (husband loved it, me not so much), Dennys, TGI Fridays, Millers Ale House and Olive Garden which we all loved, to name but a few. The breakfast was great and the novelty of making your own waffles was a big plus for the girls. We never had the evening meal but it looked perfectly good, with wine and beer and soft drinks, you couldn't ask for any more. The pool while shaded was great to jump into after a long day at the parks. They provide towels so you don't have to bring your own. Also, there is a large car park with plenty of available spaces. I can only say that I would highly recommend the Homewood Suites, it was a great place to come back to at the end of a happy but very tiring day!

Reviews.Title: “great accomodation in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: avalon100
Reviews.Content: We stayed their as a family (2 adults and teenage daughter) in October 2011...we booked this hotel on the strength of the positive reviews from trip advisor and these reviews proved to be spot on..any negative comments on here can only be one off,s as everybody during our stay were as impressed as us....easily the friendliest,most helpful staff i have ever encountered at any hotel....when we arrived our travel agent had messed up our booking and the room had been cancelled (this was a sunday evening so could not call anybody)...but the hotel staff said dont worry and put us in a room for the night and said pop down after breakfast...which i did to find that they had called round and sorted it all out!!....i would definately stay at this hotel again if i was planning to visit the theme parks and shopping malls as this hotels shuttles and closeness to iride and lynx buses is perfect (we used all these..very easy to use and there is a tourist info close by),and the restaurants and bars locally are the best on idrive...the free breakfast we thought was great and set us up for the day....if you are expecting a 5 star hotel at budget price then this is not for you,but if you want a very comfortble base with the most welcoming,friendly staff you can imagine then this is for you...i would like to thank all the staff for helping to make our holiday excellent....

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: AnnieDos
Reviews.Content: The ground floor rooms on one side of the property have a very musty smell. Luis moved us to other side and rooms were fine. Stayed at property for six nights and our bed was never changed. We did refuse maid service the first two days. We will stay at property on future trips to area. Evening treats are fair to good. Price of room reasonable considering location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Dunni17
Reviews.Content: Myself, my wife and 2 sons aged 6 & 8 stayed at the Homewood Suites for 16 nights in October 2011. The first thing to say is that the staff are exceptional, really friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the free breakfast which was laid on every morning, there was plenty to choose from, cereals, toast, fruit, yogurt, sausages, eggs and waffles which were very fresh as the guests make them themselves. The waffles were very popular with the children staying at the hotel! There is fruit juice, tea, coffee and hot chocolate at breakfast and there is also free tea and coffee available 24 hours a day. The hotel suites are cleaned daily and every evening we would come back to our room to find our kids' teddies all neatly lined up on the bed, the kids loved this, we thought it was pretty cool too! We had a one bedroom suite with a sofa bed in the living room which was perfectly adequate for our boys (they never complained that they were uncomfortable), they were so tired from the parks that they just got into the bed and went straight to sleep (they very rarely do this at home)! The suites are fully equipped with a toaster, hairdryer, coffee maker, microwave, dishwasher and large fridge freezer, you may need to take a kettle if you think you would need one (we took a kettle but didnt use it as there was always tea, coffee and hot water available). We didnt get a chance to sample any of the manager's free evening meals which are served Monday to Thursday 5pm-7pm as we never returned to the hotel early enough. The location of this hotel is perfect, in a very nice spot just off International Drive, at the Seaworld end. It is in a very quiet position which is nice after all the mayhem of the parks etc! There are various shops and restaurants within walking distance, there is also a Walgreens store approximately a five minute walk away from the hotel. We only used the pool and spa a few times but it was very good, the hotel supplies towels to dry off with and although the pool doesn't get much sun at all, this was not a problem for us, as it was still warm. There is a laundry on the 5th floor which we used twice, you can purchase soap powder from the hotel shop for $1.60 or just take some with you. It is 2 dollars (8 x 1 quarter coins) to use the washers and the same for the dryers. These machines cleaned our clothes perfectly well. To sum up, this hotel was perfect for my family's needs and excellent value for money with superb staff. When we checked out, our 8 year old son was in tears as we were leaving. Angelica, one of the lovely receptionists, gave him a gift (the Homewood Suites Rubber Duck Family) which was a lovely gesture. We are already planning our next holiday to Orlando and would only stay in this hotel on International Drive, we cannot rate it highly enough. Thankyou to all the great staff, you made our holiday extra special.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel on a budget”
Reviews.Author: aboyer8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business convention. It was reasonably priced and close to the convention center. It is also close to lots of food and shops as well as Universal Studios. Disney and Sea World are not too far of a drive. Being half way between the sirport and Disney make it an ideal location. The hotel itself is nice. The lobby has a very nice dining area where they serve a hot breakfast each morning and offer a happy hour each evening with drinks and a few light snacks. There is a Univeral Studios counter where you can get all the park information, tickets, and catch the bus to the park. There is only 1 elevator that goes up the right side of the building. This made getting up and down frustrating b/c it could take forever to catch the elevator, and if it was full, you either woulf have to wait or take the stairs. I chose to take the stairs any time I wasn't carrying luggage. The pool looked nice. However, I did not get the time to actually use it. Parking was free. So if you plan on hitting all the parks, I would just rent a car. A tax ride round trip to the airport or to Disney will run around $100. We were able to get a basic, no thrills rental car for $86 for the week when we got down there. The room was fine for what we paid for. It had a small kitchen and living area with a eat in table for 4 people. The master bedroom was very large with a king bed. The bathroom was your standard hotel bathroom. I had agreed to sleep on the sofa bed and gave my coworker the bed. However, after pulling out the sofa bed, I opted to share the king bed with her. The sofa bed had a very small mattress the was dirty. I could not, even after putting fresh sheets on, bring myself to sleep in it. It ended up not being a huge issue since a king bed was more than enough room for 2 people. But for a family of 3 or more who plan on using the sofa bed, this might be an issue. Over all, this is a decent hotel for the price. Just don't have too high of expectations just because of where you are.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay during your Orlando Vacation”
Reviews.Author: MichaelCLimerick
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in late July. A very good place to base yourself for your vacation. Rooms are spacious and clean. Free breakfast provided and the room rates are good. Staff are very friendly and most helpful when have a question. Close to all the lovely restaurants on I drive. Overall would go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Another fantastic stay at the homewood”
Reviews.Author: biggazz
Reviews.Content: Our September stay just confirmed that this hotel is perfect for me and my family. We are non drivers who spend very little time actually in the hotel but this place is the only one that suites all our needs. Efficient bus service to all parks Free Wi-Fi Breakfast and Weekday managers reception Free newspapers Clean rooms and comfortable beds. Prime location for all of our favorite restaurants. HDTVs Because of our holiday habits we spent many years booking lower end I-Drive hotels and ended up paying extra for most of the above facilities, thank the lord we have finally realised that this was false economy. A first on this trip was that couple of nights we didnt even at out due to the quality of the managers reception, another couple of hundred dollars to spend at the Yankee Candle outlet :) Many thanks to all at the Homewood, will be booing again as soon as my financial advisor(wife) allows it.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT family vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: Brandy L
Reviews.Content: Rooms are great and spacious!! Full kitchen and great pool facilities!! They serve free hot breakfast and dinner and room rates were fair!! Hotel staff was friendly and accomadating!!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay!”
Reviews.Author: happywhentravellingD
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very homely, very close to everything there is to do in orlando and a great place for extended stay. Everything that was needed to be done was within a ten minute bus ride. The iRide is very cheap, useful and convenient. All the parks are very close and the hotel offers free shuttles to all. The staff is very friendly and the rooms are very comfortable. The ac and fans are loud.. but so what? There was so much to be done that I did not even use the pool, the view was good though. The best part of all to me was that there was shopping within ten mins away! Great place and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good accomodation, very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Donna J
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Homewood suites for 7 nights. At first we thought it was slightly dated, but the hospitality more than made up for it. All rooms were clean with maid service daily. We had a one bedroom suite with sofa bed in the lounge area. Main bed was super king size and very comfortable. I would only recommend the sofabed for kids due to size, and the fridge was quite noisy so kept the kids awake for the first night until they got used to it and then wasn't a problem. Complimentary breakfast was good as well as the evening meal Mon-Thurs. All staff very helpful and accomodating. Close to all theme parks and i-ride trolley. Lots of restaurants on I-Drive. Great base for visiting Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base on International Drive”
Reviews.Author: GazzaTrip
Reviews.Content: Homewood suites is an ideal base on International Drive. Position is excellent with a wide variety of restaurants and shops in walking distance. Courtesy transport to all major Orlando Theme Parks was excellent, with choice of times for both return and departure to most. Easy access to both the red and green IRide trolley routes. Complimentary breakfast with a decent choice of food and beverage. Suites are well equipped with large fridge/freezer, cooking rings, microwave, toaster and dishwasher. Decent sized lounge/ kitchen area and large bedroom. Overall highly recommend this as a base for Orlando Theme Parks.

Reviews.Title: “Suited to our needs well.”
Reviews.Author: jennifer w
Reviews.Content: First appearances - a bit grotty, but as we got used to it and settled in we found it very suitable to our needs but we did spend most days out and about. Breakfast was a bit hetic but the quantity and variety of food was good. Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms were dated and in need of refurbishment but they were clean. Very well situated, near the parks and within walking distance of very good restaurants. The pull out bed was VERY uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A few glitches, but a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: TracyTraveler
Reviews.Content: The room was large, with a small table for dining/computer work and a separate bedroom. The toilet and tub were in one room with the sink and closet in a separate space off the bedroom, making it convenient for one person to dress and get ready while the other was in the shower. The kitchenette was reasonably equipped, but some dish soap and dish towels would have been great instead of running the dishwasher for 3 utensils, 1 dish and 2 glasses - as our maid did each day. I would have been happy to wash the dishes I used by hand as I went or to run them all in the dishwasher at the end of my stay. The glitches - the WiFi went out for a day, which was a bit inconvenient. The maid put queen sized fitted sheets on our king bed for the first 3 nights until I asked the manager about this odd practice. We got king sheets on the last night of our stay. We were near the housekeeping station/employee entrance to the hotel and it was quite noisy. Our room was also at the end of the hall and was relatively dark since the windows looked out into the passage to the pool. I'd simply ask for a different room next time (don't get Room 117!) Despite all of this, the bed was comfortable, the breakfast was really nice the location is good (we could walk to lots of restaurants!) and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money on Idrive”
Reviews.Author: hf8979
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood suites for 2 weeks recently. The location is great, near the more up market North end of Idrive, its 2 minutes from a 24 hour Walgreens and wonderworks and only a further 5 minutes to the Pointe Orlando complex. Bahama Breeze is lovely! But there is also lots of other places to eat out within walking distance, as well as Dave and Busters opposite. Helicopter tours are next to Dave and Busters, itâ€™s a must do! The staff are all really friendly and can't do enough for you. The hotel and rooms are a little dated, but compared to other hotels the rooms are so spacious, and it is such a bonus to have a kitchen and lounge area. The only thing we can criticise is the lack of an oven which we would have found extremely useful. The maids were in every day without fail, we felt the hotel in general was very clean. The food wasn't to our taste and there wasn't much choice. That said, the 'welcome home' meals on Mon-Fri were free, so you canâ€™t complain! There was also no resort fee to pay as I have heard with some other hotels on the Idrive which was another bonus. The only thing that really disappointed us about the hotel was the times for the Disney shuttle bus to the parks. The main reason we booked this hotel was because it offered shuttles to both universal and Disney - which was great as most hotels only offer either. The Disney bus left at either 8am or 10.30am (which was good) but didnâ€™t pick up from Epcot until 9.45pm or 10.30pm which we thought was just too long a day (unless you want to see the fireworks one night). So we got the shuttle bus there and made our way back using the Lynx buses. We ended up buying the unlimited 14day tickets and used the buses a lot. DO NOT use the Iride trolley, it takes forever and you are packed in like sardines!! Lynx bus drivers are really helpful, and you are not restricted to just the Idrive - we used Lynx to go to outlets, Publix, Downtown Disney, Disney parks, Sea World, Wet and wild etc. We had a fab time at the Homewood, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “good for its price”
Reviews.Author: mvhmz
Reviews.Content: I have just recently returned from a holiday in Orlando and stayed at this hotel. what can i say from the minute we arrived the staff were extremely helpful. we were given a room close to the lift as my father is disabled and they helped us out with directions and everything we needed. The breakfasts are plentiful but a bit repetitive. eggs everyday is a bit too much but the great thing is they have fruit ,cereals and much more all of which you can take back to your own room. Also Mon-Thurs they give free food which is great if you eat everything....veggies be aware the salad is a bit crap but its free so no complaints. the room itself is big and well thought out but the sofa bed is bad!!!!! do not rely on this at all.....the bed covers are as bit old and tatty and when i left i had a rash on my legs...was it because of the bed or something else i am not sure.....the A/C did break on the last day and they were really helpful and tried to sort it out asap. overall the hotel is average but the staff amazing ps the location is amazing toooo!!

Reviews.Title: “Have just enjoyed an excellent stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: alison k
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home on the 14th oct after a two week stay in this hotel. The whole experience was excellent. The staff at reception and in the restaurant were very efficient and friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The bedroom had a very comfy large bed with tv and a second room with fold out double bed/settee, tv and a small kitchen area which had everything we needed, also an ensuite bathroom. Everything was very comfortable and clean. We had the complimentary breakfast every morning, a lot of the food was the same each day, but as there was a choice of cereal, waffle, bagels, muffins cakes, fruit and cooked breakfast (and more i havent mentioned) there was no need to eat the same things two days running, so found it was more than enough choice for us, This also saved time and the expense of paying for a breakfast, which we have done when we previously stayed in a different hotel, so by saving you time, it gives you more time for the parks etc. The hotel location is excellent, within walking distance to lots of restaurants and shops, but not on the part of international drive where it is very busy. The hotel lays back from the road and was very quiet and also we found that although the hotel seemed to have quite a lot of people staying, we never heard a lot of noise in our room. The complimentary light meal mon - thurs from 5 - 7pm was useful, we didnt use it every day, but did on the days that we had eaten a lot during the day and wasnt very hungry. They also served cold beer and wine and the beer went down very well, when we came in on a hot day. The WiFi was free and easy to use, also we had a free safe in the room. I would totally recommend this hotel and we hope to have a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, kitchen inside your room and good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Guilherme37
Reviews.Content: Pro: - Location near all parks (no more then 15km). - Good breakfast (need more fruits) - Kitchen inside the room, good for kids. - Free internet - Free parking. Con: - Few elevators for floor. Picture from my room: http://photosynth.net/view.aspx?cid=4731ca8b-a41a-46bd-8e79-7fff9b722f49

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: laurmel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 12 nights in September and thoroughly enjoyed the place. The hotel is down a road, off of IDrive and is in a quiet setting .The car park is huge and was never more than half full during our stay. The suite we were given was comfortable, rather than spacious, but it contained all the facilities one could expect, including a free in room safe facility which is not often the case at other hotels. The staff were very efficient and the room was kept clean throughout our stay. Reception staff were friendly and efficient and any problems that we raised (we had a malfunctioning toilet on one occasion) were dealt with promptly, which is all you can ask for. The complimentary (?) breakfast was fine, and I do not think that anyone could really complain about the choice, although the coffee we made from the in room coffee maker was better than that in the restaurant.They also have an afternoon complimentary "reception" four times a week but we did not partake of that. Needless to say there are many restaurants within a short distance of the hotel, either walking or driving. All in all therefore we had a really nice stay. Oh! the heading. One thing whch did occur to us was that the decor and furniture of the suite we were staying in did appear tired and could do with a bit of modernisation. The lifts were also rather on the slow side. These are observations rather than criticisms and did not ,in any way, affect our enjoyment of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location with complimentary shuttle to Epcot”
Reviews.Author: TravelingSolo
Reviews.Content: I stayed seven nights from September 21 to 28. Although there to attend a conference, I took a couple of extra days to visit Disney parks. I rented a car but really didn't need to. Parking at the hotel is complimentary and ample while parking at Disney is $14.00 a day. The shuttle to Epcot left promptly at 8:00 am each morning and only stopped at the Residence Inn across I-Drive before heading directly to Disney. A later shuttle to Epcot left at 10:00 am daily. Return shuttles left from Epcot at 9:45 pm and 10:30 pm so there is plenty of time to take in the fireworks at Epcot or Fantasmic at Hollywood Studios. For those who want to get back earlier, Lynx buses leave from Downtown Disney and the Disney transportation center. A Lynx schedule is available at www.golynx.com. I found the hotel to be very clean and welcoming. My room was on the fifth floor facing the pool. Noise was not an issue; however, at one point, one of the two elevators was out of order, so the wait on the fifth floor was a little long. As an alternative, I took the stairs down to breakfast and rode the elevator back up to my room thus eliminating the wait. Stairwells were clean and well lit. The bed was very comfortable; but, the hide-a-bed in the living room did not appear to be a comfortable place to sleep. The air conditioning worked well and there was a ceiling fan in my bedroom. The complimentary WiFi was easy to log onto and worked great. I went to breakfast each morning at 7:00 am and at that time I never found it to be crowded. There were eggs and sausage available every morning; however, on a couple of days waffles were not available. There were bagels, cold cereal, fruit, and a choice between oatmeal or grits every day. On a couple of days, bisquits and gravy were available and on the other days potatoes were offered. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance and the night life on I-Drive is great. I found this to be a distinct advantage to staying at a Disney property. There is a Subway close by which I appreciated after returning late from the parks. There is also a Walgreen's within a couple of blocks which is open late and sells very reasonably priced beer and wine. So not to worry if you miss the evening reception at the hotel and don't feel like going out for a beer after a long day at the parks. You can have pizza delivered to your room. I also used the automatic icemaker in the refrigerator in my room. I will definitely consider returning to this property for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: SeekerOfTheSun
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel based mostly on TripAdvisor reviews. It was the perfect choice for us. We were in Orlando from Sept. 12th through the 18th for the AAFP Scientific Assembly at the convention center. Our room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The breakfast and the light dinner and drinks (Mon.-Thurs.) were quite good and very convenient. The pool area is shady most of the day (except from around noon to 3pm) but the Hampton next door has exchange privileges if you want more sun. There are many restaurant and shopping opportunities within easy walking distance. If you want to venture further out, the iTrolley has stops on the street right out in front of the hotel. Homewood also provides free daily shuttles to Universal and Disney. (Just sign up at the front desk area) If I ever plan another trip back to this area...this will definitely be the hotel I choose!

Reviews.Title: “Great Suites!”
Reviews.Author: Sor_Family
Reviews.Content: An ideal location, mins to all major attractions in orlando. Very friendly front desk, helpful tour agent, Kimi who can help u with all tour queries. Good breakfast with friendly staff. Suite is excellent with great bed, separate living room. Ideal for family!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base for the non car traveller”
Reviews.Author: RayandSally
Reviews.Content: Great location amongst some good restaurants and near the i-Ride. Bahama breeze just around the corner was superb (and if you're a vegetarian your best option!! (lighter bites)). Room was large and the most comfy bed ever (we wanted to bring it home, missing it big time !). Bonus having a little kitchenette/living room. Never tried the pool but it looked fine and seemed popular. Breakfast is a bit of freeforall but plentiful, would recommend that you try to get to breakfast before 8.30 otherwise its like a zoo and you may not get a table. Don't try to leave your food outside near the pool as the resident squirrels is a connoisseur of cornflakes ;). Receptionists are helpful but the Universal ladies are a little scary (as you need to ask them for the bus tickets to Universal parks). Complimentary buses to all the parks (even Busch if you stand by the Crab Shack 1/4 mile up IDrive) are included but the return times are early and you will most likely miss the fireworks at Disney. (we took a taxi one night back from the TTC to catch them, and it cost $26). Complimentary food and drinks between 5&7pm Mon-Thurs if you're about (we were always out). Rooms were always clean and tidy and the house keeping staff should be complimented. Good value for money !

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - Great location - near universal studios”
Reviews.Author: MaryfromIreland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my three children (aged 14, 10 and 8) in June for 17 days, and it was a brilliant hotel, the location was fantastic, we were on a 'theme park' holiday for the duration of the holiday, which I know was a bit mad, as 17 days in theme parks would not be every one's cup of tea, but I had promised the kids, and it was a brilliant holiday, if a little mad! the hotel itself was a brilliant choice, a friend of mine had stayed there previously and recommended it, and I always read (and trust) the previous reviews on trip-advisor, which were all good, so I book the hotel quite happily, and I was glad I did. The location itself is perfect, located quite close to universal studios, and wet n'wild water park (which was my kids favourite water park, they weren't gone on the other water park (aquatica) at all for some reason. This hotel had free transport each day to all the universal studios parks, (they had an actual seperate universal desk opposite reception!) which was very well run, I had bought my theme park tickets before I went, after extensive research I went for the flex ticket, as this gave 14 days unlimited access to five different theme parks, Islands of Adventure, Universal Studios, sea world, wet n' wild, Aquatica, and it worked out at $ 1029.81 (www.undercovertourist.com) Approx â‚¬750 (approx 188 per person, â‚¬13.50 each per day!) and I got actual proper tickets, not vouchers, which I wouldn't have trusted at all, anyway having the tickets prepaid and with me when I arrived was brilliant, and it was one less expense whilst there too, the hotel also provided free transport to Disney, which you booked a day ahead through reception itself, the only downside I found was that whilst the free transfers to the various parks was brilliant, their return times were way too early, something like 5 p.m., there was no way my guys were ready to leave the parks at that time, so I came around that by buying a ihop pass for the two weeks, which I purchased at the walgreen store alongside the hotel, and it was very cheap, I think about 15 dollars or something like that, and that covered us in the evenings to get back and the ihop stops everywhere on international drive, so it was handy the days we went shopping as well, and you only pay for adults, not children. Back to the hotel, I booked through an internet site rather than directly with the hotel itself, as their rates were ridiculously expensive I thought, compared to the internet site I used, and I booked a one bedroom suite, and asked that two double beds be in the room, instead of the king size, and there was a double couch bed in the sitting room, which my 14 year old son slept on and he had no problems with it, said it was fine and comfortable. The kitchen/living area was spotlessly clean and well organised, I felt it was a bit small on space, but thats probably because I am used to a 3 bedroom house usually on holidays, and suddenly finding us all in the one hotel room was a bit of a squash, but the room itself was lovely, there was a full size fridge, a cooker, a kettle/coffee maker, the bathroom was lovely and spacious, with the shower inside the bath, plenty of towels and lovely neutrogena shampoo/conditioners/soaps etc., and the bedroom had lots of storage space, there was a chest of drawers both in the living room and the bedroom, and the wardrobe was a normal hotel size, we were able to comfortably unpack all our belongings without a problem. The hotel provided breakfast, which was a self-service effort, and there was always loads of food, it got a bit crowded the later in the day you came down, but hey the hotel was busy, we never had a problem getting a table and there was always loads of fresh food on offer, various cereals, every morning they had scrambled egg, which to be honest gets a bit monotonous after 17 days! they also had some kind of cubed potato thing, which maybe the americans favour, but we weren't gone on it, and they had burger type sausages, again I think an american thing, they had fabulous bagels and sourdough bread things, which were gorgeous toasted, and my kids absolutely loved the idea of making your own waffles for breakfast, they became dab hands at it by the end of the first week! the toppings for same were mad though, syrup and chocolate, and various sprinkles etc., really unhealthy, but what can you say when the kids are on holidays! also the drinks machine was open at half eight in the morning, which I thought was crazy, as I noticed my 14 year old with a strofoam cup and cover on it, and I thought it a bit strange, as he doesn't drink tea or coffee, and when I investigated further it turned out it was full of coca cola at half eight in the morning, and the idea of the lid on it was to fool me into thinking he had taken up tea! anyway I banned my lads from any fizzy stuff in the morning, and they were quietly loaded towards the fruit juice machine every other morning, again it was on tap, orange or apple juice, some kind of pink lemonade juice, which was full of sugar (which the kids of course loved), there were yogurts, fresh fruits, various jams, maple syrups, you name it and I think it was in that breakfast room. Strangely enough the hotel use only styrofoam cups and plates and plastic knifes and forks which you just throw away afterwards, I suppose it spares them on the washing up, and it wasn't a problem. All in all I found this hotel to be lovely, the staff were always pleasant and extremely helpful, and never minded being asked various questions, and we had one night where the air conditioning stopped working in our room, which turned out was caused by me, as I pushed the leather armchair back up against the unit, which in turn caused it to freeze up and stop working, anyway when I reported it to reception, the night manager came up straight away and checked the room and agreed it was way too hot to be able to sleep in, and moved us next door immediately, which was brilliant, as that room was lovely and cool, and we were left the use of the two rooms for the following day in order to move our stuff, as there was a problem in fixing in the air-conditioning unit. There is also a laundry in the hotel, which I used twice, and found brilliant, very cheap, a couple of dollars, and you can wash and dry all your clothes, I just put mine on (and because the machines are american, they are of course huge machines, and fit twice what we would consider a load here in Ireland!) and went back up to my room, and came down an hour later and just transfered the clothes into the drier, and called back an hour later, and my clothes were still there, so no worries there. All in all I would definately stay here again, oh yes I nearly forgot the best bit, infront of the hotel is the bahama breeze restaurant, oh my god, make sure you go there, the food is fantastic, the coctails are out of this world, I ordered one starter of onion rings between the four of us the first night i was there, and 14 huge onion rings (I kid you not!) came out on huge rectangular plate on a bed of lettuce with two seperate dips, and they were delicious, and were very reasonable, plus I discovered the first night in the bar that when you buy the kids a drink, you only pay for the first one, after that they get free refills for the rest of the night! I thought that was brilliant value, as you could be robbed blind in Ireland when out for a night! anyway if you're thinking of booking this hotel, go ahead, you will not be sorry, its a lovely safe, clean, friendly hotel, and excellent value for money, I think it worked out at 65 euro per night for the one bedroom suite I booked, which was good value, plus they also provide a free supper on Mondays through to Thursdays I think from 5 to 7 p.m., we only made it twice, as we were always out at the theme parks, and it was nice enough, pasta and meatballs and salad one evening, and some kind of ravioli I think on the other evening, and free drinks for the kids, and free glass of wine, and a top up, which was very good value.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rudy897
