Reviews.Content: My family and I love this hotel.It is very clean.The free breakfast was a bonus with ample varieties.The 2 bed room suite that we stayed in was very nice and spacious.The staff were very nice and helpful.Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Second time at Homewook Suites Orlando I'Drive”
Reviews.Author: Klettenberg
Reviews.Content: It was the second time at this hotel, and we've decided to stay there again because we enjoyed our first stay a lot. It's a hotel to stay with your family and you will easily feel at home. I would just suggest not to stay at the 1 King bed suite if you are more than two people or have older children because the sofa is not comfortable at all. You can use the Universal Boulevard entrance to avoid the traffic jam at the International Drive. The staff is very giving and patient with the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Ian S
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading many reviews. 3 of us stayed here for 2 weeks, checking out Sept 4th. 2 adults and our 7 year old. This was the perfect location for a holiday based around visiting the parks. Room was excellent and very quiet. We were in the block next to Universal Blvd. Plus points: Daily breakfast. Welcome home buffet Mon-Thurs and drinks (wine, beer.) Rooms have kitchens, but we cooked just once in 2 weeks. Saved a fortune. Towels changed daily & room service every day. Fantastic service from housekeeping. All staff very good and helpful, especially in the dining area. Nice gym with modern machines. Decent pool for a dip after a day at the parks. This is not a 'resort hotel', ie it does not have a large fun pool and other amenities you would expect in a larger hotel, but if you want to use this as your holiday base, it is a great place to stay. Ideally located on I-drive, walking distance to loads of restaurants. We enjoyed eating at Uno and Houlihan's. Travel tips: Take the car for disney, book the free shuttle at reception for Universal, and take the i-ride to the Seaworld parks. Will save a fortune in parking costs. Take rucksack for snacks and food at the parks, and don't bother hiring a locker. Great holiday, great service and great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “1st class”
Reviews.Author: kev1888
Reviews.Content: dont be put off by a few negative reviews.cant please all the people all the time! hotel delivered on all the things i was expecting upon arrival.rooms are spacious and clean, location perfect, next to loads of bars and restuarants.pool not great but does anyone really go to orlando to lay at a pool? if you do, they allow you to use sister hotel next door which gets sun all day and very quiet!! alternatively pay the higher rates at another hotel with a nice pool and stop moaning! And for those people who turned their nose up at the FREE food and drink on offer-ITS FREE!!! My god,don't eat it if your palet prefers champagne and caviar! we only ate in it one evening during our 2 week stay because we were too tired to go out, bet the people complaining never missed a free meal with beer and wine! Seems there are 1 or 2 people who prefer to complain, rather than pay the prices which more luxurios hotels would charge you! All in all,hotel was great value for money,very friendly and will go back! p.s. Millers next door well worth a visit-great choice on food,wines and beers!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable & Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: howellsk1984
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Aug 9th-24th. Reception staff were very friendly, and breakfast was a bonus before hitting the busy parks. The breakfast was good the first 2 days we were there, with warm muffins & waffle machines, however these werent always there ? not sure why?! When we arrived we were put in a pool facing room but unfortunately our safe did not work so we asked to be moved, this was dealt with quickly and efficiently. When we moved into our new room it was clean and comfortable. The bedroom fan and one of the bed side lights didnt work but it wasnt really an issue so we didnt say anything. The hotel is well placed to catch the red & green line i trolleys.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Seaton01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice in July first four nights of our holiday and last six nights of our hotel and both stays were fantastic. Rooms are large and extremely clean. The location of the hotel is great just behind Bahamas Breeze/TGI Fridays and 10 minutes walk to Pointe Orlando which is full of shops, Restaurants and a Cinema. Having been to Orlando numerous times this hotel has really spoilt us and we will have to return again. Hotel staff were all very polite and helpful and the breakfast is a great start to the day and if you are back from the parks for 5pm until 7pm Monday to Thursday the welcome back beer and food is a great bonus. One big bonus is that they provide free transportation to all parks including disney and that saves hastle and they run a really good schedule. Will be back to Orlando and Homewood suites is the only place to stay. Thanks for a great stay and holiday. Only down side although we didnt use it is the pool as it is quite small but i would image that most people are at the parks so space would not be an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: pangee
Reviews.Content: Our family of 9 (4 kids ages 6 thru 14) spent a week in Orlando and found this hotel to be outstanding. It was clean, staff very friendly and helpful, and provided great value for the price. Beds were comfortable, kitchen was user friendly, and they provided a hot breakfast every morning, with a light dinner Mon. thru Thurs. including wine and beer....coffee bar was also open 24 hrs. Kids loved the pool and hot tub, and the free shuttle to Universal properties saved us parking charges. We'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed !!”
Reviews.Author: Hiramg
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed !! First thing first, when I book a Hotel, it is because of the reviews posted on this trip advisor website; certainly I rely that the reviews are on the spot and truthful when it is time for me and my family to plan for a vacation. All I want is to enjoy the best Hotel experience equal to other trip advisor members; in this case it wasnâ€™t satisfied like I saw in the latest reviews. Letâ€™s start when I first booked my room with a king and sofa bed layout I was told when making my reservation that the sofa bed was confortable, what a lie! My 15 year daughter couldnâ€™t sleep because the spring mattress. I approached the Hotel front desk to express my concerns and they didnâ€™t seem to care about it, the supervisor with last name Roche only suggested that we could change to a two double room only if paying 80 dollars more putting the room total for 170 when in Orlando you can find a two queen layout for 110 tops (original price 90per night w/o tax and charges). I would have normally changed hotels but my daughter forgot a dress she needed to wear for a cruise night and my sister send me the package FedEx from Puerto Rico. To my surprise the Hotel charged me 10 dollars for receiving of the package and holding it for a couple of hours, wow! Letâ€™s start with the room conditions, my room was in the 4 floor in the 440s-460s, there were stains on the carpet, stains the sheets, pubic hair in the tube and for my surprise I donâ€™t know why, there were a bunch of pubic hair in a small towel with a sea shell design, I just took it and threw it on the floor. Personally I didnâ€™t like the rooms design because the bathrooms sink is separated from the toilet and tub. For a sleeper like me and having a wife waking up early using the sink doesnâ€™t go well. In addition there were no ice makers in my floor I needed to go two floors down for ice or use the icemaker in the roomâ€™s fridge, I tried it but it was too noisy and it was 5 feet away of my daughterâ€™s sofa bed. The staff of this Hotel gives a bunch of lame excuses; I stayed in this Hotel from August 2 to August 6 and for no apparent reason in August 4 both electronic keys didnâ€™t work at the same time, for some people this isnâ€™t a big issue but when you have a lot of kids playing around in the elevators and you got to use the bathroom and go back to an crowded front desk youâ€™ll remember me!! What the staff told me was that the electronics keys fail when there are close to electronics( but why two at the same time in different pockets), next day all rooms kept receiving newspapers except mine, in addition I stopped getting soap bars, I may add one small soap bar for 3 guest isnâ€™t enough. What to expect from this hotel is a good location well its dead smack on International drive, free grub if your into that and a lot of unattended kids playing through the hotel . In conclusion I never stay in this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Bmc1116
Reviews.Content: We had read the other people's reviews on the property and had high expectations. We had had an excellent experience in Grapevine, TX @ a Homewood Suites and were hoping for a similar experience in Orlando. It was not to be. The staff was polite but not very friendly. We had a suite located on the South side of the building. The adjacent lot is vacant and has a road beside it. I think there was drag racing there at night. Not good for quiet sleep time! Breakfast was always very crowded, no matter what time you chose to go. The one thing we did agree with was the wonderful location. We could take an easy walk to Ponte Orlando for shopping and restaurants or a movie. There are tons of restaurants close by on I-Drive. All of the theme parks are not very far away, particularly Sea World and Universal. I would recommend it if you can get a much better rate than we did and a room on the North side that is hopfully quiet!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a great little hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: david F
Reviews.Content: We all thought that this was a great hotel, good location on international drive with easy access to all the parks via very good free shuttle service to both Disney and Universal Studios and Sea world via the I trolley this saved us a fortune in car hire and parking charges!! The complimentary breakfast was a real bonus too as it had loads of choice and was generally a good standard. Managed to get back for the Managers free evening buffet a couple of times which was a basic meal ( like hot dogs ) salad and free beer, wine or sodas. ( free coffee available all day!!!) The rooms were a good size , the main bed was very large and very comfortable, however the sofa bed in the lounge was less so and our teenage girls found it uncomfortable after a couple of nights. all in all an excellent choice made special by a fantastic team who went out of there way to help and assist us. would recomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic holiday”
Reviews.Author: englishrose077
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a two week stay at the Homewood Suites and we loved it. Everywhere was spotless and our room was just right for the three of us, the fridge/freezer was very useful for chilling water, beer, wine and food if you didn't want to eat out. Breakfast is substantial and had a wide range of things to choose from. The welcome home meal was a little too early, we thought, as most people were still out and about, and if sandwiches or wraps were available for the late arrivals back then that would have been fantastic. The transport to the parks was always on time and the Disney/Epcot driver was lovely, especially to the kids. We are saving to go back as soon as we can!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: jennyc91
Reviews.Content: We got a really good deal on a travel website so we didn't know what to expect...the hotel exceeded our expectations. The hotel room was clean and more than enough room for my husband and I. The pictures on the website were accurate. The pool was accommodating, but we didn't really spend that much time there. There was breakfast every morning - eggs, potatoes, waffles, etc. If you are looking for fancy pancakes or omlettes, you will want to eat else where. It was good enough to jump start the day...and I must say, good coffee! There was a welcome home dinner Mon-Thurs - again nothing fancy, but if you are on the go all day, it was great not to have to go out once more. They served things like hot dogs, stuffed shells, burgers, soup, etc. There is a different meal each night...the front desk and your room has a calendar of eats for the month. It is a great location for Sea World, Aquatica, and Wet n Wild. They are on the direct route for the I-trolly, There is a shuttle available. They depart early in the AM to Disney (8 or 10:30) and have a pick up time of 6:30 and 9:45 pm...which was kinda annoying if you like to stay there for the parade and later shows. But it is cheaper than getting a taxi. If you aren't there on time, the shuttle leaves without you! But that is a company outsourced by the hotel, so I can't reflect it directly on the hotel. We would definitely return. The staff are welcoming and very helpful. Housekeeping did an outstanding job!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!! Great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: canesgal
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel based on reviews for a training conference, and I was not disappointed! First, the check in was a breeze, very nice guy, friendly and warm personality. Loved the room, super clean, spacious, had it's own kitchen, living room and seperate sleeping area. The staff was so friendly, from beginning to end. I even approached the General Manager to give kudos. The breakfast is very busy every day, so get there early! The pool is nice, but kids everywhere. If you want to go to sleep early, do not get a room facing the pool, it is open till ten! Very nice gym. I highly recommend this hotel, it is awesome!!!

Reviews.Title: “fab place to stay”
Reviews.Author: fionaoshea
Reviews.Content: we found the hotel to be everything that we needed. it was so easy to get to the parks from here .breakfast was great. staff were great would recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “All it was Cracked Up To Be”
Reviews.Author: NellykScotland
Reviews.Content: I read review after review after review and they all lived up to what I expected. We had a great holiday and the hotel was part of it. I would most definately go back. The staff were very friendly. the food was good, the accommodation was brilliant, to be honest I could rant and rave all day about the Homewood Suites it was fab. The location for a start was great, you could walk to anything you needed. So you didn't really need a car, however, if you did have one there are plenty of parking spaces. There is a 24 hour reception. You can use the computers provided and if they are not working they will let you use their office. Nothing was ever a problem to the staff. Each suite has a fridge, freezer, ice making machine, dish washer, coffee or tea maker, telephone, wireless internet, microwave, safe, bath and shower, fab beds, cooker, table and chairs, air conditioning. I could not fault it. I could even walk about in my bare feet which means I thought it was really clean. Rooms are cleaned every day. Free drinks, wine, spirits, juice from Mon to Thur every week. Breakfast is great. Pool is really nice, but quite shaded which is a relief sometimes, however, if you want full sun just go to their sister hotel The Hampton Inn which is about 100 yards away, that is a really nice setting also. Try Wonderworks which you can walk to. We spent a whole night and day in their, the dinner and magician at night is absolutely awsome, thoroughly enjoyed it. If you decide on the Homewood Suites I know you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Roesy
Reviews.Content: A nice budget hotel. It is in a good location, within walking distance to nice restaurants, shops and cinema. Breakfast is free and is served daily between 7-10a.m. The food is basic but plentiful and sometimes the queue for the toasters/waffle makers etc can be long and a little disorganised. They also serve a complimentary, light evening meal from monday to Thursday with free beer and wine. The hotel has free wi-fi but this can be a little slow. It also has a small onsite shop selling snacks, drinks and some toiletries. The fitness room is small but the equipment is well maintained. However, it was a little messy the day we visited(paper towels on the ground, mat abandoned in the middle of the floor). The hotel also has guest laundry facilities which are very useful. My only real complaints about this hotel were the dated decor in the public areas, the slow elevators and the fact that there are too few sub loungers by the pool. Other than that we enjoyed our stay and would recommend it because of the large clean rooms and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great for both business and leisure travellers on a budget”
Reviews.Author: eat_good_food77
Reviews.Content: Satisfied with my stay. Easy check in. My suite was clean and a good size. Room was cleaned everyday, bed made up, toiletries re-filled. It was only me staying as I was attending a conference at the OCCC. It is within walking distance which I did everyday to the OCCC. But for those that aren't used to the heat, you can take the i-Trolley bus system that runs on I-Drive. Think it's mostly used by tourists. Saturday night the pool was extremely noisy and I could hear it all the way up on the 4th floor. But the rest of my stay it was much quieter so it must have just been weekend travelers. The free breakfast buffet was really nice. It's not super fancy but it's better then most hotels in same category. I would definitely stay here again if I was in this general area for a convention.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: st2826
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice, in November 2009 and November 2010 and are hoping to stay again in April 2012. If you want to stay on International drive then this hotel is in the perfect position, loads of good restaurants all within walking distance. Theres a free buffet breakfast everyday, lots of choice and a great money saver, also free food Monday to thursday evenings which changed everyday and free shuttles to Universal And Disney. The rooms are spacious and were cleaned every day, lots of towels were provided too. The staff are just great from the maids to the manager, they all had a cheery hello for us every time we saw them. The manager is very helpful-our flight back was delayed by snow and he let us have the room until we finally left (about 6 hours past check-out) for free and if we needed to stay over night offered it to us at a very reduced rate which we thought was lovely. The only negative thing i can think about this little gem is that it's now so popular it's getting booked up very quickly in advance! Looking forward to staying here again next year-if we can get in ;o)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Lovely Staff”
Reviews.Author: lmidge39
Reviews.Content: Staff were really helpful for advice on shopping etc. Couldnt do enough for you. Great room value for money. Only downsides could do with a little sprucing up breakfast is not good. Free happy hour Monday - Thursday.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families going to Orlando Parks”
Reviews.Author: krizkaz
Reviews.Content: My family (6 adults, 4 kids from 3 to 15) stayed here for 9 nights, we really liked it a lot. The kitchenette was a blessing after hours and hours walking and just having fast food. It's very near a Wal Mart, Wallgreens, the Premium Outlets, Universal, and the free shuttle to Disney Parks saved us a lot of $$$. The kids could only enjoyed the pool 2 or 3 times, and they had a blast, it's not a huge one, but ideal for kids. My husband tried the very first day the fitness center and it was ok. He didn't come back because all the walking we have at the parks, so he didn't need any extra workout. We love the laundry room, not so cheap, but we could do laundry the 4th and 7th day because we packed light. And for the price, really a bargain. The staff is really kind, but not overwhealming. And the breakfast was just OK, just eggs, sausages, baked potatoes, oatmeal, corn flakes, apples, grapefruit or bananas, yogurt, sodas, orange and apple "juice" waffles, pancakes, coffee, tea, milk. But it really helped us with the expenses and to get to the parks with a full stomach. The free wi-fi internet was a blessing when we returned by night to the hotel, just stayed in touch with ours, send some pics of the day. VERY VERY CLEAN EVERYTHING

Reviews.Title: “Dont Beleive all the Hype !!!”
Reviews.Author: wellfan1
Reviews.Content: Having read on Trip Advisor how good this hotel was and how friendly the staff were we arrived with great exectations! Where we expecting too much? Where was the friendly, helpfull staff? No Porters, no friendly greeting, no directions to your room or even the lifts. Arrived on Sat 24th June at around 7pm and to be honest it is the first time that trip advisor has let me down. Rooms are large enough for our family of 3 but dont expect a nice modern 3-4 star room. The rooms are of a good size but they are dated with worn furniture,depressing,dated decor and a tiny toilet,shower area with very noisy A/C that if you want to sleep you have to turn off. Daily breakfast was ok if you dont mind eating the same thing day after day and you can put up with rude,and very gready adults and children who have no manners,choose not to stand in line for simple things like one of the two toasters! yes two! or even the coffee,waffle machine and after a while this can be very annoying. Managers reception is at best ok. having read on here how good this was i was so disapointed but i suppose it was free but the busloads of Americans returning from the parks attacked it every day as if they were being offered a slap up meal and we found this very amousing watching this take place. Pool area was a joke with limited sunbeds,Sunshine, it appeared as thou it was an after thought dropped in the middle of a high rise apartment with limited space and defo not very appealing. Asked the not so Friendly staff if there was another pool that could be used and they directed us to another hotel out the back of our main door? There are 4 hotels out there back door all of which had very friendly welcoming staff but none had any knoweladge of this sharing arrangment and the one pool we managed to gain access to we managed to get locked in as all doors leading from hotel pool were controlled. Hotel good points would be the location as very handy for I-Drive shoping,Restaurants etc but that would be the end of my list. Overall if you want a standard hotel in good location then Homewood suites might be for you. Overall very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “If iDrive if your final destination, this is the place.”
Reviews.Author: 2worldtravelersnj
Reviews.Content: Single night on biz, standard king room. I came to town for work and chose this property because of the promotion they were running. If you are here for the parks this place is a good choice. Tons of families and children running around. Ideal for a fun time. For work.........eh! Overall decent shape but work out a bit from all the traffic this place gets. The staff was super friendly and accomodating, no complaints there. Room was typical Homewood, comfy and just like home. Didn't use any of the facilities so cannot comment. Close to shipping and entertainment in the heart of iDrive.

Reviews.Title: “Not right for honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: LizandDan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not for us at all as a honeymooning couple. It had some good points - the rooms were clean and spacious, housekeeping was exceptional, beds really comfortable and the location is perfect, very close to some superb restaurants and a good base for all of the parks. However, rooms are dated and the bathroom is claustrophobic with no natural light. Where is this friendliness that people are talking about? Not once, in 10 days, did anyone say â€˜morningâ€™ to us or ask how our day was. Donâ€™t get me wrong, if we spoke to reception they were helpful and polite, but there was no warmth there. We had to go to Embassy Suites to pick up our car and what a contrast! We walked in to â€˜good morning Maâ€™am, Sir, how are you?â€™ Weâ€™re really friendly, smiley people too, so itâ€™s not like we were walking around looking miserable. On checkout no-one asked if weâ€™d had a nice stay or wished us a pleasant journey. There was no-one to help with luggage checking in or out. Aircon in the room is excessively noisy. The flow is directed right at the bed, so itâ€™s very hard to sleep when you have to choose between having a gale blowing at you and waking with a stiff neck or being really hot. It didnâ€™t seem to cool the room down much anyway and the engineer said that it can only cool it down by 20 degrees less that the temperature outside. There was no aircon at all in the lift or our hallway on floor six. Pool was dire in our opinion. Itâ€™s not that itâ€™s shaded that's a problem, as we knew about that before booking; itâ€™s that itâ€™s in the middle of a concrete jungle and just isnâ€™t a nice place to sit around. There is very little space around it anyway. We would not stay here again and mainly because of the staff. Can't say they were rude, as they were fine if you approached them, but the words 'warm, proactive and attentive' must have evaded the management training here. All of the other concerns that we had could possibly be overlooked if we were doing a budget holiday. I am amazed at the good reviews.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: katielfcdiehard
Reviews.Content: 1. Perfect location! Denny' outside the door. Turn left in order... Howl at the moon, Bahama Breeze, Tgi fridays,Subway, Dominos, Walgreens, Millers ale house Pointe orlando and lots more. All within tens mins walking. Across the road is Friendlys, Tony Romas, Ponderosa, Ci-Ci's pizza etc... I ride and lynx stop outide on the left. 2. Fabulous staff! (Reception, Housekeeping, kitchen staff.. etc) Bend over backwards to help you. 3.Cleanliness... Impeccable! Cleaned everyday, new sheets and loads of towels! 4. 1bedroom apt- Great size. Bed MASSIVE and so comfy didn't want to get out of it! Large fridge,microwave,dihwasher etc! 2 widescreen tvs. Room was next door to the laundry room which was very handy! 5.Free Breakfast and evening reception... Same thing everyday for brekkie but saved loads of money and set me up for the parks. sausages scrambled eggs, cereal, bagels, toast, fruit, waffles(YUM) muffins, juices, tea, coffee, hot choc. Evening reception, free beer and wine. Varies with pasta and hot dogs and soup. Nice to have it if your around the hotel. Tip raymond a few dollars and he'll give you a pitcher of beer :) 6.Pool... the only tiny thing that i didnt love but was grand. Orlando is not a pool holiday so it did just fine for our few chillaxing days. if your goin for pool and sun only this hotel isn't for you as its very shaded but perfect for the kids. 7.Free tranfers to parks- book a day in advance. transport to universal seaworld disney busch and wet n wild! The hotel sells universal tickets but not disney. 8. There is a small gym with a few very good machines and weights. perfect if your into it. Theres also a little shop with essentials but quite expenive walgreens is only up the road though. Basically when i booked this hotel i read all the reviews and thought they were a bit too good to be true and was worried that the reviews were fake. I now know why people love it and i will definitely go back. If you have any problem just let them know at reception and it will be sorted asap. Had a very enjoyable 2 weeks at Homewood Suites and would definitely recommend it. Mail me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel.Staff Friendly.Plenty of parking.”
Reviews.Author: Marianglen
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a nice hotel. some good things some bad.Spotless hotel and rooms.Though not very big family rooms.All other needs in room were met.Cleaning staff excellent.Breackfast good,but not very many choices of hot food and same food every morning.Complimentry afternoon food was ok but again the same every day.Pool area clean but very small area for sunbathing.Not much sunshine around the pool and only tilll 4.30pm at the latest.pleanty of free parking spaces.No bar which was a shame.But overall compared to what i have heard about hotels on international drive this hotel was one of the best..

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: the4ofus95
Reviews.Content: What a nice hotel! Our son's little league baseball team had the pleasure of spending 5 nights at this hotel during a tournament at ESPN WWOS. The rooms were exactly what we were looking for. They were just the right size with a full size refridge. The beds were very comfortable with clean, crisp sheets. The sofa made a queen sized bed also. The full breakfast and the afternoon light meal were wonderful and really made this a great value especially considering 9 hungry baseball players! The staff was very nice and made every effort to accomodate us. We had use of the grill out off of the pool deck for a team cookout/swim for no charge! They even allowed us to check out late since we didn't know if we would win the game which would mean we had to stay another day to play again. We've never had such an accomodating hotel!! The best was when we returned from playing a game and the front desk staff hung a banner in the lobby congratulating our team! The families were so excited and couldn't believe how thoughtful and welcoming this hotel was. We have made this hotel our definite favorite in Orlando!!

Reviews.Title: “Homewood Suites I-Drive Excellent Once More”
Reviews.Author: stuartymucker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites, I-Drive for 10 nights in June 2011. This is the 5th time we have stayed at this hotel and the service is still second to none. Rooms - All suites with separate bedroom. Comfy Bed. 2 TVs' in each suite. Fridge/Freezer, microwave, cooker and all utensils. Service- Extremely helpful staff who go out of their way to help you. Manager's Reception Monday-Thursday 5pm-7pm with free beer, wine & snacks. Free Breakfast everyday with a great choice (sausage, egg, waffles, fruit, toast, cakes, tea, coffee, juices etc.) Pool- Good sized pool with plenty of sunbeds & towels. Location:- Perfect for a wide variety of bars, restaurants, shops etc. with complimentary buses to theme parks. Highly Recommended. A+++++

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer care!”
Reviews.Author: Dan42609
Reviews.Content: When our son's sensitive skin had a bad reaction to the sheets and towels, the housecleaning remembered each day to separately wash our linens in only hot water. They saved the trip! The location was great. The breakfast buffet and welcome home reception in the lodge was wonderful! We will highly recommend this family friendly hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable stay again”
Reviews.Author: fozsuzi
Reviews.Content: Third stay,brilliant staff, room clean and comfortable,any problems sorted quickly,(only needed more towels), for price we would stay here everytime .Good location for shops and resturants,easy access to all parks .

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel in an ideal location...”
Reviews.Author: TravelMama126
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I have a thing about cleanliness and this hotel met my expectations. It was very quiet and the staff always spoke when passing you in the hallways. My only problem when staying here was the front desk clerks didn't seem to have any idea about a promotion in which I booked this hotel. It was through a SeaWorld package. Included in the package was a "Benefits Card" in which you are to receive when checking in. They claimed they never seen or heard of a Benefits Card (this allows you to receive the perks at the parks in which was included in the package deal). I called SeaWorld and the Customer Service Rep spoke to the desk clerk and Viola!!!! magically a Benefits Card appears (go figure). I was a little ticked off because I asked for it when I checked in and asked the next morning and they both assured me that was something they didn't participate in. Aside from that, it was an excellent stay. I think they had a beauty convention going on and the hotel seemed to be full. Breakfast was chaos, they couldn't seem to keep up with the demand of the number of guest by replacing the food once the buffet was empty. It was ok if u wanted to grab some toast or a bagel, but if you are not there from the start you will miss out. There is a Denny's next door, I'd suggest that or Ihop. The guy who worked the desk at night was extremely nice and friendly. Once again, if you are looking for a nice clean hotel this is it. They clean the rooms and restock whatever you use (shampoo, conditioner, lotion, soap, coffee, cups, tea etc). I liked the kitchenette in the room too. The tv's were a nice size too. This hotel is in an ideal spot. You don't have to drive to find a place to eat. Boston Lobster Feast is next door. Other places include, Bahama Breeze, Olive Garden, Joe's Crab Shack, Subways, Domino's Pizza, liquor store, camera shop and a 24hr Walgreen's. My husband was happy with this hotel and he is hard to please...he actually made a comment about how comfortable the beds and pillows were. He was right, the pillows were like sleeping on a cloud.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Homer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from May 21 - May 29. We had a one bedroom suite at the front of the hotel. We arrived late in the evening to check-in and the staff greeted us warmly. They also allowed us to checkout late. Location: I like the location of this hotel. It is on I-Drive, not far from the action of the Drive. The hotel is off of the street so that it is not affected by the large volume of traffic on I-Drive. There are a variety of restaurants and some shops nearby to pass the time. We used Universal Drive to access the hotel most of the time since there is less traffic and it was easier to get around. You just have to remember to use the Hyatt Place sign as a guide as to when to turn. Room: The room was clean and well appointed. It was nice to have the sink outside the bathroom so that one of us could shower and the other get ready. We found the ceiling fan to be a little much in the bedroom and you couldn't turn the speed up because it would rattle around in the ceiling mount. The full size fridge and two burner cook top were nice. We liked the fact that the freezer would make ice for you as well. The furniture didn't show too much wear and tear. Our one critique would be that none of the lights would go one via the light switch, you always had to go to the lamp to turn them on. Generally: The breakfast was quite good and included in the cost. It wasn't too busy during our visit and it had everything that you needed to get started in the morning. My sister-in-law, who was staying elsewhere, thought it would be a great money saver for any family and it definitely got us past the lunch hour for food. The afternoon snacks with beverages was nice as well. If we had kids, we probably would have topped them off with some food at that time. The pool was small and not really in the sun given it is in the courtyard of the hotel but it was nice. It definitely wasn't as warm as some other hotels but when the temp is 95 degrees, you like a cool pool, not a warm pot. Would definitely stay here again in the future. Got a great deal of the 8 nights for approx $60 a night.

Reviews.Title: “ONLY downside...pool area...”
Reviews.Author: Cecebs
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay for anything, vacation, business, quick, extended, etc. The location is excellent. Many restaurants, shopping, things to do within walking distance. Not a far drive (5-10 minutes) to Disney, Universal, or Sea World. The breakfast and afternoon food are excellent! We saved a lot of money on dinners because of the afternoon snack. Rooms were great also!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with a few minor quirks”
Reviews.Author: GoingtoArizona
Reviews.Content: Myself and my family stayed at the Homewood Suites at the end of May for 3 nights. The hotel is centrally located which is great. We could walk to just about anything that we needed and with gas prices this was a plus. The front desk staff was very nice and accomodating. The rooms are nice, but seem a bit dated and could use a little updating. The sofa was very flat and needed to be replaced. Also, they still have window units for air conditioning and this could be updated. They only have the Concierge for Universal Studios and that person is only there for a couple of hours. I am use to the Concierge knowing about everything and being able to offer them. The breakfast was okay, but only have 2 waffle irons was a big problem and they should definitely add more. On the other hand, we did enjoy the pool. Overall the hotel was good for the money that we spent. We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite which was very spacious. I would probably stay here again if the price is right because the service was good.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: beardsleyboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here end of May beginning June and couldn't fault it. Rooms are spacious and include kitchenette with full size fridge(check your freezer before you go looking for the ice machine as it probably has its own ice maker), microwave/rings + utensils. If you are travelling south down international drive the hotel will be on the left(your opposite side of the road) and is not visible from the road. The hotel is behind Denny's, Cattlemans steakhouse and Howl at the Moon, you can turn down any of these and it will take you to the hotels carpark. Breakfast is served between 7 - 10am and the choice is plentiful - cereal, fruit, youghurt, scrambled egg/sausages, toast, bagels etc. With tea/coffee, fruit juices and even coke to drink. If you have kids you will probably spend all your time making their 5'' diameter waffles. When the hotel is full, breakfast is busy after 8am , but as the plates etc are paper you can make your breakfast and take it back up to your room(especially good for those in your party who don't make it up in time. Universal have a desk at reception open till approx 11am each morning, here you can buy tickets or book places on the shuttle for both Universals, Seaworld, Aquatica and Wet n Wild. You must book 24 hours in advance. At the time of writing this shuttle only goes to four hotels so you are not on the bus for long, and Universal and Seaworld have seperate buses. For Disney book with reception, again in advance. We bought I ride 14 day passes from the visitor centre around the corner for $17 each and this allowed unlimited travel for 14 days. We used this for Wet n wild(stop 9), Sea World(stop 33), Aquatica(stop 34) and both Orlando Premium outlet malls(stops 1 and 42), the stops are all outside these locations. The longest we had to wait was 15 minutes. Overall the hotel is in an excellent location for shops/bars/restaurants and the staff were great. Rooms were cleaned everyday and we never saw them. Tips Orlando visitor centre has some good deals on park/show/dining tickets and very helpful staff for any other info. Walgreens supermarket(5 minute walk from the hotel, come out of front entrance and turn left, up through carpark and left past Howl at moon, Tgi Fridays etc ) has good deals on packs of 24 bottles of water, which are ideal for the parks, cosmetics, camera and reasonable selection of food/drink.

Reviews.Title: “Yet again another fantastic stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: moneyaware
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week long stay in the Homewood, this being our seventh year staying here. Wouldn't stay anywhere else to be honest. Friendly helpful staff, excellent value, spotlessly clean (done every day), great space in the suite with seperate living and bedroom areas, great choice breakfast healthy to the not so healthy ..... swimming pool spotless and suits me perfectly as it is partly shaded all day..Cant wait to return again next year. Recommend room on the ground floor as you can come and go without waiting for elevators and there is several doors out of the hotel and they cannot be accessed without key card, very safe and secure. Thank you homewood see you soon

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NSFolks
Reviews.Content: There are probably ten thousand hotel rooms in the Orlando area but we couldn't have been happier with the room we had at Homewood Suites on International Drive. Everything from checking in early to the easy and uneventful checkout was great. Our one bedroom suite had a kitchette which came in handy a few times. The suite was very clean, very comfortable and well appointed. The fact that it was a suite was good because we were staying there for a full week and appreciated the extra space. The location is exceptional...right in the middle of International Drive...we walked to restaurants every evening (deciding where to eat was the hard part). Shops,a liquor store and a tourist information center are just a few feet away. We made use of the free breakfast every morning...great start to the day. And most days they have free wine and beer for a few hours around dinner was putto good use as well. The free breakfast and drinks saved us a bundle. The pool although not large was never crowded and was well sheltered. The staff was great, no surprises at checkout. We would certainly recommend it to couples and families alike. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Home Sweet Home”
Reviews.Author: Peng-Wai
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 nights and everything was great. The room was spacious, cosy and the large king-size bed was very comfortable. The free wireless internet worked without any problems. Complimentary breakfast was more than sufficient. Hotel location is great. The hotel is within walking distance to many restaurants and is served by the i-Trolley. Service was good and the front-desk staff were always friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: galvatronic
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the rants and raves from other trip advisers and they weren't wrong. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. WE asked for a later checkout time and it was given without charge. The free hot and cold buffet breakfast was excellent for starting our day. Choices included cereal, oatmeal, toast, waffles, sausage and eggs, yogurt fresh fruit and on and on. Welcome home free dinner was a bufett soup and salad and other simple things but again it was free. The shuttle service was excellent and always on time. The front desk help was amazing at answering all our questions. Was about a 15 mins drive to disney, and about 5 to sea world the water parks universal and so forth. The I trolly at 1.25 person ,free for children under 12 was excellent and easy to use, and if we weren't sure where we were going the driver was sure to point us in the right direction.The stops were plentiful and there was a map on every post to check to see where you are going. A tip, there is a outlet shopping mall with a character warehouse on each end of international drive , just get on the bus and tell them you want to go to the outlet mall. We found Disney bargains in both. There are plenty of restaurants to walk to from your hotel, we enjoyed the olive garden very much, just left on international from the hotel ,across the street and maybe a block or so, its a bit hidden. Denny is right outside, and again to the left on international is a subway which we went to a lot in our 10 day stay , and a Walgreen so buy some grocery's to put in our room, mostly we got drinks and ice cream. There are a few stores to your right on international, bargain world is one, that carry disney t shirts at a fraction of the cost ,and pretty much every souvenir you need , a few blocks further to the right is a McDonald and a chicken place sort of like KFC. If your going to use the trolley i recommend just getting a one week pass for like 10 bucks, then you just jump on and off all day long with your card, as you need exact change all the time it gets annoying . The room itself was nice, dated, but clean,the bed was large and comfortable, it had a fridge ,toaster ,stove . microwave ( we brought microwave popcorn to enjoy nightly with a show). Laundry machines on a couple of the floors, you buy the soap. They had a few items for sale , soups ,ravioli, beverages, ice cream bars, that sort of thing but more pricey than just walking to Walgreen. IF we ever go back to Florida, i was for sure stay at this hotel. The only thing I missed was a patio,oh well. The views from the 6th floor were excellent. WE had no complaints at all, and even enjoyed the free daily paper stuffed under are door. OH and we never heard anyone through the walls or in the halls. The pool is a plain rectangular pool, we never used it, but it did get used and enjoyed by others. I hear they offer free parking as well. Free high speed internet in the rooms and all over. two flat screen tvs per suite, hair dryer in the bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family base for Orlando theme park-ing”
Reviews.Author: PlasticMoonRain
Reviews.Content: With about a bazillion hotels in Orlando, and my family never having been there before, I picked this Homewood Suites because of the many favorable comments posted here. We were not disappointed. We stayed in a two bedroom, two bathroom suite, which my kids loved since they had their own room with two beds and a bathroom of their own. The price I paid was a tremendous value and extremely reasonable. The room was always cleaned spotlessly, the much-needed A/C worked flawlessly, and my wife and I commented on how really comfort6able the bed was. Although we didn't get a chance to have the light dinners, the complimentary breakfast buffet was far more than adequate. The outdoor pool was kept very nicely, and there were always families there to keep my kids company. Added bonus: some inflatables in the pool, provided by the hotel. It's amazing how simple stuff like this can go a long way keeping good graces with guests. The hotel was convenient also: about 15 minutes from Orlando International Airport, about 10 minutes from Universal Theme Park (just take Universal Blvd. right behind the hotel parking lot), about 5 minutes from Wet 'n' Wild Water Park (ditto), and about 20 - 22 minutes to Walt Disney World, mostly on highway 4. One good piece of advice: the hotel has a special desk for booking and information for Universal-based parks, such as the Theme Park, Busch Gardens in Tampa, Wet 'n' Wild, etc. It's open from 7:30 - 11:15 am every morning. Don't forget to say hello to Tosey if she's working there -- extremely helpful and friendly. She can also help get Blue Man Group tickets at Universal as well. Bahama Breeze is a short walk from the hotel and we ate there the first night. Having never been to one, I have to say I wish they had them in NY! Would we go back here? Absolutely. Nice staff. Really nice accommodations. Very good location. Excellent value. What more could you ask?

Reviews.Title: “home from home”
Reviews.Author: andrea197614
Reviews.Content: When staying in Orlando we always stay at Homewood Suites, international drive. O n our stay this month we found the suite to be clean and comfortable and the complimentary breakfast and managers reception Monday to Thursday to a good standard. Staff and managers are very helpful and do all they can to make your stay enjoyable. A most enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: VeganDiner422
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is not brand spanking new, it is clean, convenient, and has nice kitchen facilities. The service was great, the front desk and the housekeeping service went above and beyond. A very pleasant stay and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “location was great”
Reviews.Author: wizofwoz
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I cannot comment too much about the hotel as we only had a short night but we chose the location because it was near the interstate and a few miles from Universal Studios (our destination). Check in was a little slow because the front desk clerk was called in from another hotel to help and she wasn't familiar with the rooms, etc. After a long day at Universal, waiting on her seemed like forever. The hotel is very clean, parking is ample, rooms are very nice. The king bed was very comfortable but the pull out couch bed was poor. The sheets/blankets/pillows for it were good quality but the mattress was lumpy and the bed itself sloped. Free wireless internet worked great. But when I saw the location as we drove up to the hotel, I was a bit bummed we weren't staying longer. It is on a very busy strip of lots to do...restaurants that ranged from Subway to Denny's to expensive Maggione's all withing walking distance. I couldn't really see what all was around but there were tons of people walking up and down this strip of scenic road so I'm sure there was more than just restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: GuptaPG
Reviews.Content: After considering all the reviews on trip advisor, you just canâ€™t go wrong. Amazing property and location. Certainly, Homewood Suites has been the highlight of my holiday. $ 45 from the airport by Mears yellow taxi(inclding tips), returns can be organised by the front desk at about $40. Front desk also handled all my online shopping deliveries with ease. Free shuttle to all Disney and Universal theme parks was an added plus. All Universal parks tickets sold in the reception area including the fast pass. Disney tickets can be bought at the respective parks itself. The Visitors Centre on International Drive is a minute walk, they also sell Disney tickets but at an additional fee. Lynx ad I-Drive Bus stops very close to the Visitors Centre, where all area information can be sought. The complimentary breakfast is not so adequate for vegetarians, however itâ€™s a great start for the day. The welcome home complimentary wine and snacks from Monday through Friday (5pm to 7pm) was just great and something to look forward after a tiring day. Daily menu is pasted on the fridge to tempt you to get back early. As for the suite, very comfortable with a pullout bed and a complete kitchen, consisting of a fridge, microwave, dishwasher (powder included), coffee machine (coffee pods and tea bags replenished every day) and adequate cutlery. Housekeeping service was immaculate, came home to a clean and neat room at the end of a tiring day. Great restaurants in the vicinity are Bahama Breez, TGIF, Friendlys, Subway, etc. Wallgreens just a 5 min walk. On site coin operated Laundromat very convenient, Tide available at the in house store adjacent to the front desk. Overall great experience and will definitely return to Homewood Suites on my next trip to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “staff that care”
Reviews.Author: robert_davies
Reviews.Content: breakfast very good and the happy hour mon to thurs good food annd drink the staff allways worked very hard with no complaints. the r ooms could do with an update but had a very good stay. will be back next year

Reviews.Title: “best holiday to date”
Reviews.Author: quinner23
Reviews.Content: The management and staff were very helpful and friendly. The rooms were cleaned every day. The hotel was spotless. The food was very good. The pool area was was kept very clean. 2 mins walk to the i trolly and links buses was a plus. we were very happy and have no complaints. A sincere thank you to all at Homewood Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BOB_Phila-Pa
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor and once again, the reviews were right on target. The room was very comfortable and clean. Free WiFi worked great as well. The staff were pleasant and happy to help with any questions. A nice breakfast buffet was included in the price as well as a daily happy hour (wine and beer) that included hot appetizers/food. An ideal location on International Drive, the hotel was within walking distance to restaurants and a short drive to Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “As Good As The First Time”
Reviews.Author: Deebhoy
Reviews.Content: I submitted this review some time ago but it was rejected for some reason but this is my honest opinion about this hotel and I've edited my original post. This was my second stay in Homewood Suites since August 2005. Stayed there again in June/July 2010. Situated perfectly on IDrive (a short walk from Wonderworks so its far enough from the seedy part of IDrive) its off the road and very quiet. They have a selection of two bedroomed suites and or one - we stayed in the one. If you have young kids the one bedroom is perfect as two big double beds easily fit into the room. Bathroom was very dated and needs an upgrade. Every room has a separate sitting room along with a massive fridge, cooker, table and chairs. Each room has a good size flat screen tv with lots of kids channels. There's also free internet access via wifi or from a computer on the ground floor that you can also print from free of charge. I heard when we were there they were in the process of redecorating the hotel which is probably required as it was a bit jaded but will be fine when its finished. There's a swimming pool and hot tub outside by the eating area but anybody staying in the hotel gets a free breakfast and a welcome back managers meal Monday to Thursday with free beer or wine - took advanage of that - it can save you quite a bit of money in terms of saving your dollars for a meal out at the weekend. I would suggest they consider changing the breakfast menu a bit more but its still decent although some people were a little surprised at the polystyrene plates - the solution is to bring the plates down from your room if it bothers you. Free shuttles take you to Disney or Universal Studio's including return - make sure you are there on time though or you will miss it. Room was cleaned and beds made everyday and were spotlessly clean. My only criticism of Homewood Suites is that there isn't a central location to meet - i.e. a bar (a wee cozy Irish bar would be perfect!!). Top notch hotel for price and when I am in Florida again I will definitely be staying there. Should also mention that the staff were top notch when we required anything - the manager in particular was very friendly and eager to ensure his guests were enjoying their stay. A really nice hotel - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: LMC_77
Reviews.Content: Great location on I-Drive: shady parking spaces, set back from the road, does NOT back onto I4 road, within walking distance of lots of restaurants. Free breakfast with several options. Manager's reception on Monday to Thursday evenings was a little repetative (sausages 2 nights in a row, followed by pork), but would be good value for a family on a budget. The one-bed suite we had was spacious enough (though the travel cot made the living room a little smaller), overlooking the pool courtyard, and was quiet at night with the air conditioning on. We had a problem with the ice maker in the fridge and the ceiling fan in the bedroom , but they were fixed the day we reported them. The staff on reception were very helpful and kind. I would highly recommend this hotel for the I-Drive area, especially for families as the suites give more space and freedom than a hotel room for little extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a fantastic holiday!”
Reviews.Author: lorrainebaldock
Reviews.Content: We had read the reviews before we booked so had high hopes, we weren't disappointed! The location was ideal, right in the middle of International Drive so walking distance to lots of restaurants and ideally placed to get the local bus up and down International Drive to Universal Studios and Sea World. When we arrived we received a warm greeting from Louis and as it was a Monday, we arrived just in time for the happy hour - free food and drink (including wine and beer) from 5-7pm Mon - Thurs! Perfect after a long journey! The rooms were kept very clean and stocked with plenty of towels. The facilities in the room were also good. The pool was nice but the only downside was that there weren't many beds and the ones next to the pool tended to get splashed! We did go in the Easter holidays though so its possibly not always this busy. The only thing it was missing was a hotel bar so you couldn't buy alcohol outside happy hour, although we had a big fridge and freezer in the room so could buy own own beer and food. The rooms didn't have balconies but this seemed to be the case for most hotels in the area and it would probably have been too hot! The free high speed wi-fi was amazing and meant we could connect via our mobiles and keep in contact with people. The free breakfast was great, lots of cooked food, waffles and cereal but it was a bit repetative after 10 days. It was a great place to crash after a long, fun day - the bed was really comfortable and the room was quiet and because it has a seperate living area and bedroom, you don't feel cramped in a small space for 10 days. Overall, we loved it and would definetly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but a little over-rated”
Reviews.Author: judgeMiddlesex
Reviews.Content: I have tried to submit one review but it didn't appear. Anyway my family of 2 teens, husband and myself stayed here for 2 weeks on April. We arrived very late and were not happy to find the sofa bed unmade and no bedding. We had to make this up ourselves and found the main bed very comfortable but the sofa bed noisy and definately not. However the next day we changed rooms and the second sofa bed wad much better. The other issue we had was the huge noisy fridge but we unplugged this at night and slept well. Staff are friendly, shuttles excellent and many eating places near. The nearest pharmacy/ snack store is Walgreens and the nearest supermarket Publix along Universal Boulavard. Great restaurants are Bahama Breeze, Tony Romas, Friendly's( best coconut shrimp and ice creams!) Cheesecake Factory and Olive Garden. Hotel does decent welcome home suppers and an ok breakfast. Pool has welcome shade and there is plenty of shady parking around. I would give this a higher ranking as a couple but found suite a little cramped for a family of 4. Free internet access was very useful- don't forget to google and download coupons for restaurants and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Stands above the comptetion in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: PalmBeachBuckeye
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 (2 children 9 and 6) and 2 other families stayed at this property for a weekend at Disney and Universal. I live in Florida and travel to Orlando 3-4 times/year and this was my first stay at this property. The location COULD NOT BE BETTER. The Hotel is within walking distance to a Mexican restaurant, Seafood restaurant, Steakhouse, TGI Fridays, Dennys, several pizza shops, 2 walgreeens, 2 minature golf courses, gift shops, and several other specialty shops. The staff was very friendly on check-in and I was even able to get a slight upgrade to a high floor with pool view (king suite) along with a late check-out time (1pm) just by asking. The lobby was a bit small and over-crowded at check-in, but not a major problem. Parking is free and there are ample spaces to accomodate everyone. One negative is that the hotel has only ONE elevator and there is often a fairly long wait ... I would hate to be there if it broke down. The room was very nice and well maintained. There was full sized refrigerator, stove, Microwave (with nite lite) and a full-size pull-out couch. The room had 2 TV's and the master Bedroom had a large king bed. The shower was fine--nothing fancy, but cleaned well. They give you shampoo and body wash and are very accomodating if you need x-tra sheets or towels. The breakfast buffet is THE BEST I HAVE EVERY HAD IN ORLANDO.....eggs. sausage, potatos, hash, waffles, french toast, pancakces, several kinds of breads and cereals, yogurt, pasteries, many kinds of beverages.... and several people re-stock and constantly clean and clean again..... very nice. The pool and jacuzzi were nice and there was a game-room for the kids. I would HIGHLY recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Maucha
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on other peopleÂ´s reviews from tripadvisor and I couldnÂ´t agree with them more.....my stay was perfect!!!! The room was very nice, spacious and clean. The staff did absolutely everything to make our stay more enjoyable. Mario, the hotel manager, was extremely nice to us and so was Angelica. On my next trip to Orlando I will definitely choose this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel..***** been spoiled by this hotel and wouldn,t stay anywhere else..”
Reviews.Author: hannah186525
Reviews.Content: we have now stayed at this hotel twice, firstly in september 2009, then again in september 2010. before i booked our florida holiday, i looked up hundreds, and i mean hundreds of hotels on trip advisor, this did take me a few months to do, with this hotel there were very few complaints, just that someone,s coffee hadn,t replaced in their room, which to be honest ,big deal....so we booked this hotel through a company called flights 2 florida, and they look for the flight that suits you and then they get the accomodation then add them together. we were travelling with an 6 year old myself and my partner. the hotel, really friendly welcome, took us 5 minutes to check in then up to our room. the room overlooked the pool and was very well equipped , with a super large fridge, which i found really handy for making sandwiches up for the parks and also keeping the drinks cool, really wouldn,t like to have stayed in accomodation without a fridge.. at the time we arrived they had snacks on in the evening, which was if i can remember correct, was a baked potato and chilli, with wine, beer and juice. the hotel has a shuttle bus which takes you to epcot twice in the morning, then returns back to the hotel twice at night from the same spot in the epcot car park. the bus runs 8.30 and 10.00 going to the park and 7.15 and 9.45 coming home. we didn,t do universal studio,s, but do beleive they do a bus there aswell. breakfast consists of 3 different cereals, fruit juice, scramboiled eggs, sausages, potatoes, waffles (make your own).. yoghurt, pastries and lots of fruit.. this was a big reason why we also booked this hotet, to save looking for breakfast in the morning elsewhere. we were there for the two weeks and i never got sick of the breakfast, but my daughter did toil near the end of the holiday. the staff... what can i say...amazing **** the staff in the restaurant, so polite and always smiling.. really always smiling and genuinely lovely people, will do anything for you, really make you feel at home.. mario, another plus for the hotel, the assistant manager, always there, smiling again and making sure everyone is getting well looked after. as soon as we returned last year, he recognised us straight away, and made us feel very welcome.. i have visited florida 15 years ago and had a car, but the times staying at this hotel i wanted a break from driving so we had no car. i had such a nice time not having to worry about where i was going and where i was parking. the hotel is situated perfectly for everything. small supermarket, which you can get really all the essentials 5 minute walk from hotel, lots of restaurants on your doorstep. i -trolly which takes you up and down i-drive 1 minute from hotel and costs $1.25 per trip. fantastic show at wonder works, again 5 minutes walk from hotel, really funny, guy called tony brent, does this magic show, and involves the audience, really funny, i honestly haven,t laughed so much in years, with unlimited pizza, salad wine, fizzy juice and beer. i,m not a big pizza lover (always on a diet). and i did worry because the reviews on this place said the pizza was dripping with oil, but i found it really nice and not oily at all. the wine went down rather well as well. i,m sure the price for this was about Â£15 for the adults and Â£10 for a child, really worth the money. i just found this hotel in the perfect area for everything, and with the disney transport, which most of the hotels don,t do as the other hotels only do universal.. this hotel was great for us. we have just been looking at holidays for 2012, but we fancy doing three weeks this time, and going to universal and trying out discovery cove as that sounds great.. so we have started to save hard.. we paid for this hotel Â£43 a night in 2009 then Â£54 a night in 2010.. haven,t got a price for 2012 yet. i hope i have covered everything about this hotel, and if your booking it, have fun...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, superb location, staff utterly brilliant”
Reviews.Author: KevinMcD11
Reviews.Content: Located at 8745 International Drive, the Homewood Suites is right in the heart of pretty much everything you could wish for. Shops only a couple of minutes walk include groceries (to fill the fridge in your room with snacking essentials!), clothing, footwear and tons of restaurants. The Orlando Convention Center is approx a 5-10 minute walk, along the way you'll find numerous attractions including a spot to take a helicopter ride. The Homewood suites, in addition to the complimentary breakfast (which was always fantastic) also provides a free bus service to and from Disney. This is a superb service for anyone going to Orlando specifically to visit everybody's Uncle Walt! What makes Homewood Suites stand out from all other hotels is the staff. Fantastic. Extremely helpful, always ready to help out with whatever you need, I really cant praise them enough. At every juncture they were ready with a smile and a helping hand, no matter what our question. On our holiday in Orlando, we had 3 generation of the family - grandparents, parents and kids. A 2 bedroom suite gave us 4 very comfortale beds, 2 bathrooms, a full kitchen / dining area/living room, 3 tv's.....and a never to be forgotten trip experience. It was truly superb. Something for everyone, no car needed. In summary :- 1. Awesome staff 2. Fabulous facilities in the hotel, rooms great, full kitchen etc fantastic for a family. 3. Disney bus service - saves a bunch on taxis etc 4. Location - walking distance to SO many things. 5. Its in Orlando - always warm!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Very impressed. Free breakfast and dinner.”
Reviews.Author: ktscott01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location during a show at the convention center and I must say I was over impressed. I booked when the show hotels were all booked up and I'm happy they were booked. The hotel was full and it didn't make a difference at all. My co-worker was at the Springhill Suites behind the hotel and his place was empty. Plus they didn't have a evening reception. Chekin Easy, fast and very friendly. The front desk clerk was very nice and we joked. Room I had a corner room so it might have been slightly bigger than the others but it was great. Also I was right across from the elevator and i thought that was going to be a problem but it wasn't at all. They are suites so I have a living room, kitchenette and bedroom. More than enough room if you had a family staying there for a week or so. Internet No problems with the internet at all. And i figured with so many families there it would be slow but I never noticed. Bed Can say the bes was average for a hotel. I've had better and worse. Shower No problems again and I was up during peak times. Hot water and good pressure. Breakfast They have a huge room so there were no problems getting tables at anytime. The selection was the best I have ever seen for a free continental. Evening Reception I was surprised to see the even reception also. Again a great spread plus beer and wine. They had a main dish that would be good for dinner. Taking a family out can be expensive but here you can eat 2 meals that are included. Location Like I said I was fine with the location. They have a lot of close places to eat and I thought the walk to the convention center was easy. My coworker that needs to get in shape complained. Parking Large lot with free parking. Overall This was a great place. If I even head back I'll be sure to book here again!

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Home only better!”
Reviews.Author: Cherpurr
Reviews.Content: From the minute we stepped through the doors we were cheerfully and warmly greeted. Check in was smooth and the arrangement for our room was more personalized than what we had originally planned which delighted us. The suite was a perfect little home away from home-well appointed, the LIGHTING was Marvelous and LOTS of it(most places use those crummy CFL bulbs that you can't even read by)We usually have a hard time getting use to beds away from home but not here -the sheets were SOOOO SOFT plenty of pillows in variety denseness -the mattress was just right not too soft or hard,plenty of options for coverings as needed too. Even the towels were soft what a delight! The shower area well lit and really excellent shower head and the tub was huge. The kitchenette area was very serviceable, full size fridge with ICE MAKER -dishwasher,microwave,stove top and sink plus all the tools to make meals yourself.We truly felt Welcome every day- The mornings included a HOT BREAKFAST-We were greeted with smiles from the manager and staff ,belgian waffles,scrambled eggs,hard boiled eggs,hot oatmeal or grits,sausage patties or links (depending which morning)even the makings for french toast and one day there were even donuts-each morning offered also healthy things like fruits,juices,yogurts,tea,,milks,and the all important COFFEE (regular,decaf and Robust) Yummm In late afternoon early evenings Monday thru Thurs there is a Welcome Home nosh each evening different-Cheese ravioli with marinara, Chicken fajitas with rice and salsa-plus fresh veggies and cheese-Stuffed peppers with mashed potatoes and sides of carrots and peas. There were also offered some wine and I think beer too. Of course soda and juice,coffee and tea and hot cocoa were available. Everyone was friendly and helpful-This location is absolutely the best-access to I-Trolley -restaurants-shopping all in a very close proximity PLUS if look around you can find rides with these bicycle pedalman services which is just what you need if you can't walk another step and the fee is what you tip them how great is that -At the Homewood they also offered in the little service grocery all kinds of things you need most PLUS ICE CREAM!!!! The internet business room was excellent and private and SECURE-the swimming pool and Hot tub were just the right size and temperature-even tho it was outdoors it was in a private area that you could look out on from the dining relax lounge area This will be our choice hotel in Orlando in the future!!!

Reviews.Title: “A HILTON HOTSPOT.”
Reviews.Author: sano100
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the homewood suites on the 15th march 2011 with two friends for one week. The hotel was fanastic in a great location close to bars and restaurants. The rooms have two double beds and large sofa bed with full kitchen. The breakfast was great and complimentry food beer and wine monday to thursday was a real bonus. staff are so friendly and helpfull. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place on I-Drive!”
Reviews.Author: BFMcLaughlin
Reviews.Content: We were here for two nights to access the outlet malls and visit with family, and we needed a place where we could have our twin 1-year olds have a dark, quiet place to sleep while we could relax at night. Homewood was perfect for that. The service was nice, very friendly people. The continental breakfast was very good -- lots of space to sit and lots of variety in the food. The room was just what we wanted, and we got it for 109 a night so we were happy with that rate. Only problem with the room was the TV in the main area wasn't working correctly and we (big Florida fans) had to rig the TV from the bedroom to the one in the main room so we could watch the Elite 8 game in the main area with some visitors. We called about this problem and they said it would be taken care of, but it wasn't. Truly, that was the only problem we had. The wireless internet was extremely easy to use, and the pool/jacuzzi area looked amazing (we didn't have time for that, but wished we had). It was perfect for what we needed, and we'd go again. Parking was easy too.

Reviews.Title: “home from home”
Reviews.Author: GeoffHowell
Reviews.Content: We have been to this hotel 5 times and love it, the staff are fantastic always helpful and very friendly, even the Manager(Gary) makes you feel very welcome and he is always on hand to speak to. The hotel as what they call a complementary breakfast, which is a lot more than the normal breakfast you would get, and the staffs never stop. I would also like to mention Tosie who works on the universal studio desk who like part of the Homewood suite family and very helpful. This year we have booked to go to Las Vegas for our 25 wedding Anniversary and we wish we had not done it on impulse because we really wished we had gone back to the Homewood Suites. We will be going back next year and cant wait.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect "home" for the conventioner”
Reviews.Author: blessedbunch5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 3 nights while attending a convention. The convention center is an easy 15-17 minute walk away. The rooms were clean and well equipped with everything you could need. The beds were very comfortable except for maybe the overstuffed pillows. Breakfast and evening reception were an added value we appreciated...although there were plenty of restaurants within easy walking distance. You definitely had plenty however for a light filling supper (Examples: Chicken parmesan, baked potato bar with fresh veggies.) Area to lounge around the pool was limited but the pool was large and hot tub was perfect. The customer service was noticeable...everyone trying to make sure you had what you needed and were comfortable. I would definitely recommend for the business traveler. Just a quick help: the hotel is situated between International Dr. and Universal. It is not visible from road. It is after the castle but before the Hampton and Marriott establishments as you drive towards the convention center on Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: vbmegs
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 6 days during a trip to Disney and Universal in November. We really enjoyed our stay. The room was comfortable - just big enough for the relaxation that we needed after theme parking all day! My best friend came to stay with us one night and slept on the pullout couch. I wouldn't recommend doing this for an entire week, but it worked for a one night reunion with friends. The hotel provides shuttle service to Disney and Universal each day. Be sure to book the shuttles the day before, especially with Universal, they only offer morning booking times for the following day. We arrived Thanksgiving Day and left the Wednesday after, so we did have a few days where there weren't as many families. The weekday travelers were business people. It was warm enough to swim in the pool one day which was nice but we chose a week day when most families were there because it was way too crowded to swim on a weekend night. The hotel is within walking distance of most restaurants and things to do on International Drive including a movie theater. The breakfast is great, free and full service, really helps with covering expensive park meal costs. We also used the fridge to keep food that we packed for the park each day. The manager's reception at night can be a full dinner if you choose to do that, depending on what they serve. Overall, great trip and nice stay. I would definitely avoid Orlando in general when kids are out of school since the hotel was just utter pandemonium during breakfast times the weekend after Thanksgiving. Although, I'm not a parent, so I can still choose that option.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff - Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: Maeboyce
Reviews.Content: Spent the last night of our Orlando holiday here on International Drive on 14 March. Got a great deal through the hotel's own website - booking all very easyand straight-forward. As we arrived at the hotel at 1.30 (check in not until 4.00p.m.) asked at reception if there was any chance of an early check-in. Extremely pleasant and helpful receptionist who advised our room was actually ready and we could check in immediately. Got bags from car and back to check-in. Checked in by Gary (Assistant Manager) who told us lots about the hotel, about complimentary evening meal and wine and full breakfast in the morning. We were onlly staying one night but made to feel like honoured guests. Also asked how much it would cost for a late checkout next day as flight home not until 7.30 p.m. He checked his computer and for no extra charge allowed us to stay in our room until 2.00 p.m. - what service. Allocated Room 333 (on third floor but ground level is considered first floor). Room spotlessly clean, with small kitchen area, full fridge, small cooker, kettle, microwave, complimentary tea and fantastic coffee and lounge area wtih window overlooking pool, which led through to the bedroom, again with large window overlooking the pool with huge big bed, and ensuite bathroom. We have been lucky enough to have stayed in the past at The Wynn, Las Vegas and the Fairmont, San Francisco and the bed at Homewood Suites gave them both a run for their money - and for an amazing price!!! Evening meal is served every week night from 5-7 (apparently menu changes every evening)and we had hot dogs, salad, chips and a very welcome glass of wine. Staff on duty again all very helpful and friendly and no lengthy queues for food. Similary efficient and friendly service at breakfast where you had the choice of eggs, sausage, bagels, breads, and self made waffles. To sum up, this hotel probably offers the best value in Orlando but the real jewel in their crown is the staff who all go out of their way to make customers feel like VIPs. Well done and no wonder it has received such a high rating fronm Trip Advisor Reviews. Hope and expect to see it comfortably sail into Trip Advisor's Top Ten in the very near future and would thoroughly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY AMAZING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lisacarew
Reviews.Content: OMG!! What a fantastic place. The staff were amazing. A big thank you to Mario,u are an absolute diamond. The suites truly are like home from home with everything you need for a fantastic stay. Already looking to book another stay!! Huge thank you to all the wonderful staff.x

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Service! Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: GNLKWS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this property because we love the Homewood Suites chain. We always know that we'll get great service and the amenities are second to none! During the week nights, they offer a "manager's special" which is a free light dinner (menu changes daily) and complimentary beer and wine! This is such a nice option to have available!
