Their breakfast each morning is wonderful! They have two waffle makers and a hot breakfast including breakfast meat, (sausage, bacon, etc) eggs and a type of potato. Not to mention all of the fruits, cereals, coffee and juices (and even soda for those that prefer an alternate caffeine to coffee.) The rooms are very clean and spacious. They have kitchens in their suites which makes it convenient for drinks or leftovers when eating out! The front desk staff bent over backwards for us to make sure that we had everything we needed and did it with a smile...the customer service far surpassed our expectations. The housekeeping staff is very gracious and courteous. We found that while the hotel was very busy with many guests, it was very quiet and never heard a peep from other rooms, nor in the hallways. This hotel is located on International Drive which has a lot to offer for dining and entertainment! There is just about every type of eatery within a mile and most are walking distance! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the Orlando area for all types of purposes. Easy access to I-4 and the theme parks, while also quiet at the hotel if traveling for business. While my husband and I don't have any children, many families stayed there as well so it was definitely a good fit for all types of travelers. Lastly, they have a complimentary shuttle that will take you to Disney/Epcot. While we didn't need this service, it was a nice amenity to have available!

Reviews.Title: “My reservation meant nothing”
Reviews.Author: typhoonsurf
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton Honors Gold member, I was extremely happy to have traveled from the West Coast to Orlando and upon check in being told that the hotel was overbooked and I am now being put in a really bizarre timeshare that was not within walking distance of anything. I only made the reservation 5 months in advance. Thanks again for my fantastic trip to Orlando

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: susan096
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Homewood Suites, International Drive in May and also in February while visiting my daughter who has been working for Walt Disney World and the staff continue to give excellent friendly service. Good breakfast selection and the evening snacks and drinks are a welcome bonus. Suites are comfortable with fridge, dishwasher, microwave, 2 T.V's, sofa bed and separate bedroom. Trolley stop is nearby so you can get to the attractions easily and tickets for the trolley and attractions are sold in the lobby. The business centre has free use of the computers and printer, handy for printing boarding cards and checking e,mails. Plenty of good restaurants nearby. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends and family .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: OBrienDublin
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, friendly and helpful staff (Luis & Orianna thks), spotlessly clean (maid service was excellent), great location in International Drive especially if you don't want to rent a car. Breakfast included, porridge, cereal, eggs (boiled, omelette or scrambled - varies), fruit (apple, pear, grapefruit, orange grapes), juices, breads (toast, bagle, muffin, danish), make your own waffles (add cream / chocolate). Managers welcome home meal / snack buffet(depending on your appetite) Mon - Thurs, this often sufficed as dinner for us - especially if we were too tired to go out for dinner. Pool area spotless, plenty of loungers and towels. Had 1bed suite, very spacious, just as photos on website. Free wireless internet, many hotels charge $10 per day for this. I recommend Friendly's restaurant across the road for good value food.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER FAILING WITH EXCELLENT SERVICE.”
Reviews.Author: simplybest1
Reviews.Content: I have to say that this Hotel has always maintained its high level of excellent service and has not changed in anyway to my last visit. The Reception was always welcoming and helpfull the staff are always ready to help with a genuine smile should you need any assistance, I can say with all honesty that I thank the Manager and his team for a wonderful stay again at the Homewood Suites, the welcome home evenings with a free buffet with wine and beer on monday to thursday was a nice ending to a tiring day at the parks, breakfast served hot dishes if desired always set us up well for the day ahead. This Hotel is well placed in international drive for all the attractions, with everything in easy reach shops etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: Geoffrey_from_MA
Reviews.Content: We totally screwed up. We booked the wrong homewood suites through hotels.com. We ended up with a reservation at a hotel on the wrong side of Orlando. We called hotels.com to change the reservation, but they said it couldn't be done. Nanci at the front desk was wonderful. She assured us that it wouldn't be a problem, called the other hotel, had them agree transfer the reservation, and then dealt with hotels.com. Problem solved. We love our room. The "Suite" is great with small children, as the adults can talk in one room, while the kids are asleep in the other. It's clean and classy. And it has a real kitchen!

Reviews.Title: “Came for work, but enjoyed family time as well”
Reviews.Author: mommyrants
Reviews.Content: Loved having a huge clean fridge and ice maker. Good dinner buffet. Very responsive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK for business”
Reviews.Author: kristyroot
Reviews.Content: Let me preface the review that something was going on at the Convention center as well as the Daytona 500 was the coming weekend. The hotel was CRAZY busy, and the staff was unable to keep up. I travel for business a lot and was coming from Tampa after my meetings, I arrived about an hour early and was denied check in, even though I'm a Hilton Rewards member. Annoying, and forced me to drive around I-drive making phone calls and keeping busy until their 4 pm check-in. Once I returned everything was fine, but agent forgot to redeem my special rate promotion and I needed to go back to ask. SHe did apologize, but I'm glad I remembered to ask!! Breakfast was just OK, I think sue to the large amount of people and I skipped the receptions all together, once again due to the large amount of people. The rooms were OK, and nice amenities, however the desk is located immediately next to the door. Poor design and found I wasn't comfortable using it. I did find the exercise room adequate, but overall I think the hotel was overwhelmed with the number of travelers. Don't think I'll be back and I'll try to find a hotel better suited to the solo business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Workable hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: UnboundTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a three-night business trip. The room was comfortable, albeit a little worn down, and had a full kitchen. Check what your view will be because outside my windows sat the air conditioner units and a wall. Free breakfast every morning was satisfactory. The usual eggs, sausage, and fruit. The front desk is a little slow. During my stay the three times I had to go to the desk there was always a very long line (even one time at 10:00pm) and they didn't seem to move very quickly. Hotel was clean and employees were very friendly though. There are restaurants and bars within walking distance of the hotel, although if you are going to the theme parks I recommend being closer to them (such as staying on property). But, this hotel would work for Universal or Sea World trips, especially for the price. Overall, if you are in town for a few days and need a good place to stay this will do it.

Reviews.Title: “Great service & location.”
Reviews.Author: KMR317
Reviews.Content: Traveled to area to visit Univeral Studios and Sea World. Hotel conveniently located to both and even offered free scheduled shuttle transportation. Also, plently of dining options for dinner within walking disctance. Room was spacious and clean. Breakfast and the evening reception were a plus. DId have a problem with the key at check in, but the front desk agents were helpful and effient and quickly changed our room. Thanks for a great mini vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, great location and will be back soon”
Reviews.Author: smhlat11
Reviews.Content: Hotel was close to convention center and even closer to nightlife hot spots like Howl at the Moon. Great resteraunts nearby. Breakfast menu was very good and full of options. Room was clean and very comfortable. I will be back in a month.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location!”
Reviews.Author: staciarn01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the HomeWood Suites for business last week. I was impressed with the location off from the main stretch of International Drive. It seemed quiet and was within walking distance of a quite a few restaurants and a couple of stores. The Lobby is nice and the people at the desk are personable. There was only one woman that I recall appearing a little frazzled. I actually asked her to call me a cab to go and workout at the Gold's Gym (1.9mi away) and she directed me to a black car outside the hotel. I truly thought nothing of it until I got in and the driver had no clue where the club was! Thank goodness for my iPhone! Oh, plus the cost for that short trip was $14, even after I asked him if it was extra for the added time it took to find it. So, back to the hotel. I liked my room as it had an open concept 1 bedroom with the kitchenette and the livingroom as you walk in. It leads to a nice king sized bed and the sink over to my left. Then the bathroom which was rather large! The service was superb! They did the few dishes that I had in the sink the whole week. There was never an issue finding your way around the hotel if you just asked. There was a gentleman that I saw at the front desk area (looked like a manager) who was extremely helpful each time I needed something. The breakfast buffet and the welcome dinner in the evening were great! It was nice not to have to worry about going elsewhere to eat when you are there by yourself. Room service is also from TGIF's and another restaurant called the Ale House. I ordered a salad from Friday's for lunch one day. It did take a little bit to get there, so plan accordingly. I would definately stay here again.....maybe when its warmer!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and ran down”
Reviews.Author: katmint
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights during the International Builders Show. We reserved a room with two beds and were given a room with two bedrooms with two beds in each room. We called the front desk and they said it was an upgrade. Upgrade? The living/kitchen area had a sofa bed with fabric that was very tattered. I sat down in the chair, (didn't want to sit on the sofa) and saw crumbs on the floor and under the fridge. Which I wiped up with a paper towel. You shouldn't have to clean your own room!! The comforters on the beds were snagged and ripped. I promptly threw them on the floor, afraid of what might be ON them, and used the blankets that were in plastic bags in the closet. The breakfast was so-so They had a note in the room that said you should go down before breakfast before 8:00 a.m. because after that they would be to busy. Nothing special about the breakfast other than the big room for seating. The shuttle to the convention is not that close to the hotel. You have to walk to another street and then wait for a shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RedstoneAL
Reviews.Content: I travel often for business for several weeks at one location, so I enjoy the Homewood properties due to the kitchen/living room layout that makes it feel more like home. I have stayed at both of the area Homewood properties, and if you put the two of them together you would have a perfect "10". The beds at both are very comfortable. All the appliances worked well, although aged and the positioning of the dishwasher made the door scrub the wall each time it was opened (not good design planning). The breakfast was the usual fare, extended somewhat with powdered eggs mixed with cheese or tomatoes, sausage links or patties, and the ever popular make-you-own waffles. The only disappointment was that the yogurt was heaped into a large bowl instead of individual sealed chilled cups. Bananas were not available everyday either, and why I point this out is that a yogurt and a banana are usually my "grab and go" breakfast. Another minor point is that they use smaller coffee cups and only regular non-flavored creamers. These are very small things but I miss having these items that were at the Homewood down the street. I tried this location this time instead since they have flat screen TVs in the rooms here; although I had to ask for a copy to be made for me of the channel directory, it was nice to have the flat screens for morning news. The workout room was small for the size of the property, but very well maintained with towels and water available, both very nice features. The business center was for the most part, useless. There are two very old and very slow terminals, usually occupied by children playing games while I am waiting to print out my boarding pass. The business center is at the very back of the hotel, and no remote printing is available; both frustrating omissions. I had only requested room cleaning every other day, but still had to ask for dishwasher detergent, or shampoo, as items were not regularly replenished. I don't know if this was due to varying housekeepers, or simply poor training of the staff. I do know this is a minimum expected service that was missing. Also it was frustrating that for an extended stay type of hotel that the laundry facilities were on the top two floors, again at the very back of the hotel. Okay, now for all of its minor issues, the best part is the location. It is set back from I-drive directly behind Howl-at the-Moon and next to the Hyatt Place. You can walk to more than a dozen different restaurants, Pointe Orlando, or the Convention Center from here. This is the best thing about this place, as you don't want to have to drive and park in the I-drive tourist area in the evening unless you have to!!! The layout of the rooms is nice, the people are friendly, and if I stay again I will skip breakfast, bring a printer, and pick a room on the top near the back.

Reviews.Title: “Fan-ta-bulous Stay, Simply Wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: Mr242
Reviews.Content: I previously stayed in a same named hotel at a different location and I was skeptical about staying at this one. But this was a complete turn around to what was expected of it. I came here for a training course and my stay was exceptional. Wonderfull location, excellent staff, clean, hospitable, cozy, quiet and I can go on and on and on. From my arrival at the hotel, everyone one was smiling from ear to ear and called my by my first name, which I really did not mind, it was actually comforting. Down at the front desk there was a little "tuck shop" that had all the little esentials that a travelling person needs. Another plus. I got to the hotel at about 1:30pm and my room was ready. Yes! Ready. I was escorted to my room like some royalty and walked around the room with the bell-man who showed me all the intricacies of it all. Clean sheets, freshly cleaned bathroom, overall room was "very nice". My view was great. The hotel is shaped like a "U" and in the middle was a very nice sized swimming pool. Full view of the swimming pool and the front of the hotel was beautiful enough for me. Free WIFI was offered in all of the rooms which was a major plus for a tech-nerd like myself. The hall ways were cleaned and smelt fresh all the time. There was a fitness room that was least expected but was a very great addition. I worked out every morning before class and every evening I came in. This was just a wonderfull experience overall. Situated on I-Drive, restaurants, attractions, night life were all within 1 to 2 miles of the hotel. Excellent location, excellent hotel. I dont usually rate many hotels like this but this one just had to get it. i slept well, I had fun, i went to class and most of all, i felt safe in the environment i was in. Gatta love it.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous 18 night stay!”
Reviews.Author: wilson2009
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a 9 hour flight from the uk (celebrating our 7th wedding anniversary) and from the moment we checked in (which was speedy and efficient) the service has been excellent. We loved our room which was on the 3rd floor, however we would have prefered a smoking room which was not available. Reception informed us there may be one available in a few dasy and to check back with them. We had a smoking room within two days and all of our luggage / groceries were moved to the other room for us. The rooms are fab, and the beds are so comfy and huge!, if we could take it home with us we would! Great lounge /kitchen area with flat screen tv, also flat screen in bedroom. Bathroom spacious and shower was fab. The location is excellent. On previous visits to Orlando we have always hired a car but this trip we decided not to. There are plenyt of Restaurant s close by lots with lots of variety and one to suit every budget. It is also close to Pointe Orlando. As we didnt have a car we used the complimentary bus service to all the parks, the service is so efficient we never once had a problem, and hey no parking fees in the parks which @ $14 per day adds up! Breakfast very nice and included with room rate, lots of variety. Also the managers receptionl Mon - Thu 5-7pm was a bonus, we only ate at managers reception a couple of times but what we had was very nice. The best things about this hotel: the staff, the bed & the location. I honestly cant think of any bad points:,.....................................nope still cant think of any! Myself and my husband work in hotels and have done for almost 20 years so its an occupational hazard to sometimes be a little more critical than most but this hotel ticked all boxes for us. We deffinately reccommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Everyone was helpful and freiendly.”
Reviews.Author: Vicki12345
Reviews.Content: Good location, breakfast was one of the best. Everyone was nice and friendly. The rooms were clean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel, breakfast and dinner, rooms that bring home to you and great people.”
Reviews.Author: Dame53
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers everything a traveling business person needs. The location provides after hours entertainment, food and refreshments all within walking distance. The rooms are like a mini home away from home and if you don't want to cook for yourself they'll cook breakfast and dinner for you!

Reviews.Title: “this is the hotel !!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mmita
Reviews.Content: Very ."FAMILIAR'. We loved every thing.up there. thanks thanks thanks thanks thanks thanks very mutch for have so nice peple to assist us when away from home. In our case that we are from south america/Brazil

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't of asked for more, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bbotty
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel to enjoy the pleasures of Orlando, great rooms pleasant staff and a buffet breakfast to set you up for the day. Kids loved making there own waffles

Reviews.Title: “so many reasons to stay here”
Reviews.Author: cubitz
Reviews.Content: hi stayed at this hotel for the first time jan 11.this was my wifes choice as it was her 40th birthday & she couldnt have made a better pick. first of all location this hotel is on the nicest part of i drive,totally central ten mins in the car to disney & universal,5 mins onthe free shuttle to seaworld/aquatica/universal. food wise breakfast is free & excellent all fresh & loads of choice. if your not going to the parks theres an excellent dennys on the corner of the block. for evening meal both millers & tony aromas are superb & 2mns on foot. for an evening out try the pirates show or capones on 192. when your all disneyed out & go back early youll find an excellent "help yourself" buffet dinner served mon-thu 5-6pm with complimentary drinks,a nice touch after what can be an exhausting day! to sum up,if you want pretentious flashness look elswhere. but if you want an immacute 3* hotel in an unrivalled location,thats run to a very high standard with attentive but not overbearing service then this is the place for you.factor in the free universal shuttle & inclusive breakfast/early tea & its a no brainer. on a personel note id like to thank Nancy & Gary and team for making our vacation so pleasant & memorable. p.s put the complimentary dinner on fri/sat/sun & you really would be the perfect package! all the very best,& hope to see you soon, regards, Neil & Pauline Tiffin & family, thanks for a great holliday.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat visit!”
Reviews.Author: Eimear99
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Orlando for the second time. We decided to stay again at the Homewood suites having had a wonderful time there 2 years ago. We had a similar experience this time! The location is superb, the staff are warm and super helpful, the availability of shuttles saves a huge amount of money. In addition to this the very wwelcome free breakfast and welcome home reception is great. The beds are really comfie also. It there are any negatives, it would only be that the decor is dated and the pool area gets very little sunshine but overall I can't recommend this hotel highly enough especially for families.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for family group to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jbadgph
Reviews.Content: Had went to Orlando for family event and stayed at the hotel for 7 days and six nights. We had a large group so we needed a suite style facility. Hotel is just off International Dr. right next to another Hilton family hotel. Several restaurants and attractions on International Drive are within reasonable walking distance. Hotel staff was friendly and accommodating. Suites were of good size. Living room and bedroom included flat screen tv's. Bed was very comfortable, sleeper sofa less so. Although to be fair it was no worse than others in comparable hotels. Bathroom of good size, clean and well-maintained with accessories provided. Carpeting starting to show wear and tear and replacement should be considered. Service staff was very prompt about taking care of room needs. Suite included a kitchen area with stovetop, microwave, full sized refrigerator, coffemaker, toaster and dishwasher(w/detergent). It also had silverware, dishes, cups, glasses and cooking utensils. With our group this was very handy being able to keep dining costs down by bringing in food and drinks and preparing meals. For those that do not like to prepare meals, the hotel had a hot breakfast bar every morning with eggs, potato's, sausage, waffles, toast, fruit and cereal, coffee, tea, various juices and soda. Mon-Thur they have a hot dinner bar consisting of an entree, a vegetable, soup and salad, juices, soda and beer and wine(no charge). We found both to be of good quality and value. Hotel has outdoor pool and spa. Did not get to use it much because of cold snap in Florida at the time, but both are well-maintained. Also has decently equipped exercise center. Hotel has shuttle service to Disney parks and others, as well as a staffed attractions desk. The hotel does not have a shuttle to the Orlando airport. Front desk staff provided a secure area for our luggage while we took one of our party to the airport. Prices were very competitive with other hotels in the area and we were very satisfied with the value of our money spent at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons....”
Reviews.Author: Magic1987
Reviews.Content: I will just list the pros and cons because I know everyone is different.. Pros: Great breakfast for free Great location for restaurants Bed was great for sleeping Water pressure was good in shower Reception in evening had an entree, salad and soup and it was free Free parking Free internet Cons: One of the noisiest hotels I've ever stayed at - ie: water running, doors slamming, neighbor noises, etc. - light sleepers beware. Carpets stained and dated in rooms Headboards nailed to walls, very shaky, every time pillow moved it sounded like it was falling off. Metal covers for heating/cooling unit had screws that were loose, making it bang every time it cut on/off - again the noise in this hotel was non-stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SweaterGuy
Reviews.Content: The staff were sensitive to my needs as a business traveler, doing whatever they could to make my hotel experience easy and comfortable. It may not be home, but they treated me like family.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and very nice”
Reviews.Author: TacoMel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Homewood Suites for 1 night while preparing to catch a mid-morning flight the next morning. I was very satisfied with the room, cleanliness, location, and free parking. It is a short walk down International Drive to several restaurants and shopping. Also, via the back entrance (Universal Blvd.) it's only about 15-20 minutes to the airport. I would recommend this hotel and would stay again. The only complaint, a somewhat minor one, was that it took an inordinate amount of time to check out. Part of this was because the woman in front of me was going through every night of her stay seemingly wanting each night charged to a different credit card. When the line reached 4 people deep, the front desk agent called for someone else to come up and help. It was only then, after about 7 minutes, that I was able to hand the key to someone and say "room 415, thanks."

Reviews.Title: “if it's available book it”
Reviews.Author: bettyboop015
Reviews.Content: stayed 1st - 15th Dec on holiday; loved the whole place rooms clean and tidy we stayed in 545 our hse keeper was wonderful. breakfast is buffet stle you can take it back to your room if you wish, good selection of food always fresh fruit available. the waffle maker is fun and easy to work!! transport to the parks regular and has good timings. all staff say "hello" and help out at every need, hi to Marie on front desk - your a gem. we will be staying here again as soon as I can save enough money to go out again. we have been to various hotels in I drive area 6 times now and this is by for the best we have stayed in.ideal for families and couples. partner used the gym saying equipment was to a high standard. do not hesitate to book stay here it really is fab.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: jdmariner
Reviews.Content: Great location. Great price. Friendly and attentive staff. I could not recommend this hotel more.

Reviews.Title: “Homewood Suites is the home of hotels”
Reviews.Author: LSannes
Reviews.Content: The Homewood Suites on International Drive is excellent for families and business travelers. I could not tell you which is better about this Homewood Suites; the staff, the rooms or the location. The Staff is absolutely amazing, they remember me by name, they are always concerned about my wellbeing and how they can make my day better. They greet everyone with a smile. The rooms are very clean, spacious and comfortable. The hotel is centrally located to several tourist attractions and fantastic restaurants. As a business traveler, the last thing I want to do at the end of a long day is get back in the car to drive somewhere for dinner. 2 to 5 minute walk and you can have any kind of food you want; Mexican, Tex-Mex, Sushi, Thai, American, Pub... There is something for everyone! And for those with a sweet-tooth Friendly's Creamery is practically across the street. I will miss the staff at Homewood Suites the most. They are wonderful people and will do everything in their power to make your stay perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, accomodating, and CLEAN!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dkmusicman
Reviews.Content: I found this to be the best Hotel I have stayed at. The Ladies Nancy and Marie who were tending the desk were very kind and very helpful. I own a house cleaning business so I automatically see things like hair in bathrooms. I finally found a place I felt was very clean . I would highly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: shest0n
Reviews.Content: This was on of the best Homewood Suites that I have stayed at! Large breakfast area with plenty of seating, spacious and clean rooms. The staff was very attentive and helpful as far as helping us find somewhere to eat the evening we got in and coming to check on a plumbing issue which was resolved in minutes! I love staying at Homewoods when we travel with kids and this is one I would definately go back to.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like I was at HOME!”
Reviews.Author: flashot
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to share the excellent experience I had at the Homewood Suites near the Orange County Convention center. The place was sparkling clean, the rooms were great and most importantly of all the Staff was FANTASTIC!!! They actually made you feel at home and were genuinely happy to help and make you feel wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: annie1960
Reviews.Content: I give this hotel 10/10 ...staff location everything ...we have stayed at this hotel a few times and are never been disappointed...on our anniversary they scattered rose petals in our room .......in the morning we had strawberries dipped in chocolate hot cookies and a bottle of champagne ... Rooms very clean and the kitchen has everything you would need alkthough all we use is the fridge and the coffee maker ....the cleaner fills the dishwasher Two flat screen tv's and free WIFI Would highly recommend this hotel Annie

Reviews.Title: “Gives you that "at home feeling"”
Reviews.Author: tbresson
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel every other week for the past year. My experience has been unbelievable with the staff, the cleanliness, and the most convenient location to all the attractions in Orlando.The incredible free breakfast in the morning and the Welcome Home light dinner in the evenings has been a Plus. I cannot say enough about the Staff and the truly at Home feeling you get when arriving to check in. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: obuchela
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Oct 2010 and it was perfect in every way , the staff were super,One day by accident we left our safe wide open with all our money on view and arrived back to clean room and nothing touched very honest staff . The breakfast is good but a bit boring after the first week but it will set you up for the day .The shuttles are brill and almost always on time but forget about the IRIDE it's a joke!!! always full and never on time I named it Idontride rather pay a taxi. The Golden Coral is good to eat and the Chinese Buffet is Good TGI is good but a bit expencive the ALE HOUSE is Fab a pitcher of Beer $6 thats 3 pints and the food is yummy big plates Note always fix a price with Taxi drivers they will !!! over charge, the airport run is $39.00 from International dr we were charged $45.00 from the airport saw us comming over all the people are lovley . hope you have a ball

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: SolaraMinnesota
Reviews.Content: Very spacious rooms that were very clean. I was impressed with the room for the price. The pool is small, but I wasn't there to use a pool, so that was fine with me. They have a great free breakfast and even an early dinner during the week.

Reviews.Title: “at least 8/10”
Reviews.Author: elizabethreid772
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at this hotel three times and love it here, the food mon - thurs evening is adaqute yes there does seem to be a lot of pasta meals but the are lots of other meals we have also loved fajitas, baked potatoes with so many toppings you feel spoilt for choice and sloppy joes. we have stayed in appartments where you have to cook for your self this is so much better yes you do have to eat at the meal times but for a restfull time this is the place to stay the staff are only to happy to help the manager is in the resturant every morning and is more than happy to dicuss any little thing you wish to comment or chat about , the room cleaning staff are brilliant and will clean your rooms as much or as little as you wish for all in all i would say this hotel is at least a 8 if not slightly more out of 10 we have stayed in lots of the time share places out here as we own a place in teneriffe/ spain but still adore being here.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday heaven”
Reviews.Author: sepachick
Reviews.Content: we stayed for a week in September, had previously stayed at the Spring Hill Suites so we knew where we were heading. Very impressed with the size of the suite we had, excellent breakfast choice every day. We were never back in time for the free meal at night but the menu looked appetising. Would definietly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “oasis of paradise”
Reviews.Author: lors57
Reviews.Content: We were not disappointed, Standards were excellant, rooms were very comfortable and spacious, plenty of hanging and drawer space. Breakfast was sufficient, never made it for the manager's special. Very well located with everything you need within walking distance. Bahama Breeze, Olive Garden, Miller's, Cattleman, Tony Roma's all close by. There is also a discount available at certain restaurants when showing room key. If you feel like a night in then you can phone out for a delivery. If you are driving then going out via Universal Boulevard was the easiest for getting to Sea World or Universal. I would have no hesitation in staying here again if I'm lucky enough to get back to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent,welcoming, friendly, home from home”
Reviews.Author: Mamii
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 weeks with my husband and 2 daughters 13 and 3, my brother and sister in law and their daughter 3. What can I say? EXCELLENT!! Yes the rooms need a bit of updating and are a bit smaller than they look on the internet, yes the pool is in the shade but none of that matters because the staff make up for these things in spades!! The shaded pool was great for children and the rooms were clean and well equipped. We are a messy lot and we came home to clean fresh rooms everyday, even our dishes were washed for us. The breakfast was unbelievable, so much food and choice and the managers meals Monday to Thursday (free with wine and beer) an added bonus. A BIG BIG BIG THANK YOU from the bottom of me heart to all the staff here for making our stay wonderful. Whatever ye get paid it is not near enough for the service you provide.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: kellhe
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay here. The staff was wonderful and the meals in the evening and breakfast were a great addition.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful and happy Homewood”
Reviews.Author: geebeas
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived,nothing was too much trouble.Rooms are comfortable and clean with excellent maid service every day.Hearty breakfast and afternoon snacks very welcome.Great location with bars and restaurants everywhere.Shuttles to all the parks all included.Management allowed us to keep our room on the last day which was a blessing. We would recommend these suites to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to stay in Orlando.”
Reviews.Author: landocolt45
Reviews.Content: We left the previous hotel I was at (Hawthorn in Orlando on Westwood Blvd) as we were not happy about the service, room or breakfast. When we went to Homewood, we were treated great. I arrived at 9:30 am and asked if I could check in early. They said no problem and offered me breakfast if I wanted it. The suite was beautiful and felt more like a house than a hotel. The bed was comfortable, it had a full kitchen and looked very nice. The free breakfast every morning and free dinner/ wine and beer Mon-Thur was a great bonus. The pool area was nice and the overall look of the hotel was clean and modern. Between the price, location, service and amenities, I would rate this the best hotel I stayed at in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “another great stay at the homewood suites”
Reviews.Author: Sunflower86
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at the homewood suites. They first was at Easter 2008. The hotel is very conveniently located in a quiet area about 5 mins walk from Pointe Orlando. Plenty of choices around for restaurants etc. its in between the Bahama breeze restaurant at the front facing i-drive and the springhill suites at the back facing Universal Boulevard. The rooms are a good size. We stayed in a one bedroom suite. It had a large comfortable kingsize bed and a sofa bed in the living room area. The rooms do have a safe which i always want in a hotel room, but some of the others around this area didn't provide. The kitchen had a stove, microwave, toaster, coffee maker, fridge/freezer and dishwasher. It was also fully stocked with glasses, cutlery, plates etc. There is free use of the business centre which has 2 p.c.'s available and a printer. Very convenient for checking in for flights and printing boarding passes etc. There is also free wi-fi thoughout the hotel. There is a well stocked buffet breakfast every morning from 7-10 with the usual breakfast items and a welcome hotel reception in the Evenings from Mon-Thurs 5-7 serving beer/wine and some food. (i didn't tend to make it back for this though) The staff were helpful and friendly and overall i thought it was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: janeylaney077
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two weeks at this hotel and found it perfect. This was my 7th trip to Orlando so have stayed in a few hotels and whilst this one was not the most plush it was ideal for us. We had a one bedroom suite, the lounge was a good size and the bedroom and bathroom was big. Kitchen was fine and the management had no problem in supplying me a new kettle when I asked for it.On our last day we rang and asked if we could have the room till 3pm and again this was not a problem and no charge was made. All the staff were extremely polite and helpful. Only went to breakfast once and this again was excellent and included in the price. The hotel is ideally located and very easy to get to by using Universal Boulevard. Next door is a Walgreens for a few essentials if you don't want to dirve to Walmart which is only 5 mins drive away. Many restaurants are in walking distance. This is one hotel I would stay in again.

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: andrea197614
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Homewood suites several times and have enjoyed every occasion. The management and staff are always polite and helpful. The rooms and guest areas are clean and tidy. Daily complimentary breakfast and Monday to Thursday welcome home food and drinks again complimentary and of a good quality. Tatiana was most efficent with our booking. Elita the food and beverage supervisor goes that extra mile to ensure guests are looked after. We would recommend this hotel when staying in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Covention Center or Disney-either way- a good solution!”
Reviews.Author: pine129
Reviews.Content: I have had 4-6 extended stays at this location. It is so well situated for the Convention Center that we keep coming back. Great staff- very attentive for a US hotel anyway. Breakfast included and is adequate but often the eating area is packed. Plenty of places to eat and shop within walking distance. Hotel has arrangements with 'taxi' that seem to be above normal meter taxi pricing. I like this place and am happy to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: jaguar_nation
Reviews.Content: While shopping I often refer to tripadvisor.com, and I am extremely glad I did. The choice had been narrowed down to Homewood Suites and another Idrive hotel (where a group rate had been negotiated). I am so glad I chose this hotel over the university's choice. Homewood offered so much more than "the resort" for only a few dollars more (literally). I had no problems from check-in to check-out. My room was very accommodating and clean. The breakfast was a great start to get us into late afternoon. Although I read negative feedback about the pool area, I found it very inviting. Location is wonderful it's accessible to everything as "the resort" was a stretch from the eateries, shopping, etc. Even though we did have a rental car we did alot of walking because everything was so close. We even took the trolley just for the experience. I love this place!

Reviews.Title: “great place to celebrate anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: caldwell1235
Reviews.Content: I came to the homewood suites to celebrate my anniversary with my wife of 10 years, we only mentioned it at checkin with the manager Tatianna and next thing we know their was a small cake, balloons, champagne and orange juice and some small treats with a letter from the staff congratulating us on our anniversary. It was such a sweet gesture. we were not expecting to get anything out it. The front desk recommended Capital grill for our anniversary dinner and offered to make arrangements to get there and back and even made our reservations. The front desk went above and beyond helping us celebrate such an important event for me and my wife. We will definetly be back next year to celebrate another anniversary or bring the kids for a family vacation since they offer shuttles to all the parks!Great Team homewood Suites!!!

Reviews.Title: “An excelllent place to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: AlineSP
Reviews.Content: We certainly recommend this hotel. It was very well located, had a very good breakfast and happy hour time from 5-7pm, monday to thursday. The front desk people were very friendly and help us all the time. The rates were accessible and the hotel in accordance with the price. Not a luxury hotel but very comfortable. The room was very good, clean and it had a well equipped kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, excellent service, good location”
Reviews.Author: BUNNYRANCH
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend reserved a two night stay for my birthday at the Marriott hotel . Upon arrival the clerk at the front desk was arrogant and prejudice. Because of that reason our service was horrible. The next day we called and checked in to the homewood suits Hilton where we recieved excellent service. This was our third time staying at one of your many locations and we would recommend your hotel to all of our friends and family. It's was clean, comfortable and felt right at home. Thank you to the staff and their amazing service.

Reviews.Title: “Watch for extra charges and rude manager”
Reviews.Author: Vacatime23
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was fine (location and comfort of room and bed). My issue, which has been brought to Hilton's attention, was with the cleanliness of the hotel and the management. For example, the toilet seat had dried urine on it. I always bring Lysol wipes when we travel so I did a quick clean up of the bathroom. Also, the third day we were there, we put the little sign on the bed asking for our sheets to be changed. I had called in the early afternoon & asked for our sheets to be changed again due to a stain being on them. When we got back from the parks we found the sheets had been turned inside out! The stain was still visible and in the same spot! I called the front desk and there was no answer and we were exhausted so we laid the sheet that goes on the sleeper sofa on top. In the morning, I called the manager (again) to let him know and he became defensive so I invited him up to the room to see for himself. He claimed he would see for himself and advised he would address it but never made it upstairs, unless he went when much later once we had already left to the parks. The breakfast was good but the same thing every day and we were there 5 days and 4 nights. We traveled with family and I paid for the 2 suites. My mother in law called the front desk to be sure local calls and 800# calls were free- she was told they were. She made an 800 call and I was charged $7! If you choose to stay here, DO NOT use the hotel room phones.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: FloridaHoney
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights - everybody was completely friendly and helpful. They have a Monday-Thursday dinner included in the price of the room - it was great! Very delicious - a full meal, not just chips and salsa. And it included beer and wine, as well as sodas. Their breakfast was equally outstanding. As for the room, everything was clean and neat, very quiet and comfortable. I can't think of one negative about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: arabd
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and 13yo son for five nights at the end of July then for another two nights a week later. The hotel is Very Good overall with nothing really to complain about. The Staff were very friendly and extremely helpful ( esp when we wrongly thought my son had lost his wallet and they repeatedly checked for it only for it to turn up in a suitcase - Doh) We were never around for the evening buffet mon - thurs, but the breakfast was excellent. I'd read some reviews complaining that the choices never change, but considering there were so many different things to choose you would need to be there a long time for that to become an issue. The bed was huge and very comfortable, and the pull out sofa seemed fine as we had to wake our son every morning!! For value it was pretty good if you book direct, and excellent if you book through another site (eg the ones tripadvisor recommend) as we did for our first five nights. The location is great with many restaurants within walking distance. Would def stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Staff went over and above!! Excellent stay!!”
Reviews.Author: jjccboston
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel, was greeted by the most friendly front desk staff, Nancy. (Kudos to her). We had a 2 bedroom suite, with a living area and kitchen, which was great! The rooms were clean and spacious. Bed were comfortable, did not need to use pull out sofa.. WiFi faded in and out - but overall worked well. Cleaned our room on time each day and did a wonderful job. Breakfast each day and Manager's reception (M - Thurs) were exceptional, only had to worry about buying lunch each day.. Pool was clean and the right temp. Asst. Manager was very helpful with questions about the local area - he recommended a wonderful beach on the gulf of mexico, which was amazing. The asst. manager was very attentive to our needs and concerns and acted on the quickly. Would stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “Sleeper Sofa Useless...Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: carma223
Reviews.Content: I chose the Homewood Suites for our recent trip to SeaWorld. We mainly chose the hotel because we needed 2 beds plus a sleeper sofa, and the location was convenient. Unfortunately, the main reason we needed the suite was for the sleeper sofa -- and it was completely unfit to sleep on! The "mattress" was approximately 1 1/2 inches thick, and not even one of the kids could sleep on it without feeling the metal bars and springs digging into their backs! Also, the blanket was probably 20 years old and threadbare -- an embarrassment for a Hilton family hotel. Seriously... I'm not being picky... it was literally "un-sleepable." In addition to this, we had problems with the hot water in the shower. Maintenance came up quickly to fix it, but the "fix" only lasted for about 10 minutes and since it was late, we ended up dealing with cold showers in lieu of packing up and switching rooms. To be fair, I lodged my complaints in the morning with the front desk and asked for a rate reduction. The regular rate was about $125, and they removed $69. While this was fair, I really regret the choice of this hotel and would have been better off elsewhere. (We had previously stayed at the Sheraton Doubletree Suites and that was great.) Management informed me that they are in the midst of upgrading the living room areas, including the sofas, so if you have a reservation and need the sleeper sofa, I'd call ahead and see if they have any rooms already renovated.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding value and service”
Reviews.Author: CaReDo
Reviews.Content: We originally booked for a 10 day break but had to extend to 20 days due to volcanic ash. Couldn't think of a better hotel to stay in. The price/quality ratio was outstanding. Breakfasts were second to none and the suite, while not styled in up to date fashion, was exceptionally clean, comfortable and practical. The staff were responsive and helpful. When a problem was raised with the tumble driers within 30 minutes notices were put up and we were given a full refund. We have stayed in many five star hotels and the service at the Homewood Suites was as good or better. Free shuttle service to Disney parks was excellent, we used it every day. Location is handy for good restaurants, we especially enjoyed Tony Rom's across the road. When we found out that we were stuck due to the volcanic ash cloud, we were given a 10 day extension at a discounted rate which was much appreciated. We booked a taxi to take us back to the airport and were pleasantly surprised that the manager had organised for us to be driven back by George and his stretched limo, which was especially popular with our four year old son. Great stay, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: jbirdtiger
Reviews.Content: I was there on business and most of the people staying at the hotel were families going to the different parks, which was fine. The breakfast was pretty good. I didn't eat at the happy hour but I did have a couple of beers. They are served in keg cups and I believe it is Natural Light, but it was free. Front desk was nice and helpful also. My only complaint is that the bed could use a thick matress pad that I am used to at other Hiltons I stay at, but not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and location. We will definately be back.”
Reviews.Author: Mechanics
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two weeks in this hotel and had to write to praise every aspect of our stay. All staff are polite and courteous at all times. Got the impression nothing would have been too much trouble,(although we never had any reason to require help as everything was perfect). Breakfast is good quality and has cereals, fruit, yoghurts, breads, eggs every morning, hot alternatives, some days sausages, some days bacon etc. Fruit juices, teas coffee, something for everyone. Mon to Thurs is mangers reception, this has drinks, including beer, wine, juices etc. and a light meal. If you have had a big lunch at any of the numerous nearby restaurants, this is enough to cover your evening meal. If not, it is good to keep you going for a later meal. Rooms have cooking facilities if a night of self catering is required. Good size fridge with small freezer in kitchen. There is an ice maker in the hotel, discovered this after buying a bag at nearby liquor store! The living area is comfortable and has a nice plasma with loads of channels. This cannot be heard in the bedroom if door is closed and likewise the tv in the bedroom cannot be heard in the living area. Great if kids want to watch Disney Channel and adults want to catch upon on news/weather. Bedrooms are comfortable and lead onto good sized bathroom / shower area. Good pool, shaded if it is too hot that is welcome. Good whirl poot tub for aching muscles after a theme park day. Small fitness centre ok for a light workout, which is all that is needed if trudging around parks. The trip started out badly in Orlando as our travel agent mixed up hotels, so special mention to Homewood near universal as they arranged a taxi foc for us down to Int Drive. We bought magic your way Disney tickets from Toucan Travel that worked out cheaper than the UK Disney option tickets and 2 park Universal, didn't think we would have enough time for Seaworld, water parks, etc when visiting 4 Disney and 2 Universal parks. We were right! The hotel has a free shuttle to Disney. The shuttle goes to Epcot and you can use Disney transport from Epcot to Magic kingdom, Hollywood Studios and Animal Kingdom. It is really easy (honest, not as stressful as it may sound) and a real money saver. There is also a shuttle to Universal, though this picks up at other hotels and is really busy. This needs to be booked though the Universal desk in reception. It is $15 to $20 in a taxi, less stressful and allows you to visit later in the day. Lynx buses 8 and 42 transfer to no 37 which goes right into Universal for $6 all in tansfer return ticket. Good deal and again not as awkward as it sounds, the drivers announce where to go for the transfer. Itrolley is very busy and does not go too near to Universal, though if you get off at stop 7, it is about 1 mile walk, which is really long if a hot, humid day. Itrolley is good for visiting malls and other attractions on I drive, though Lynx may have better options, I did not fully investigate this option. IOA is currently very busy due to the boy wizard, Magic Kingdom pretty busy, but other parks reasonably quiet due to Harry Potter. Forbidden journey ride is a really good simulator. Fly on a broomstick! Roller coaster fans have to do the rip ride rock it, smoothest coatser I have ever been on. Ron and Roller coatser at Hollywood studios is surprisingly fast and caught us bt surprise, made for a funny photograph though! Nearby the hotel are numerous restaurants, such as Olive Garden, Tony Romas, TGI's, and Miller Alehouse, Don Pablo's Lobster Feats etc etc. also family American diners like Denny's and Friendly's. Also, late night revellers can frequent the Icebar and Howl at the Moon. A late night shop is nearby and a Walgreens that sell virtually everything you will need. Wonderworks is very close as is Point Orlando with more upmarket restaurants and shops and a cinema complex..

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: lananvor
Reviews.Content: Love everything about hotel.Convenient,not expensive.Ideal for family with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodation in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: EasyGoingTraveler77
Reviews.Content: Homewood Suites continues to impress. Tasteful, casual elegance. Large suites that are well appointed. Our family of 5 fit comfortably into a suite. Minor disappointment - the beds were not quite as large as queen size. Very nice breakfast and dinner arrangement. Not cheap, but still a good value.

Reviews.Title: “I DARE YOU TO FIND A BETTER HOTEL FOR THE SAME PRICE”
Reviews.Author: madpartyboy
Reviews.Content: from the start the check in was fast and efficient and from that moment we just we knew that this hotel was going too be special and heres why it was when we arrived to the room after about a hour the reception rung too see if everything was ok and it was thesuite had everything you need fridge/freezer/toaster/coffee maker/microwave/2 ring hob the pool was on the small side but we never seen anyone in it but its florida so there is more immediate things to do rather than a day at the pool the free breakfast was ok sometimes you felt that it was a bit repetetive but it was free and you could that say that of all the all you can eat buffet like ponderosa and sizzler it was free and it set you up for the day there is some sort of dinner but we never managed to get back for it but heard that some guests said is was ok for free the reception staff and management were fabulous always friendly and smiling the housekeeping was even better they were outstanding and deserved the three or four dollars we left for them everyday money well spent indeed we will return to florida next year for sure and we will not even look at any other hotels we will just book this one from the start

Reviews.Title: “You should stay here.”
Reviews.Author: JENNET710
Reviews.Content: Have today returned from 2 weeks at the Homewood suites. What a great hotel in a superb location. The staff are superb, there when you need them, and willing to do everything they can to ensure you have a superb stay. The rooms are good, we had a one bedroom suite (although I would suggest you have a 2 bedroom suite if you have a young family as the alternate sleeping facility also doubles as the sofa in the single). The bed is comfortable and HUGE, and adequate bathroom facilities. The free breakfast sets you up for the day and the nights free buffet will be sufficient on occasion. The pool is great and normally reasonably quiet, so you can have some down time when your feeling exhausted, which im sure you will be. The best part of this hotel is the location though, situated off Idrive, sufficiently to be nice and quiet, but with all ammenieties in walkable distance. Idrive can be very tacky further up towards Sand Lake road, but that is no the case here. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: crin82
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel for 9 nights in February 2010. The weather should have been approximately 22 degrees (75F) on average, but we were having quite cool weather around 60F - this didn't stop us going to the parks etc but it would have been nicer to have had warmer weather for the whole trip, we had about 5 days of warm sunny weather - which was nice. The hotel is in a good location in the middle of I-Drive. I-Trolley stop 21 and 22 are the nearest to the hotel. Point Orlando is 1 block away (approx 3-5 minute walk). There are great restaurants within a short walk - Bahama Breeze, Dennys, Friendlys, Tony Romas, Olive Garden, Houlahans, Sizzlers, Burger King, Subway. TGI Fridays. The hotel rooms were clean and spacious, 2 plasma TVs and a large King Size bed which was very comfortable. We didn't use the pool but it seemed nice, but was shaded for the most of the day. The breakfast each morning was nice but a bit monotonous every day - scrambled egg, cereals, pastries, doughnuts, juice, tea, coffee, toast and bread. It did save us a bit of money though so we did make the most of it. They also did a welcome home buffet Mon-Thurs with free beer and wine, which was also a nice touch and we made the most of this offer too. The staff were really helpful, when we arrived our room wasn't ready but we did arrive a bit early so the hotel took our cases and gave us vouchers to eat in some of the restaurants in the area while we waited. We asked for a late checkout on our last day because our flight was not until 6.30pm and the staff were really good and let us stay until 3pm. There is a universal desk in reception, if you want to go on the shuttle to Universal book on it of a morning at breakfast. I think the pick up times from the hotel are 8.10a.m. and 9.50a.m. and then the pick up from universal is 4.20pm and 7.00pm. The hotel also do a shuttle to Seaworld and Aquatica but we just used the I-Trolley because it gave us more flexibility on the times, and it stops right inside both parks. We bought a 7 day pass for the I-Trolley for $10 each which was worth it because a single journey costs $1.25 - we bought the tickets at the Information Centre which is 1 block away also. Overall we had a lovely time, and would recommend this hotel to people in the future, we would consider staying here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, staff are brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Joolsandlyla
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night only as our hotel was over booked so they arranged for us to stay here - the staff on reception were fantastic - from our hotel manager making the call to us taking 5 mins to get there everything was sorted for us. Rooms were really spacious and fully equipped with everything you would need for a stay in Orlando either business or pleasure. Breakfast was fine for filling up before your day.

Reviews.Title: “Management would walk on glass to insure guest's satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: rwethereyet850
Reviews.Content: This Homewood that is nestled away from it's entrance on I-Drive blew my family away. We only stayed one night using HHonors points (and were upgraded to a 2-bedroom suite - SWEET!) but the staff was extremely nice and you get the impression that management would walk on glass to insure your satisfaction. Although there was a caution regarding the breakfast area filling up fast in the morning, my wife and daughter encountered no problems (and had more than a few delicious waffles). Although we tend to stay away from I-drive when we visit Orlando, this hotel may force us to re-think that position. It's an easy walk to a nearby TGI Fridays (which also provides room service to the hotel!) and not that far down from the downtown shopping center with IMAX movie theater. The beds were COMFY....my 8 year old slept until 10 am after a hard night at the parks. Can't wait to go back and experience this hotel for more than an overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we had more time”
Reviews.Author: bsc4gators
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel via "Name your price" on Priceline. We got a steal! We simply needed somewhere to stay in Orlando as we were driving to Miami for a cruise. This place was great. The rooms were clean and the beds were super comfortable. When we arrived, they had placed us in a smoking room, and without any hassle, they moved us to a nonsmoking room. The breakfast was outstanding. It was a full, hot buffet and was included in the rate. The only think I hated about this hotel was that we had to leave after only one night!

Reviews.Title: “Probably the Best Part of Our Vacation”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoVacation79
Reviews.Content: I have to tell you, after the flight and the nightmare with our rental car, I can honestly say that the best part of my vacation was my hotel. I can't rave enough about this place. It took us nearly three hours to get off the plane, grab our bags and deal with the rental car company, late at night. So when we got to the hotel, we expected another long process. I cannot believe how easy it was to pretty much just go in and pick up the key. The front desk personnel were on their game...all the time. When I spend money, I expect great customer service. This hotel delivered. The breakfast was good..not great, but good, but hey, it was free. The hot tub, probably my favorite part of my trip. You are allowed to go across the way to the Hilton and soak up in their hot tub. Wonderful, absolutely wonderful. I ordered room service one night and it took them no time flat to deliver. All in all, I will definitely be renting another Homewood Suites hotel room in the future. I do highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not great”
Reviews.Author: HelenVancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights and wish we had stayed somewhere else. Pool had no sun at all as it was surrounded by the tall hotel building; whirlpool did not work at all, pullout couch bed was very uncomfortable. Not enough room for two adults and two teenagers. Breakfast was okay but not great. There was the same food every morning and very short on healthy options. Reception food from 5 to 7 was a nice idea but bad food. Staff were pleasant and helpful and general location on international drive was good; close to restaurants, not far from attractions. I would not stay here again and wish we had gone to a better hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again and recommend to others!”
Reviews.Author: kiwi_candy2323
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel great to stay in, it was more like an apartment actually! We stayed in a one bedroom suite which included all amenities such as full size fridge/freezer, stove, microwave, dishwasher, etc. There was also a small dining area next to the kitchen. The bedroom is separate from the rest of the suite which is nice if one person wants to watch tv and the other wants to go to sleep. The beds were very comfortable, the most comfortable bed I've ever stayed in besides my own. I could not find any faults whatsoever with the room. The staff were also very nice and friendly throughout our stay. Every morning a complimentary breakfast was held in the lounge with a great selection of food and juices, we took advantage of this every morning as it was a great way to start the busy day at the parks! There is also a meal available from 5-7 Monday through Thursday which is also served buffet style. This is all included in your stay at the hotel at no extra charge. We also enjoyed being able to go for a swim outside in a secluded area at the hotel, while we were there it was cold for that time of year usually but this did not effect us being able to go for a swim as the pool was heated, so we were delighted! The hotel is 20 minutes from the airport, we decided to get a taxi as we were too tired from our long journey to wait around for a shuttle to the hotel. The taxi cost us $47 so we gave $50 including tip. We thought this was very expensive but after speaking to a family who took a bus to the hotel we were relieved with our decision. They told us that they paid $90 to get the bus to the hotel which also included their journey back to the airport but they said that it took them 2 hours to get to the hotel with all the stops and that the bus driver got lost. The taxi back to the airport cost us $45 including tip so we would definitely recommend getting a taxi as it is only $5 cheaper to get the bus which is a lot more hassle! The hotel itself was in a lovely area and was very central on international drive. There are many attractions and restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. I would recommend going into wonder works as we found it very fun and interesting. Also I would recommend the Ice Bar. You pay $20 each to get into the ice bar, your first drink is $10 and then the pinnacle brand vodkas are only $5 dollars after that! It is definitely worth the money, inside the walls, bar, glasses and seating are all made out of ice and the room is kept at 27 Degrees F. You get gloves and a big jacket to wear when inside. We were a bit disappointed that one of the girls was very rude to us when we were going outside for a cigarette (to warm up!) and told us that we were only supposed to be in there for 45 minutes, this is something we were unaware of as no one told us previously before we went in, just something to watch out for, but otherwise it was definitely worth the money to see this! There are free shuttles to all the parks that we wanted to go to but you need to book your times the day before as there are only a limited number of seats. This included Disney which you get dropped off outside Epcot. If you are looking to go to other Disney parks there is complimentary transportation from this location. There were also shuttles available for the other parks we went to, Sea World and Universal Studios. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is travelling to Orlando, it is worth every penny and is in a great location. I will be staying here again on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - a bit far from Disney but you might like that.”
Reviews.Author: love2ski21
Reviews.Content: We stayed during Thanksgiving Week. It was a bit further than I anticipated but we had a rental car so it wasn't a huge deal. We did use the 'free shuttle' one day but they have a sign that basically requires tips so we decided for the few extra bucks per day to park at Disney, it was worth it to be able to come and go whenever we wanted rather than adhere to their schedule. The drivers we had were very nice and polite. My husband hates to have to wait on 'public transportation' so that's part of it. Anyway, very clean hotel, not huge rooms but way bigger than Disney All Star rooms which we stayed at a few years ago. Very nice, updated. We never got back in time for the Mgr's reception but did enjoy the breakfasts practically every day. Liked the area - upscale and away from the pandomonium of other closer areas. We only went to the Disney resort so if you go to Sea World/Universal as well, this is an even better choice. Stayed w/ my husband and 2 young children (ages 4 and 7). Would stay here again if the price was right. The food freebies are a huge bonus and staff was very, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Base for Disney”
Reviews.Author: TravellinTash
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 wks in July 09. Was really nervous about International Drive hotels as heard some bad stories about them and considering what we paid I was not hopeful! However the hotel was fantastic. I booked a one bedroomed suite for myself and 2 children (age 14 and 10). There was a separate bedroom with a huge kingsize bed and flatscreen t.v. Then a sitting room come kitchen with table and chairs, a double sofa bed and another flatscreen t.v. The rooms were spotless and cleaned daily. The housekeeping staff (all spanish speakers) were lovely and not intrusive. There was bfast included in our package and it really made a difference every morning not having to cook yourself or go out to eat. The food was ok, nothing great but it did the job. It was a buffet style where you helped yourself. Gets really busy after 9 a.m. so get down early if you can! (Beware of the signing waiter, he comes to your table, sings a song and you are meant to tip him!!!! It is hilarious on day one but by day 10 it is extremely annoying!!!!) The swimming pool area was nice and the kids often went for a swim after a long day at the park. It was really safe here and I had no problem letting the children out of the room to play around the hotel with friends they made. The free transfers to and from all the parks was fantastic, always on time and never any problems. The bus drivers were all lovely and its well worth giving them a tip at the end of your trip as it was such a relief to have a hassle free service for the 2 wks. The hotel itself is in a prime location on International Drive(what appears to be the cleaner end of the drive), right beside Walmarts and there is a small outdoor shopping centre 5 mins walk with a cinema, a hooters bar (food is great here and its child friendly) and some nice shops mainly Victoria Secrets and Hollister. Lots of other bars and restaurants within 2-5 mins walk. The IHOP bus service goes up and down the drive regularly and is a fantastic way to get to the shopping outlets, there is an outlet at each end of the drive. Would defo go back here was not expecting the service and rooms to be as good as they were considering the price we paid. Contact the hotel directly for best deals.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: ericdetwiler
Reviews.Content: One night stay with a hot breakfast in the morning. Got a great priceline room and a clean room. Very quick internet access with no resort fee! Nice

Reviews.Title: “Based on this experience I will definitely be more inclined to stay at a Homewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: e065702
Reviews.Content: Keeping in mind that I had just spent the better part of 2 days on the road with a grupy spouse, an ADD teenage boy and 9 yo girl that is apparently the center of the Universe, this stay was right on spot. We arrived at the hotel in the late evening. Check in was a breeze, the staff exceptional, and the lobby was really nice. A good start, but certainly not the highlight. Once we got to the room we were even more pleased. The room was really clean and had the amenities (and more) one would expect in a Homewood Suites. 2 t.v.'s, a dinner table a full fridge, dishwasher, stove to burners, microwave, etc. The rooms were, well, roomy, the showers hot, plenty of towels, pillows, etc . . I could go on and on, but I don't see the point . . what nice accomodations. My only observation was that the carpet appeared to have a couple of cigarette burns in a no-smoking room. A small thing that really had no bearing on my stay. After all can you really expect a hotel to replace an entire carpet just because one jerk decides to be inconsiderate? I certainly don't think so, and since the room had NO smoking odor this was a non-issue with me. The beds were really comfortable and the room exceptionally quiet. Being a light sleeper this was a great benefit. Both mornings we woke up the breakfast bar was packed, and for good reason. Without a doubt this is the best breakfast bar I have ever had. Please keep in mind that I am VERY mindful of cost, and the facilities I stay at reflect this. But never the less - wow. As crowded as that bar was, the staff never let the food run out, and there was plenty of seating. Also, if you want to eat away from the hotel there are 20 restaurants within a 5 minute walk, so knock yourself out. Being a Hilton Diamond VIP I am exposed to a lot of diffferent hotels and it is clear that the management of this property is serious about their business, making travellers comfortable and welcome. Kudos!

Reviews.Title: “great location on I-Drive”
Reviews.Author: tianjin2005
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in early September 09 with my sister in law, and very quickly realised that we had chosen a hotel with a great location for getting around Orlando, especially if you don't have a hire car. The I Ride Trolley stops just a stones throw away from the hotel in both directions and if you buy a 7 day pass, it is by far the cheapest way to get around the main "non-Disney" attractions in Orlando, such as Sea World, Aquatica, Discovery Cove etc. The hotel itself had everything we needed, given that we were not in the room too much - we had a one bedded suite, which had a double bedded room with en-suite bathroom, and a seperate lounge / living area with a small kitchen area and dining table. We didn't cook anything in our room, as we ate out all the days we were there, so can't comment on that side of the facilities. The hotel is VERY close to some great eating places such as Tony Romas, TGI Fridays and a fab Mexican place literally around the corner (can't remember the name). Hotel has a small pool in the central courtyard, which was quiet most of the days we were there. Breakfast was good, given that it is included in the price, however only thing that bothered me was the fact that you had to eat from plastic disposable plates and plastic knives and forks - easy to dispose of when the staff clear up and I guess saves on employing staff to do dishes and washing up!! On one of the mornings we were there, one of the waiters walked round all the tables and asked if you wanted a song to be sung, and once he had a recommendation, he would launch into full song - and a very good singing voice he had too !! Made for a lively and different breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Love the space in the 2 bedroom suite”
Reviews.Author: steelersfan4ever
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Dec 27 - Jan 2. We had a 2 bedroom suite which worked out beautiful for us. I agree that the room could use a little updating. The staff was very friendly and kept breakfast buffet very well stocked, One computer was down in the business center the entire time we were there. If I was going to be in the area again I would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dorothy35
Reviews.Content: stayed at the homewood from mid dec till 4th of january this hotel was fine stayed with my husband and daughter aged 7 the staff are really friendly and helpful. the room was good too, only thing i would say is my daughter slept in living area on sofa bed and the aircon is noisy you can book a room with two beds in bedroom area which would have been better may cost a bit more but def worth it especially if you have 2 kids would be a squash in that sofa bed (not the most comfortalbe) the kitchen area was great a large fridge freezer micro cooking rings dishwasher and cupboard space. the free breakfast in the morning was great saved us a lot of money . we havent been to florida for ten years and saw a big difference in the price of things a lot more expensive prices a bit like home now. this hotel also offers a free bus to disney universal and seaworld which is great but be on time as they wont wait for you. we took a few taxis home and this adds up to but if you use the i ride bus they can drop you at a stop to get a lunx bus to disney etc which saves lots.. the drivers on the i ride bus are helpful too. the pool is fine heated but was still toooo cold for us in december it was real chilly. this hotel was good situated just 2 mins walk to international drive where all the food and shopping was. we bought a 2 week pass for the i ride bus which can be bought from the universal desk at the hotel they sell everything apart from disney stuff. i bought most my tickets before we went but would not again would just buy as i was doing as we bought a 3 week disney pass and did it all in a week .

Reviews.Title: “Very old and outdated rooms”
Reviews.Author: IronBird0
Reviews.Content: I did not like this hotel as it did not live up to my usual standards for a hotel belonging to the Hilton chain. I had issues that still remain unresolved with management to this day (still waiting on award points) and I will not stay here again. My repeated calls to management go unanswered along with all my voicemails asking for a call back. Although the rooms were clean, I am used to a more updated and renovated room style. I'd say this hotel is on the older side and not what I am used to.

Reviews.Title: “I don't understand.....”
Reviews.Author: BensAdventures
Reviews.Content: After reading all the wonderful reviews this hotel got, I had a really positive feel about spending a week there. Unfortunately, after leaving I still don't understand how this could possibly be a highly rated hotel in Orlando. Maybe the general quality is low, making this hotel seem better than it is. The rooms were large, but so dated. The breakfast that was raved about was appalling. The eggs had to be powdered, and everything else just looked inedible. The apple juice was good though... The free wireless and parking were great and much appreciated. I write a lot of reviews and I've just spent nights in four other hotels, all of which I'll rate highly, so that is why I feel for the first time, let down my tripadvisor. A note must be made, if you are traveling with a family and you get a cheap deal, but discount this hotel, just don't expect too much!

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Orlando Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SilverStar092
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel on a few prior occasions, we were delighted to have the chance to spend a night on our way to Miami before Thanksgiving and again a few nights later on the return trip. We were greeted warmly upon arrival both times and the staff went out of their way to greet us each time we passed by. On our first visit there was an air conditioning issue and the front desk had us moved to an adjacent suite immediately. They even sent up the key to us rather than expecting us to march down to the lobby. Everything was in perfect order after our move and they even had someone work on the original suite's a/c soon after we moved. (So many hotels expect you to wait and be uncomfortable.) On our return trip we had a 2 bedroom suite which was ideal for all three family members who each had favorite TV shows to watch. Everything functioned perfectly in this suite. The suites were quiet which helped after a long day in the car.
