The breakfast buffet was well maintained on both visits and we were impressed that they had 3 waffle makers for guest use and when the bowl of bananas began to approach depletion, an attendant refilled the bowl with fresh bananas. He even removed one that didn't meet his approval which is unusual as many hotels leave out bananas that are way past their prime. There are lots of restaurants and activities near this hotel yet its location a block off International Drive makes it feel secluded. We recommend this property heartily.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: rosyg
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 18 nights, it was the perfect hotel for us. Shuttle every day for disney, universal and sea world. Two minutes walk to international drive and surrounded by good restaurants. Good breakfast every morning and the most important, very clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: anbiff
Reviews.Content: as a family we have stayed in florida many times in the last 15years and would have to say this is one of the best we have stayed in as for making you feel welcome it gets 10out of 10 it is sutable for all couples or familys it has everything you need to have a great holiday we will be staying here the next time we go

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: CarolBruce
Reviews.Content: We spent the last 2 weeks there, 14 of us in total stayed at the hotel, it does not have a bar, but you have a fridge in your room and can buy drinks locally to keep cold and drink in the communal area (were breakfast is served) which is great, it is a really great hotel cannot fault the facilities and the cleanliness of the rooms, excellent staff on duty at all times, (some grumpy staff on the Universal ticket desk, but they dont belong to the hotel), free shuttle buses to Universal and Disney, breakfast was very good, and free evening snacks, beer and whine Mon-Thurs, will definately be going back .

Reviews.Title: “10 Out of 10 HOME FROM HOME”
Reviews.Author: Wildrover4711
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 10 days at the Homewood Suites International Drive. November 5-14th. We loved it. Had a great time. Couldnâ€™t fault anything with this hotel - Home from Home. The staff were very nice and approachable. Rooms cleaned and towels changed every day, Sitting room/kitchen and separate bedroom. Large Plasma TV in each room with about 30 channels. Leather Suite, excellent quality furniture, carpets and drapes. The kitchen had everything Microwave, 2-Ring Cooker, Dishwasher, Large family size Fridge/freezer with Ice making machine inside, Iron and Ironing Board. Bedroom had the most comfortable Queen sized bed and pillows I have ever found in a hotel. Air Con - Ceiling Fan â€“ Hairdryer. There was a small fee for use of the safe, about $1 a day. Hotel had Computer room for guests with free Internet and printing. A Laundry room and Gym. The pool was very nice but not good for Sun bathing as it was in the shade most of the day. But guests could use pool in sister hotel just next door (Hampton Inn) that had a very sunny pool. Free buffet breakfast, selection of cereals, nice breads, fruit, toast, yoghurts, muffins, and a waffle machine. Some hot food Scrambled Eggs, Fried potatoes, Corn bread, Tea, Coffee, a selection of juices and soft drinks. If you didnâ€™t fancy that, thereâ€™s an abundance of restaurants in the area to buy breakfast. Thereâ€™s also the Managers Welcome Buffet on Monday to Thursday 5 â€“ 7 p.m. with a selection of FREE foods, e.g. Pasta, Salads, Meatballs, Potatoes, Barbecue stuff, Beer, Wine or Soft Drinks. We only went to this once, but it was nice to relax after a long day in the Parks or Shopping, this would be ideal for hungry kids. Large selection of restaurants, a supermarket and 24 hour store called Wallgreens less than 5 min walk. Some restaurants (Ponderosa Steakhouse) had eat all you want buffets, we found the food in the TGI Fridayâ€™s excellent, and it seemed to be very popular with families. We had planned to hire a car but it wasnâ€™t necessary. We spent the first couple of days visiting the Theme Parks; the hotel provided free transport to and from Universal Studios â€“ Seaworld - Aquatic and Wet nâ€™Wild. The I-Ride Trolley bus runs the length of International Drive. This will take you to the 2 main Shopping areas, Prime Outlets and Premium Outlets. All journeys cost $1.25, or you can buy a 1, 3 or 7 day passes, you can hop on and off for $4 a day. We found this hassle free â€“ no getting lost, looking for parking, parking fees etc. There were only two places we had to get a taxi to - Walmarts and Florida Mall. You might have to hire car to visit Disney. Iâ€™m sure you will find cheaper Hotels, but the money you save on Breakfast- Evening snacks and Free Shuttle is fantastic. Would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely visit again. Shopping Tips. If your looking for bargains then you canâ€™t go wrong with Walmarts, they carry all the official Disney merchandise and Orlando gifts, open 24 hours. Check out Ross Stores and T.J. Max (I Ride stop No. 4) before you go to the outlets, great value for marked down designer handbags, shoes and clothes. I picked up a Jessica Sinpson bag for $59. Google the shopping malls before you go, most of them will allow you to register online or print voucher for VIP Coupon books. Then you can print or pick up Coupon Book from customer service, this will give you an extra discount on top of whatever discount the shops are already offering. Sorry to ramble on, but we had a Super time. Pauline Ireland

Reviews.Title: “great stay at homewood suites”
Reviews.Author: mcelhinneyrach
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Homewood suites, international Drive for a week in November. There were 14 of us there for a family weeding and had an amzing time! The hotel is a great holiday base and i have no complaints at all. Staff were very friendly and really helpful, the rooms were clean and had everything you needed. There's complmentary breakfast each morning including cereals, pastries, toast, waffles, scrambled eggs susauges etc....something for everyone! They also provided complementary dinner monday - friday which was a basic but unexpected which was great. Free soft drinks and at dinner time wines and beer. The location of the hotel is great, plenty of shops and resturants close by. We had park tickets for Universal studios, islands of adventure and wet n wild which are all great! The hotel provides FREE shuttles every day at 8.40am and 11 something and to pick up from the parks in the evening. Only takea about 10 mins it's a great service.There's no bar in the hotel but they don't mind you bringing your own. There's a computer room, gym, swimming pool - it has everything you need! I would definatly stay here the next time I go to orlando - its great value for money and a great location!

Reviews.Title: “glad I read the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: SpearoHawaii
Reviews.Content: Stayed there November 3 to the 8th. Perfect location for people going to the convention center. Plenty of free parking and the free breakfast was perfect for me to save time before going to work. : [ More than I have ever had for free at any other hotel. Staff couldn't have been more accomodating. I will stay there every year when I go for work. Plenty of room to work, lounge, sleep in the suite. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: claregirl86
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel from 05th September until 15th September. After a long flight we were glad to finally get to the hotel and were greeted by really friendly front desk staff who couldn't have been nicer. We were only in the room a few moments when the first desk called to make sure everything was ok for us - which was nice and doesn't happen very often!! The room was spacious and clean, the kitchen had everything you need if you planned on cooking and a big fridge/ freezer. The bedroom was also big and the beds were really comfy to sleep in. The hotel was very quiet at night and never had a problem with noise from another rooms etc. The shuttles to the park are really handy and are a great addition, also the shuttle in the evening to Universal is great on the way out - but beware on the way back it can often take up to an hour with all the drop offs so you might be better off paying the $10 for a cab! The area around the hotel has some good restaurants to eat in - would recommend the Olive Garden and Millers Ale House for drinks! Pointe Orlando also had some good places but didn't try many of them. Its very handy for the I ride trolley too just beside stop 21 on the north bound route and stop 22 on the south bound route. The breakfast in the morning has a great choice and sets you up for the day. We used the pool a few times after we got back to the parks and it was quite warm most of the evenings. All in all it was a great place to stay and would definately stay here again due to the location, the facilities and the friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Another good stay”
Reviews.Author: dell08
Reviews.Content: We returned for the second year in a row and had another excellent stay. The hotel is clean and well run and the staff are helpful and friendly. If you are after a holiday around a pool look elsewhere - the pool is small, generally in shade and in a central courtyard. The suites provide space and flexibility not afforded with normal hotel rooms. The one bedroom suite has a very comfortable kingsize bed and whb/vanity unit within the bedroom and an en-suite (bath, shower and wc). The lounge has a well fitted out kitchen with a full size fridge/freezer, dining table and chairs, sofa bed and single leather chair. The lounge and bedroom have large flat screen TV's. Towels are changed every day - although there was some problems this year with the laundry but a quick call to reception and fresh towels arrived within minutes. The complementary breakfast sets you up for the day. It can become a bit repetative by the end of 2 weeks but a least you can still have a bowl of ceral and a coffee. The most annoying thing this year was the introduction of a theatrical singer who went around the tables asking the diners if they would 'like a song'. A nice chap but the booming voice was a bit too much at that time of the morning - I think the hotel should have a re-think!!! The hotel is well located between I Drive and Universal Bollavard close to several good restaurants. Within a short walking distance are Bahamma Breeze, Olive Garden, TGI Fridays and several others in the Point complex. Also relatively close by are the usual establishments like, Subway, Sizzler, Ponderossa, Pizza hut, etc. The crazy golf course 'Pirates Cove' complete with water falls etc is within a few hundred metres and is well worth a visit. Wonderworks is also just around the corner. The hotel is located between Sea World & Aquatica in one direction and Universal and Wet and Wild in the other (a couple of miles both ways). Ideal for those purchasing the Flexi Tickets. However Disney is around 10 miles away and you may find this distance a bit of a drag (like we did) if you intend going on a regular basis. The hotel represents very good value for money but while it may have the Hilton name it is not 5 star. If you get a good rate I would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay at Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Travelling-Argie
Reviews.Content: I've stayed 3 nights in Jan 2009. The hotel is good overall, with a superb location near everything. We booked a 1 bedroom suite with sofa but when we opened the sofa there wasn't too much room to walk around. But besides that, the room was what we wanted. The breakfast as always the best and the evening dinners excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Third Time And Still a Charmer!”
Reviews.Author: suzieb78
Reviews.Content: Myself and my hubby stayed in Homewood Suites for 10 nights from Sept 20th to Sept 30th this year. This was my 3rd time at this hotel and my hubby's first time. I have to say I cannot fault the place and would go back in a heartbeat. Check in was a breeze we asked to be placed in a non smoking room and overlooking the pool, we received this without any hassle an nice room on the 3rd floor.The staff were all very attentive and friendly and nothing was ever too much trouble. The room was clean, the bed very comfy and the cleaning staff were very good with the room being tidied everyday and clean towels delivered everyday. The room is very equipt with large fridge/freezer, microwave, hob, dishwasher and all the utensils, though we didnt use them as we ate out so much and breakfast is included! Breakfast was served every morning 7-10am and had a good variety of food, enough to fill anyones belly. The Managers special is a treat, Mon-Thurs from 5.30-7.30 there is wine/beer and a different menu everynight so you have a bite to eat. It was great if you had just come back from a park and didnt fancy heading out for dinner after a big lunch and again the staff were fantastic. Some people have complained about the pool, I found the pool was good, its not huge and there is not alot of lounger space, but we never had a problem getting a bed as it was always very quiet. Lots of little geikos running around, really cute and meant no insects !!! The pool was closed one day during our stay from morning til 5.30 whilst the repainted the whole area, it did not bother us as we were out to a park, but they had arranged use of another hotels pool for those who may have wanted some pool time. There is a gym which i didnt venture to as i did enough walking round the parks, the laundary facilities are based on the 5 & 6th floors and were adequate, i didnt have to worry about bringing home aload of washing which was great. There is a business centre which is good for checking flights etc, we found this useful as we didnt bring a laptop. This hotel is only rated as a 3 star compared to a 3 star here in Ireland it should be at least a 4/5 star. It is in a great location close to Pointe Orlando and lots of good restaurants nearby, it saved us money as we had breakfast included and the managers special and also it had complimentary shuttles to all the parks again saving us a packet! I would recommend this hotel whole heartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for family and couples who do not wish to drive.”
Reviews.Author: livingthedreamUk
Reviews.Content: This is the last day of our holiday and are still in the hotel but feel we have to share our hotel experience with you. Rooms - clean, very comfortable beds, fridge,microwave, dishwasher, and small kitchen with all the utensils you will need. 2 x 32" LCD TVs, one in master bedroom and one in kitchen/living area. Also a sofa bed in living area which we have used for our 9 yr old daughter. Maid service daily with a change of towels (and you get plenty of them). Hotel staff - Mario the asst. manager has been mentioned a few times in the reviews and we can agree and also add he and the rest of the staff we have had the pleasure to deal with have all been fantastic and very professional. We wanted to buy a laptop whilst here in Orlando and asked Mario's advise on where to go. He had no idea but within a minute he was on his phone to his nephew for advise. He also arranged for reception staff to print off details and had them delivered to our room. What more can you ask!!!!! Plus points - Monday - Thursday welcome home refreshment 5pm-7pm. This includes as an example Monday - shredded pork accompanied with salads,soup, crisps, pretzels etc..... Wine , Lager, soft drinks and coffee. Tuesday - Hot dogs and as above. Wednesday - fajita chicken etc, Thursday - rotisserie chicken etc. This can be a big saving for families. Breakfast - every morning (Between 7-10 am) and consists of scrambled egg, Sausage , fried mini potatoes, cereal, toast, muffins and waffles. Coffee, tea and fresh fruit juice. Again we have found this a real saving. The hotel also offers free Internet access in room and also has a separate room with two computers for guest use and this is free with your room key. Please note there is free transport to the theme parks. Universal studio's leaving at 8.25 or 10.50 am returning at 4.20 or 7.10 pm Disney leaving at 8.20 or 10.20 am returning at 7.15 or 9.45 only. This we found can be a long day and would have preferred an earlier option !!! Swimming pool - we read reviews about the pool.It catches the sun from 10.30 but is gone by 2.30 ish pm, otherwise the pool is clean and there are pool towels provided. Today we asked reception if we could keep the room on until 4.30 pm and they agreed. no problem and at no charge.We have asked this at other Hotels and have charged for this option. Overall an excellent hotel, Professional staff and would highly recommend a stay here !. p.s...On a totally different note, Flew with VIRGIN and never again.Staff not helpful ( a smile would be nice ). Food, no choice at row 37 !!!!!! no lager left 3 hours into flight ( so much for free drinks only one offer of bar service ). Leg room = shrinking Children's meal = awful movies are not on demand they run at intervals RICHARD needs to get a grip on this !!!!!!!!!!!!! and FAST....Take a look at BMI if only they flew direct to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Very good accommodation”
Reviews.Author: nb1975
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 mights, we booked with travel republic and paid about Â£48 per might. I really enjoyed the stay - the area is great, with loads of places to eat and drink around. We used the shittles a few times with no issues. Only downside is the times of the ones coming home, don't co-incide with seeing fireworks etc at Disney, but a very minor thing. They even have shuttles for CityWalk that would get you home after a night out. Breakfast and evening mean Mon-Thurs was good. We didn't use the pool, but it looked fairly quiet most times. Room was great, housekeeping was good. I would definately consider going back there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: weew
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 6/10/09 until 20/10/09. From start to finish it was fantastic. The suite was spotless, the bed was fantastic. The free breakfast was great as was the Managers special Mon - Thu evenings, free beer and wine! The reception staff are an assett to the hotel and helped us out with every little question we had. I would definatley go back here to stay and hopefully will be in a couple of years!! My advice - book homewood, you wont be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: gribbo78
Reviews.Content: this hotel is fantastic value for money, it is in a great location and I would say five of orlandos best restaurants are with in a five minute walk. The room are spacious with cooking facilities . There is a free shuttle to the parks although we drove and they were only five minutes away. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in orlando

Reviews.Title: “Good luck beating this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: szwright
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned to Orlando for the 1st time in about 12 years. We have grown accustomed to the amenities of a suite vs. a plain hotel room. We read the online reviews of this Homewood Suites and wholeheartedly agree with the positive reviews. We also read the negative reviews and have a hard time understanding their point of view. We were satisfied beyond expectations with this hotel. We visited Orlando for the Disney and Universal parks, and a work-related conference. After researching many Orlando hotels online, Homewood Suites on International was our choice for several reasons- the reviews from other guests; the proximity to our destinations; our preference over a suite vs.a plain room; free and good breakfast; walking distance to several restaurants and Pointe Orlando. During our stay, I saw the manager (Mr. Rodriguez) at the breakfast area several times. He usually had a cup of coffee in his hand and a smile on his face. It was nice to see that the manager took a personal interest in something as mundane as breakfast for his guests. As a totally subjective comparison -- we moved to the Grand Cypress Resort for a conference after staying at Homewood Suites. Totally different vibe at GC - beautiful hotel, different level of accommodations, amenities and prices. Grand Cypress has a lot to offer. But I will, without a doubt, return to Homewood Suites the next time we visit Orlando. My wife and I are still debating if Grand Cypress is worth the cost, even though we really like golf, tennis, canoeing and riding horses. IMHO

Reviews.Title: “absolutely amazing”
Reviews.Author: pusEwloe
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my holiday to florida with my husband, 8 year old son, my mum and step dad and this is the second time I have stayed at this hotel and all I can say is that it was absolutely amazing. Upon arrival of the hotel we were greated by a friendly receptionist who sorted out our room as quickly as possible. I had rang up the week before my trip to arrange the particular room that I required and they met my requests so it was perfect. The first thing you notice when you enter th hotel is the lovely clean smell and the friendly faces. When we entered our room it was spotless!!!! The only down side is that the room was not as big as last time we stayed and there was three of us living in the room but that didn't matter because in the day we put the sofabed away so there was plenty of space for us. The breakfast in the morning was fantastic, just what you needed to start the day with all that walking. My son particularly loved the waffle machine. Evey morning one of the hotel managers would great us and ask how we were. The only down side is that the swimming pool does not get a lot of sun so you have to pick the best spec at the right time to catch the sun, but to be honest this time when we went it was hotter then ever so we spent most of the time in the pool cooling off!!!! The room maid was lovely and cleaned our room everyday and put the dish washer on with our dirty glasswear. The best part of the room though was the MASSIVE COMFY bed. It was the best bed ever and I bet you could get four adults in it. The location was fantastic. It took five minutes in the evening to walk to the restaurants so you did not have to drive anywhere. The day before we left the manager of the hotel personally rang us to see how our stay was which is a nice touch. The only tip I will give is that you get a lot of take away leaflets posted under your door and DO NOT ORDER from any of them as they are a con only order from the take away menus which the hotel provides in your room. Flippers is the greatest!!! overall I would recommend it to anyone it was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service, location and standard”
Reviews.Author: gkbrownie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites in early Sept. I thought i had booked the Suites on American Way but was glad i hadn't, these were excellent. Just set back 100 yards from Inter Drive in the better part of I-Drive, close to everything really, very central. The check in was quick and polite and the room was very clean with everything you could need, iron, freezer, cooker etc. The day we arrived the management rang to see if everything was ok, we needed a few more Hangars and they brought them immediately, how many places ring to check if you are happy. Everyone morning there is a FREE breakfast, yes Free, and around 5pm there is another special meal with Salad etc. and Wine and Beer, this is also free. Brilliant if you have been at the Parks all day and need something to put you on for the evening meal. There are free shuttles from the Hotel to some of the major parks a couple of times a day which makes it easy to get around. This Hotel really tries hard to exceed your expectations, excellent !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again A+”
Reviews.Author: Richard_Mas
Reviews.Content: Well, having read countless reviews and finding this Hotel highly positioned within the Trip Advisour list I decided to give it a try. Thankfully I was not disappointed. I arrived late on a friday evening after a good few hours travel to be welcomed in to a bright and cool entrance. After a quick check in we heading to the rooms (Suite). First impression was excellent, spacious and well equipt, ideal I thought. The next morning we heading for an early breakfast, this was good also, not the continental I was expecting but no complaint from me, plenty of choice so most tastes should be happy and plenty of it also. Headed out for the day to come back to a cleaned room with coffee re-stocked. Now had a chance to explore the hotel a little, from one or two of the reviews expected the pool to be a little smaller but I thought it was pretty generous especially when considering the number of rooms. Gym was ok (3 running machines, 1 bike, 1 cross trainer and an selection of dum bells) but for me could have done with a 'multi gym' style weights machine but not real a problem just a prefference. During Monday - Thursday Evenings the complimentry food and beverages is a nice touch, a refreshing start prior to heading out for a bit of evening entertainment. Location was ideal, set back from the main roads ment it was quiet from both traffic and public which I liked. Its not within walking distance of the theme parks but they have a shuttle (I hired a car so did not use). Plenty of resteraunts near by and Ripley's / World of Wonder / Mini golf / Point Orlando Shopping & Cinema are within 10 / 15 mins walk for a bit of evening eintertainments. If I have the oportunity to visit Orlando again this hotel will be on the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Kalbany
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this property for 10 days in May on a mixed business/pleasure trip. The hotel was very central with a wide variety of restaurants and lounges within easy walking distance. The rooms were clean and well appointed with a small kitchenette with 2 burners, microwave and full size fridge. Complemetary coffee and microwave popcorn. The beds were comfortable. The staff here really seem to go out of their way and the manager was frequently seen overseeing everything including the buffet breakfast and the "welcome back" light afternoon snack with beer and wine. Both the breakfast and snacks were complementary - so get there early as EVERYONE seems to take advantage of this. I received an email from the hotel manager on my return home expressing his hope that our stay was enjoyable and asking for feedback if it was not. Can't say I have had that happen often! There is a tour desk onsite so you can book your Universal trips day of and take the shuttle from the hotel. Lots of free parking. Free internet - great! Overall very good value and I would recommend for couples or families.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, good hotel, but some not so good guests!!”
Reviews.Author: dazbec
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a hectic 14 days in Orlando staying at the Homewood Suites. Even though I had emailed prior to arrival requesting a non-smoking room, we were given a room on the 6th Floor (which is all smoking). On realising this, my husband approached the front desk and requested a room change - we got offered an alternative room on 6th Floor. Fortunately, the second room didn't reek of nicotine so we accepted it. The room was big enough for the four of us (just about) with two double beds in bedroom and separate small lounge/kitchen area. Housekeeping good - they even put dishwasher on every day for you, so don't do what I did and buy dishwashing tablets!! The buffet breakfast and homecoming dinner were both totally acceptable and it was good to return from a hard day at one of the park's to something to eat and drink (Mon-Thurs). A couple of disappointing incidents caused by other guests is our only gripe. Firstly, a family who would not have looked out of place on Jerry Springer in the room below us - shouting and swearing at their children etc which we could hear clearly in our room; secondly, the couple in the neighbouring room who firstly kept us awake with their shouting then when we finally got to sleep, woke the whole family up at 3am fighting which again we could hear quite clearly. My 8 year old thought repeating some of the swearing was really funny!!! Fortunately, Security came straight up when we rang and in the morning we spoke to the General Manager who was extremely apologetic and said he would talk to them as a report had been received by the night staff. This was our first visit to the U.S. as a family which cost us a fortune and could have so easily been ruined by a few inconsiderate people (American citizens) but we managed to enjoy it anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the price.”
Reviews.Author: whenicuucmetoo
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay. went with my 2 young children and husband. the rooms were cozy. the price was very reasonable. when i wanted to extend my stay for an extra night the staff in front were wonderful. even gave me a discount because we had stayed for an extended period. only pit fall was when i first entered the shower curtain was disgusting. i went down to the desk and immediately no questions asked and sincerely apologetic they changed the curtain out. we left money around the room and when we came back the money was still there so our cleaning staff were NOT thieves. be careful if you decide to do laundry, watch your clothes because i had a pair of pants stolen. (not the hotel's fault). many local restaurants deliver to this hotel so it's in an excellent area. the air conditioning worked excellent. i look forward to coming back in January. keep up the good work Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: jeffires
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel on hotwire for $47 per night. Excellent value. Free hi speed, free full breakfast and centrally located. Very clean - friendly staff. I will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tinatottot
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 8 nights with my boyfriend.Had a brill time. Room was very spacious and well equiped.Bed was so comfy.. Breakfast was grand except you have to be down before 9 or else you wont anywhere to sit..Paul in breakfast room will frighten the life out of you when he starts singing but we had a good laugh.. We only made it back for one evening of the welcome home dinner and this was a nice addition to the place.. It is n a good location just off international drive. Staff were fine didnt have much dealings with them really. It was perfect for our stay nad i will stay here again in the future. Loved orlando. So much to do. Fast pass in the parks are well worth the 36 dollars.. Wish we could have waited longer ... Enjoy the Homewood.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: timewatcher
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 weeks at the Homewood Suites on International Drive and couldn't fault this hotel, it is excellent. The rooms are spacious and the huge kingsize bed is so comfy. The sofa bed is just that a sofa bed and my 17 year old did complain a bit. Flatscreen TVs in both the living area and the bedroom. There is a small kitchen area which I never used, was not there to cook etc but the fridge was invaluable used it to keep drinks and snacks cool, even kept the aftersun cream in the fridge. The rooms were exceptionally clean and there was maid service every day. Breakfast is provided every day: cereal, porridge, sausages, potato cubes, scrambled eggs, bread, bagels, french toast, english muffins, danish pastries, fresh fruit, tea, coffee and breakfast juices, there is also waffle machines so you can make your own waffles. If you can't make a breakfast out of all that that something is wrong. One word of warning a guy comes in most morning dressed as a chef and sings, the first time you see this it is quite amusing but after a few days it does get on your nerves and by the end of the holiday you are near nuts listening to him. He seems to be doing this for money, people were tipping him. Maybe this is something new they are trying but going by the expressions on people's faces it is a bad move. There was a welcome home reception from Monday to Thursday and the best bit of this is the free beer and wine. Food was also on offer it was nearly always some sort of pasta dish, some salad stuff, soup and crisps and dips. Not bad for a snack if you are about but I wouldn't rush home for it. I myself enjoyed a few beers by the pool with a bowl of crisps or nachos and a dip, now how relaxing does that sound. The breakfast room can be used all day every day . People gather there in the evening, bring their own drink, order a pizza, bring snacks and sit and have a chat it is quite relaxing after a hectic day. The pool closes at 10.00pm because it is in the centre of the hotel and there are bedrooms all around it so quiet has to be restored at some point. The location is excellent, just off International Drive behind Bahama Breeze. You can walk to International Drive in about 2 minutes and because the hotel is set back of the road a bit it is nice and quiet. There are plenty of restaurants within 5 minutes walk. Wonderworks, Ripley's Believe It Or Not and Pirates Cove Crazy Golf are all within walking distance. Olive Garden Italian Restaurant is just across the road from the Bahama Breeze and is a must, meals are fantastic and I was pleasantly surprised at the price, 5 adult meals, a good bottle of red wine and several vodkas came in at $148 a lot cheaper than I expected and the surroundings are lovely. Would avoid the Ponderosa, always thought the Ponderosa was cheap and cheerful especially for families, well it is certainly not cheerful and in my opinion it has gone down hill badly. The hotel also has a gym, a computer room, free WIFI, several games machines for the kids and laundry facilities. They will even do some grocery shopping for you if you leave them a list. There is no restaurant in the hotel but you can order food in from TGI Fridays and a few other food places. Only order food from the places recommended by the hotel and these you will find at the back of the welcome folder in your room. Leaflets are pushed under your door every day from various other food outlets but do not use these the food is rubbish, we found this out to our cost. The staff in the hotel could not be nicer or more helpful, excellent customer service, nothing was too much trouble. Would definitely stay here again. Thanks to all at the Homewood Suites

Reviews.Title: “amazing,holiday of a lifetime.didnt want to come home after three weeks.”
Reviews.Author: blondIreland
Reviews.Content: we had a room facing the carpark and didnt hear any noise at night which was great as we were getting up early in the mornings.always on a seat on the bus to the parks which the hotel provided for free. the free breakfast and manager reception were great.Travelling with a teenager he loved it.he never ate so much in the mornings!! the staff were friendly and very helpful.the hotel is also very clean.cant wait to go back next year.wouldnt dare stay anywhere else as i would only be comparing it to the homewood.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: frank021
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 16 nights from 20th june to july 6th [2nd time staying], good room on 3rd floor overlooking the car park at the back of the hotel [we find the rooms overlooking the pool can be a bit noisy in the evenings] the room served its purpose for us 1king sized bed and 1 pull out bed, a/c worked ok, the hotel was busy for the duration and the breakfast area gets a bit packed from 8.00am on, one addition this year is a singer in the breakfast area in the mornings going from table to table singing for people not for me and i think other people found it a bit intrusive so early in the morning when you are still a bit dozy and trying to eat breakfast, dont know if it will catch on? homecoming reception was also handy we caught it a few times and it was good, we also used the sterling cars outside the reception as we were not driving they have a set fare with the hotel for trips to the airport, parks etc. very handy for going to the florida mall and mall at millenia and downtown disney [look for george,very obliging and collected us on time every time] the shuttles to the parks were also very handy and always on time. we did not use the gym or computer room so i cant comment.Toasy as always was great if you want to get universal tickets or gatortours trips l i would recommened this hotel no problem and if we return we will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “It was ok, but not for couples.”
Reviews.Author: Carnadem
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on TA, i booked a two night stay at the Homewood suites as part of our Florida holiday and was thoroughly looking forward to it. The room was large enough with a huge comfortable bed, and very clean, but the 'view' from the window was awful, just feet away from the window was a wall, you had to get right up to the window to just see the sky! and below the window were the pipes etc to the pool.We would have asked to be moved had we booked for more than a couple of nights. Other than that, i'm sure that if you go as a family you may love the place, but there was nothing for couples, not even a bar and we didn't eat breakfast because we couldn't move for kids running about.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: bella246
Reviews.Content: Great location for I drive, in the middle of everything. Walking distance to food and stores. Wonderful staff, was able to check in early. Nice clean suites, 2 modern tv's is great with kids. Nice size kitchen, was happy to have a regular size fridge. My family and I were very comfortable. My only complaint is that the elevator is so slow, plus there is only one for each side of the hotel, the free wireless internet kept getting cut off, and though the beds were perfect to sleep on, they can use new linens, they were dingy with some holes. When I travel I always bring my air mattress in case I can't sleep on the beds, because I start itching, but I didn't use it cause I had no problems sleeping on their beds, my husband was shocked. Also the pool is located in the middle of the hotel and that minimizing the amout of sunlight to be in that area, so if you want a tan, then timing is everything. Breakfast was pleasant not too busy, enough tables, a lady went around giving crayons and coloring books to the children,which made them happy. I thought that was sweet. Customer service in this hotel is excellent. One thing I noticed besides the signs stating that they are not responsible for your car , were the police patroling the area. Kind of made me feel concerned and safe at the same time?

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jbirdtiger
Reviews.Content: I was in Orlando for one night on business and was booked at the Homewood by the client I was seeing. First time at one and it was great. I would reccomend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel and marvellous staff”
Reviews.Author: clemo46
Reviews.Content: We are the Clements family from Deal, England, we Stayed at the Homewood suites i-drive on a family 11 night holiday, absolutely marve llous hotel and staff, especially assistant general manager Mario, who personally ironed out any problems (not that there were any major problems at all), and all the staff at the hotel without exception, who treated us like royalty, there was a large convention on in the nearby Orange County Convention Centre, so the Hotel was busy, but Mario and his staff always went out of their way to to make us feel at home, we have been to Orlando on five previous occassions but this is our first stay at the Homewood suites, we will now never stay anywhere else other than the Homewood Suites, Thanks Mario and staff for a great holiday experience

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: richhill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with a group from Northern Ireland on their way to a cruise from Port Canaveral. We had been booked into the Hampton Inn next door and an unforseen mix up caused a double booking and we were offered this hotel. I must say that the staff could not have been nicer, the rooms were beautiful, the beds so comfortable and the overall treatment and facilities were great. The social time between 5pm and 7pm with refreshments and drinks was a great idea and I am sure anyone staying found it very convenient. I can highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Orlando and know when passing through with a group again we will not be staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: davidmeyer
Reviews.Content: This is our first trip at a Homewood as a family, and it did not disappoint. The in-toom kitchen was well appointed, and the two bedrooms with a living area (with fold-out couch) allowed our family to be very comfortable. The breakfast was good, and the facilities were very clean. Over-all, it was a very good experience and I recommend it for families and solo travelers alike.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: missmilly
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 6 nights and found the hotel to be clean, comfortable and fantastic value for money. We had a one bedroom suite which included a fridge/freezer, oven, microwave, coffee making facilities (and coffee supplies) and dishwasher. It was very well stocked with utensils (although we didn't actually use them) The staff couldn't have been more helpful and welcoming and made a point of greeting my son by name when we returned each day. The inclusive breakfast is buffet style and quite limited but you can eat as much as you want so it was more than adequate, we managed to be back in time for the evening reception twice which included a choice of hot food/salads and as many alcoholic and soft drinks as you wanted. We made use of the free shuttle to Disney, Seaworld and Universal even though we had a car, as it was so hassle free. Car-parking is also complimentary. Overall I was very pleased with our stay and would thoroughly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Family Friendly, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Ray72
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Homewood Suites for 2 weeks in Oct 08. 2 Adults & 2 Children. We had a 1 Bedroom Suite on the 3rd floor. The suite was great , fantastic comfy bed, a fold out sofa bed, full size fridge, kitchen area, large bathroom and a safe in the wardrobe(small daily charge for use of the safe $1.50per day). All 'n' all - everything we needed to make our stay relaxed and secure. All the staff we dealt with were friendly and professional and really made you feel welcome , but without being overbearing or intrusive. The hotel is located in my preferred "section" of International Drive - near the Pointe Orlando Complex / Convention centre. . I find this section the best for family friendly restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. Tony Roma's , Bahama Breeze, TGI's are all less than a couple of mins walk. The hotel has a free breakfast buffet every morning which is great when you're travelling with your family cos it can save you time and money of the course of your holiday. The buffet itself is more than adequate - plenty of choice for Juices, Tea, Coffee, pastries, Cereals, Yogurts, Fruit, Muffins, Pancakes etc. They aren't as many Hot Food choices - mainly scrambled eggs , hash brown (or cubed potatoes as we'd call them !) and sausage patties (not traditional "linked sausages") but as I said , more than enough choice to keep everybody happy. The hotel also has plenty of laundry rooms spread out across the different floors of the hotel, a small business centre (internet etc) , a small gym and a nice pool area with an adequate size pool and hot-tub. If your driving - the hotel has plenty of free parking and is a great base for Universal Theme Parks (approx. 10mins away) and Disney (approx. 20mins away on the I-4). Its also centrally located for getting to most of the main shopping area's - Premium Outlets, Florida Mall and Belz Factory Outlet. As a regular visitor to Orlando , and having stayed in a few different hotels (most of which I liked too) - I prefer this hotel over any of the others I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Was better two years ago...”
Reviews.Author: ang126
Reviews.Content: Okay, so we stayed here two years ago and found it delightful! You can read my review on down the list. We went again for the same conference, but the hotel was DIFFERENT! The room was the same. No kidding, the SAME couch. It was not comfortable to sit on. In the first room we felt like we were falling off of the sides of the bed when we were trying to sleep. The maid service was hit or miss. They did make the beds consistently, but that was the only thing that was the same. One day our room did not get service at all, one day no wash clothes, some days we got shampoo/soap, sometimes not. We had to change rooms because the neighbors had screaming children, and when the children would scream, the parents would scream right back... all hours of the day and night. In the second room, the bed was more comfortable. They did try to make things right. Breakfast was the same every day.... They really did need some variety. All in all, I am not sure if I would recommend this hotel this time. It was a fair price for what there was.

Reviews.Title: “Large suites ideal for any travellers to Orlando”
Reviews.Author: vicky_b_09
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I stayed at Homewood Suites for 7 days during April whilst visiting Orlando and and we really enjoyed our stay. The rooms themselves are large and spacious with a seperate lounge and dining area to crash after tiring days at the theme parks. We intended to save money by cooking for ourselves in the evening and making sandwiches to take to the theme parks with us but once we got there we ditched this idea and pretty much always ate out. With this in mind, I think the Suite style rooms at Homewood would be better for a family but it was still useful for us. The breakfasts at the hotel were lovely with a selection of different foods and tea/coffee/juices to drink. We only managed to catch the free dinner on one night we were staying there but that was also very nice and we couldn't complain about the free beer and wine! The location was ideal for the theme parks with several different free shuttles running to all the main parks. Taxi's were generally quite reasonable to the different malls and outlets, there's always one that wants to rip off unsuspecting tourists! Alternatively, the I-Ride bus offered very cheap travel up and down International Drive. Nearby we visited Bahama Breeze for amazing cocktails, Olive Garden for great Italian (big portions though!) and Tony Roma's for steak and burgers! Orlando was amazing and if you're looking a great place to stay whilst exploring, I'd highly recommend the Homewood Suites

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location”
Reviews.Author: N0NEPLUSSED
Reviews.Content: My wife and I Stayed for 18 nights and it was just what we wanted, an apartment that had a separate bedroom and a bed-settee in the dining/living room. That meant I could snore the night away without bruises. All hotel staff we spoke to were helpful & friendly, maid did a good job. Pool is a bit small but the water is warm. Free shuttles to Disney (Epcot, and then use Disney transport to the rest of the parks) and universal studios. I Drive trolley stops near to hotel so we didnâ€™t miss having a car and the local supermarkets are within easy walking distance. Complimentary breakfast at the hotel was very good considering that it is free and there was plenty. Mon to Thurs there was a complimentary basic evening meal which included free wine and beer, so plan to return to the hotel early on those nights as it finishes at 19:00, it just saves a little money so you can spend on more fun things. If you donâ€™t want use of the room safe tell the reception when you arrive else you will get charged a small daily fee at the end of your stay. Iâ€™ll definitely use this hotel on my next visit to Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Good - but not Great!”
Reviews.Author: Jenny1000000
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Orlando. Having read the reviews on the Homewood Suites I was happy that we had chosen a good hotel. I dont consider myself to be over fussy but when we arrived at the hotel it was a bit of a let down. The room we were given was on the 6th floor which is the smoking floor. I hate the smell of smoke at the best of times ( ex smoker!! ) and I asked for a non smoking room. There were no rooms available. To cut a long story short the reception did not seem to care that I wanted a non smoking room and talking to other people they put all the British people on the 6th floor in the smoking rooms. I did not meet one American on the 6th floor!! I suspect this is because they would complain bitterly about the smell of smoke. I spent 14 nights at the hotel - the least they could of offered was to move us to a non smoking room when one became available. There never was a room on offer. I also asked for a kettle for our room. The reception said could I wait a couple of days. I said I could. Again - no kettle ever arrived. when I asked the reception she just shrugged her shoulders. I didnt care too much because I boiled water in a pan. But I do think a kettle is a fairly basic requirement in any hotel room let alone one with a kitchen! Maybe I am being a bit picky! But generally the rooms were very clean and the beds were very comfortable - really comfortable actually. The fridge was a great size and very cold which was great for cold water. Having 2 tvs was great for my two teenagers! The bathroom was very clean and the shower very powerful which more than made up for the lack of a kettle!! the complimentary soap and shampoos are good quality. the kitchen equipment more than adequate and the complimentary tea and coffee sachets gratefully received. Breakfast - Well again I have to say I am going to moan. The food was good. BUT it was difficult to find a table. It was very overcrowded and felt more like a school canteen at times. I saw on a couple of occasions people fighting over tables. The quality of the food was good but there is a lack of variation. The coffee though was great. Pool - all said before. Small and in the shade. Orlando is not a holiday where you will be doing much sitting by the pool anyway. The complimentary shuttles were very good. We used them a lot. Never a problem getting on them, Eating out - we went to Dennys on the first night - it is so close to the hotel - I found out the next night that if you show your room key you get 15% off your total bill. Food was adequate. TGI Friday - Good Sirloin steaks and good service although you pay a little more. Friendlys over the road from the hotel - same as Dennys really - good fast food. Not for the healthy types!! Ponderossa - I did not like this place at all. It reminded me of school dinners!! The price is good but the surroundings are poor and the poor staff look knackered! Domino pizza is 5 mins walk - Great!! Good value deals and great taste if you like pizza. Ci Ci pizza is a few stops on the I trolley. Great deal if you are really hungry. $5.99 all you can eat buffett with salad ( limited choice ). The pizza choice is good although do not expect too much topping. At the end of the day its cheap and tastes good. The buffet also includes 2 puddings!! Cant be bad. I bought my flexiticket plus from Charter Travel for Â£154. This was good value. Disney is expensive and very very crowded. go if you can out of the school holidays. There are two shopping centres at either end of the I Drive. Premium outlets and Prime outlets. Both offer designer clothing at discounted prices. Great if you like that kind of shopping. Florida mall was a more normal shopping experience with more normal shops - its where the Americans shop. Look out for discount vouchers for almost everything - all the attractions and restaurants. Well thats it really. Over all the Homewood Suites were good value at Â£62.00 -per night for all 3 of us so I suppose I should not be complaining at all. Its just that my expectation before I went was higher than the reality. Hope this is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent mid-priced hotel. We'll be staying here again.”
Reviews.Author: KilbegganRanger
Reviews.Content: We (two adults and an eight year old) stayed in this hotel for two weeks in February 2009. The reason we stayed here was because it suited our needs and had such great reviews. Our essential requirements were; an I-Drive location, a heated pool (it was February!), free transport to the parks, an inclusive breakfast and clean rooms. The location was excellent. Just off I-Drive, no traffic noise, good local shops and restaurants and 1 minute to both the Red and Green Line trolleys. The hotel itself was very clean, the staff was very helpful (not that we really had any problems anyway), the concession staff was also great. The breakfast was more than enough for us and never crowded. The pool was heated and great for splashing around or a few laps, but not for sunbathing as it's mostly all in shade for most of the day, but you can use other local hilton hotel pools anyway. We preferred the shaded pool to be honest. The free internet access was good too. We used "the business centre" which is basically a smallish room with two PCs and a printer - good enough for checking email and surfing the web. Our room was a suite (a lounge with a small kitchen with a table and chairs and the couch pulled out into a double bed and a separate bedroom with an en suite bathroom). We loved the extra space that the lounge seating gave us in between being asleep and being out all day. The room safe was great too, large enough for the essentials but not big enough for a laptop (I'd guess about 10x8 inches and 8-10 inches deep) and we weren't charged for it, although we used it daily. The free transport ran twice every morning to all the parks; one shuttle to Disney and another to all the Universal parks, SeaWorld and Aquatica. And coming back, there were also early (6pm ish) and late (9.30pm ish) shuttles. We found all the drivers very helpful, knowledgeable and courteous. Well worth a few dollars tip. Disney transport was booked at reception, other transport was booked by the concession staff. Only once was the disney shuttle (the early one) full when we tried to book it, necessitating a quick change of plan - no problem. We were very happy with our stay here. We actually extended our Disney tickets while there so we'll be back and we'll definately be staying at Homewood Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at the Homewood suites”
Reviews.Author: zoeyhunt
Reviews.Content: The suites were clean and very comfortable. The location was also geat , on international drive but tucked in a little so we didn't have the traffic noise. There were several stores in the area and the i-trolley runs every 15 - 20 minutes so you can go to almost anywhere on I-drive for a very reasonable price. The Hotel also offers complimentary shuttles to Disney, Seaworld and Universal Studios. There is a great pool and a very nice gym on site. just a very short walk away is an awesome miniture golf course. We had a great stay. Edith, from Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel but overloaded with kids”
Reviews.Author: Jayvad
Reviews.Content: Staff at check-in were friendly and efficient. Rooms were clean, spacious, and well equipped. Carpet in the communal hallways is in need of cleaning or replacing and the hotel could also benefit by fitting air conditioning in the hallways, lifts, and business centre as they were very stuffy and uncomfortable. Breakfast was included although it was never a great experience with a million people pushing and shoving and trying to load up as much food as possible on top of their plate. Overall though this is a good family hotel and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - an absolute bargain”
Reviews.Author: fintyflanagan
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel. Short walk to Pointe Orlando shopping / eating mall. Friendly staff, good breakfast in the morning. A suite for $130? Where else would you get it. We have travelled across all of Florida in the last two weeks and cannot get close to the service and value of this place. Couldn't recommend this place highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay- will return”
Reviews.Author: lsm112375
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend getaway to Sea World with My husband and 20 month old. Great location for Sea World- less than a 5 min drive. Room was clean. Some of the furniture had some markings and small rips on it- but nothing outrageous. Could hear some noise from the room next door- and from loud folks in the parking lot- but nothing into the wee hours of the morning. Breakfast was great! Lots of options and kept very clean- even though there was a Mary Kay convevntion going on and the place was packed. Not a good pool for little ones though- barely a deck at all. Staff was great. We will definetly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ansy007
Reviews.Content: I don't have a bad word to say about this hotel. The rooms were immaculate and generously sized. The breakfast was superb and the shuttle service to the Disney and Universal parks was reliable, comfortable and safe. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful as were the shuttle drivers etc. The location was perfect with a number of shops, restaurants and amenities a short walk away on International Drive. Although the hotel is situated on International drive, it is set back from the main road and is quiet and peaceful as a result. The pool area is clean and well maintained with a jacuzzi and plenty of sun loungers. Homewood is a perfect hotel to exploe Orlando and Internation Drive and I would definitely recommend it to anyone and go back.

Reviews.Title: “Absoloutely Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CiaranTrinity123
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as we were on holidays in Florida (Disney, Universal etc.). We loved this hotel, probably one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. The hotel had a slight old fashioned interior, but was to be expected as we were not staying in a modern European hotel. Our stay was for 10 nights and we really loved it. There is a pool, small gymnasium, and the hotel offer free breakfast every morning of the week which consists of really continental style, there is also some hot food sausages, fried potatoes and egg. The breakfast is really nice and free so there is no need to go out and spend money on a breakfast. The hotel also offers light food from Monday to Thursday, the food is really nice and the hotel also offers free beer and wine with this meal, the meal is really nice and there is a menu in each room to tell you what is on each night. The meal is nice as a snack after the parks but often we went out after to eat. Our only bad experience with the hotel is the TGI Fridays room service. After a long flight we were quite hungry and desperately tired, we decided to get the room service it was a rip off and disgusting. Dont get it, however a quick talk with the manager resolved the whole thing. Homewood offers free shuttles to all of the major parks: - Disney (ALL) - Universal Studios - Islands of Adventure - Sea World - Aquatica - Wet n Wild (only minutes from hotel) - Busch Gardens The hotel is right on the I RIDE trolley red line and this service is very good and very quick. This goes right up international drive. There is a Dennys a minute away from the hotel as well as other lovely restaurants. Dont miss Tony Romas it is class. The pool is nice but it is a bit small. The area is nice and the shops. Overall, fantastic hotel, the rooms are very clean and the maids are excellent, there is a self service laundry service on each floor which is so handy. Would definetely stay in this hotel again in the future. Reccomend to anyone no matter what holiday.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: a1detect
Reviews.Content: Overall, very nice stay. Rooms were clean and spacious. Complimentary breakfast was well stocked and generous. Only disappointment is the pool area. 99% of the pool area is shaded during the afternoon hours, when I go to florida I want some sun.. We were encouraged to use neighboring hotel pool but it was pretty small. Nice hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great value vs. convention center hotels”
Reviews.Author: TravelingAggies
Reviews.Content: My group stayed at the Homewood Suites in late February 2009. We chose this hotel over the other hotels offered by our convention that were in walking distance to the convention center. Although we had a choice of taking our convention center scheduled shuttle or the local I-trolley we found it better to be closer to the restaurants and enteraintment. Those staying at the convention center hotels had to walk or take taxis to us and the restaurants. This hotel was nearly full every night we were there, but the staff did a great job at the breakfast time and evening social hour keeping food and drinks supplied. I used the gym once and it was clean but had limited equipment. I also utilized the free wi-fi and found it fast and easy to connect to. I like the Hilton family of hotels and think that thier Hilton Honors program is one of the best since I can double dip with my airline miles. Just around the corner from the hotel is a good steak house, Howl at the Moon, Bahama Breeze and a TGI Fridays (they deliver to the hotel along with a local pizza place).

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! Homewood is the best!”
Reviews.Author: x_dan_x
Reviews.Content: I will break this review down into sections so you can see the good and bad points of each area of our stay in Orlando. ARRIVAL After booking with Travel City Direct, we made the walk through Sanford to the transfers exit. Our 2 reps were there to meet us, and directed us to the exchange booth, where we should exchange our transfer vouchers for coach tickets. Once on board the coach, another rep came on and explained to us how long it would be before we got to our hotel. She briefed us on our resort, giving us plenty of maps, guides and voucher booklets (discounts on theme park tickets, restaurants etc) . She then left the coach, explaining that we would have a long wait until the coach set off, due to a family stuck in immigration. Finally, we set off and our hotel was one of the first to be dropped off as it was at the end of International Drive. The rep was not on the coach at this point and the coach driver snapped at us when we asked him which of four hotels in the grounds was ours. On arrival, the porter was waiting at the door of the hotel to help us with our luggage. Here is where the good stuff begins! CHECK-IN / ARRIVAL AT ROOM Don, the porter, carried our bags to the reception desk, and the polite, friendly staff checked us in. We were given a key to a room on the 2nd floor and our bags were carried up. On arrival at the room, we were given a full tour of the room and we were asked if there was anything we would need straight away. There was nothing, no queries about our wonderful room, so the porter left. ROOM In our room, we had an open-plan kitchen/living area with a sofa-bed (double) which our children slept in. In the kitchen area, there was a fully equipped kitchen and seating. The living room contained a plasma tv with all the channels we could ever want. We also had a master bedroom with an en-suite bathroom. This contained a plasma screen, a kingsize bed and chairs and 2 large wardrobes. Safes were available at an extra charge. The bathroom was in good condition and was kept well cleaned and equipped throughout our stay. REST OF HOTEL The rest of our hotel was outstanding as well. There was a jacuzzi, a large swimming pool, a games room, a large dining area, a mini-market and a baggage storage area. There were always plenty of sunbeds available as most guests were out at the park all day. Breakfast was a good choice - serving continental and cooked. Monday-Friday 5pm-7pm, the hotel ran a welcome home reception where soft drinks, beer and wine were free, as were snacks. A shuttle service was also complimentary - although you do have to book in advance. To go to the parks in the morning the shuttles were as follows: 1) 7am 2) 8:30am 3) 11:30am And coming back from the parks was 1)4pm 2)6pm 3)8pm 4)10pm The hotel overall was great and the staff could not do anything more. PARK TICKETS Just a word of warning - unless you want to be ripped off at the Park Entrance - book your Disney tickets back in the UK! The hotel sell tickets for Wet 'N' Wild and Universal but no Disney tickets are available. They are sold at discount prices and you can pick many discount books up from restaurants/bars that can get you an extra discount if you know where to use them. DISNEY PARKS One word - AMAZING! Bring the magic of Disney alive as you visit: Epcot - The "World of Tomorrow" park Magic Kingdom - The "Little Kids/Big Kids" Park Hollywood Studios - For all you thrill seekers out there! Animal Kingdom - Animal Lovers- you can travel to Asia, Africa and much more! Blizzard Beach - The best Disney water park there is Typhoon Lagoon - Good, but not as good as BB! My ride recommendations are Epcot - "Test Track" and "Mission: Space" Magic Kingdom - All of them! Hollywood Studios - Tower of Terror and Rock'N'Rollercoaster Animal Kingdom - Expedition Everest and Kilimanjaro Safaris Blizzard Beach - Summit Plummit and Water Wavers Typhoon Lagoon - Wave pool and the big water slide Enjoy your stay at Homewood!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant”
Reviews.Author: floridastar
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this hotel and it is better than ever.. going back feb 09

Reviews.Title: “Loved Homewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: Robrud&family
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Feb 2008 for two weeks, great hotel, great staff, the free breakfast is a excellent and so is the free beers ,wine and food during the week!!. You can get to all the parks via free transport providing you book and there's lots on your door step. The hotel has only one down side, the pool, I stayed at the Holiday Inn on Int drive many years ago at that had a fantastic pool wereas this one is in the centre of the hotel and has limited area around the pool and is very over shaddowed by the building. If your looking for a great hotel as a base for all the parks then this hotel is it, if your looking for a few days by the pool too then maybe this isnt the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Stay”
Reviews.Author: scotsfam
Reviews.Content: had a wonderfull stay , helpfull front desk always pleasant, mario the manager could not do enough for you he was a pleasure to deal with a gentleman ,suite was clean a great size and good maid service,the transport to the parks saves a small fortune,breakfast has everything you cold ask for,get there early though as is very popular,happy hour is free alcoholic drinks or juice and a snack- great wee filler before dinner,good little gym,good laundry facilities,basically a very good option for stay in orlando just off int drive about midway between disney and universal definately stay here again, and have to finish with a big thank-you to mario for everything top bloke. from the hughes family scotland cheers mate

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly”
Reviews.Author: pilotswifecincinnati
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Thanksgiving, for four nights. They had a Thanksgivingdinner for the guest that was pretty good, the same as their breakfasts. This is a very family friendly hotel. Rooms are large with full kitchens, livingroom with sleeper sofa and king bed in bedroom. The location is great. Near all types of restaurants and Walgreens where you can stock up on drinks and snacks. The public transportation is wonderful and very easy to get around town. The pool is small and gets very little sun light as it is in a courtyard type setting.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: FatimaBrazil
Reviews.Content: The breakfast is great! The room amazing! The bed so confortable! I was there with my 4 years old son and my husband, and spend there 8 nights. I will return to Orlando and I won't change the hotel! Only want to spend more days there.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Jen590
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights during a conference and had a great experience. The staff were all very nice and helpful, rooms were clean, and the included breakfast (waffles, bagels, toast, eggs, etc) was a great 'bonus'. I booked through an online discount site so got a great deal that was less than the published rates on the hotel website. It's also in a good location with many restaurants nearby and within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Homewood!”
Reviews.Author: CaliGirl4Ever
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in November at the Homewood I-Drive in Orlando. I got an amazing rate of $39/night through Priceline which was more than we ever could have bargained for. It also gave me very low expectations. We have stayed at Homewood Suites in the past and have been pleased with them overall and were anxious to see how this compared to the other locations we stayed at. I had read TripAdvisor reviews of the property and it sounded perfectly fine so we gave it a go. Keep in mind we were in Orlando in the off-season; this may have affected our experiences with crowds, etc. We arrived on a Tuesday night. The hotel was marked by a sign on the street and could be missed if you weren't really paying attention as it is set back from the street. But I had done my research and found it without problem. There was plenty of parking right near the front entrance. Parking did fill up in the evening but I never had trouble getting a good spot. I walked right up to the front desk where I was greeting warmly by the desk clerk and checked right in. The type of room we wanted was available and I made sure to ask for one of the already renovated rooms. The only thing it didn't have was the new TVs. The room was similar in size and layout to the other HS we've stayed in. The room was clean and well taken care of with the usual HS amenities. The only downside was the new remodel removed the towel rack/shelves from the vanity area. Consequently there is no place to hang a hand towel for drying your hands. Not a big deal. The daily breakfast was adequate and welcome. The BEST part of their food service was a soda machine! I am one of those people who wants Diet Coke with every meal and I was able to have it! The dinners were also adequate but not spectacular. (We were spoiled at the Homewood Suites in Alexandria and compare all others to it!) But it was included and we ate there a couple of the evenings. It was sometimes busy but never crowded and gave us a good opportunity to chat with our fellow travelers. Didn't use the fitness center. The pool was big enough and not at all crowded (again, it was November). The business center was hot and stuffy, but free internet access is always welcome. There were occasional issues with the printers, but nothing major. I would recommend the Homewood Suites for a clean, comfortable stay. The staff was nice, the room was clean, the food was adequate, and we couldn't beat the price! And it was really nice to have a separate room to go to when it was kiddie bedtime! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel with a premium on service”
Reviews.Author: ehsim
Reviews.Content: Stayed during Thanksgiving weekend. Very nice hotel. They have a new customer service campaign and you can see the benefit. I needed an adjustment to my thermostat and the engineer was up to my room immediately. In addition, the Manager called after he left to make sure everything was working ok. The breakfast was very good as well. Only thing I would changeis better signage. Coming off International Drive you cannot see the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for family adventure!”
Reviews.Author: bangorfamily
Reviews.Content: Great location, in the middle of all activity on International Drive. Hotel not plush and could do with carpets and curtains revamp but clean, staff great, rooms great for a family and we had a great fun on our family adventure! Pool nice but you dont get much sun there. Breakfast buffet again not plush but all you need. We had a great time here and 2 tv's great (one for them and one for us).

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great location”
Reviews.Author: MTZinzan
Reviews.Content: Great location, great value and friendly staff. We stayed three nights from Oct 21 to 24 in a somewaht dark two bed suite. Nevertheless it was spacious, comfortable and extremely functional. Location wise the hotel is excellent - close to some great restaurants Cafe Tu Tu Tango, Bahama Breeze and Don Pablos were the three we visited - attractions such as Ripley's, Wonderworks and four mini-golf courses and not too far from Wet and Wild either. Breakfast is no great shakes but it is free and there is a welcome home buffet with free beer and wine each evening - certainly unusual by my experience of the US where everuy extra is itemised and charged.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: welshjock
Reviews.Content: Homewood Suites visited September, for 17 nights. Our second visit. Reasons why we like this Hotel: - Location, Location, Location. A short walk past BB TGI and a Walgreenâ€™s to Point Orlando with its shops, restaurants and cinema. Turn the other way, and a short stroll to visit past D and Don Pueblos (to name few restaurants) to Pirates Cove Mini Golf. You can access both Universal Blvd and International Dr, by car or for public transport. Rooms with a huge Fridge/Freezer, Microwave, and free wireless broadband and in a separate bedroom, a massive bed. Free breakfast, there are days when you canâ€™t face a big American breakfast, so being able to have just tea and toast, is great (especially as its free). You can still have a large (free) breakfast, in the Hotel if you want. Tea and Coffee, 24hrs a day in the breakfast area and Mon to Thurs 17:30 to 19:30 free beer, wine and soft drinks (and snacks). There is one or two things that could be improved, more storage for one, itâ€™s all right if your only staying a few days, but if youâ€™re staying for two weeks! They were working on the rooms when we were there; perhaps they are updating them. The pool, the space around the pool is limited, and the sun is only visible, from about 11 till 2, also the output of some AC units can be felt, and heard around the pool. We would go back, but as there are several other hotels in the same area, Hyatt Palace, Springhill Suites, Hawthorn suites, and across ID Embassy suites, may give these a quick look at, before booking the Homewood suites again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel/Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: zackary71
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently amid all the refurbishment work. Pros: Free Breakfast, Great location near Restaurants and Entertainment, Free Shuttles to all Parks (would be nice if other Hotel Guests actually bothered tipping driver just $1) free Internet for Adults,TGI delivery service billed to Room, free welcome drinks 4 nights a week. Cons Hotel starting to look drab and dreary with dark greens dominating colour scheme, very noisy elevator. Main criticism is the Hotel Management themselves-they make a big thing of the "Exceeding Expectations" service standards. However, with all the work going on which started from 8am onwards, they took 10 days to address our complaint and even then, did not offer an apology of any sorts for the disruption and inconvenience caused. Overall, this is a great place to stay especially if you want to avoid driving on holiday and hopefully the refurbishment will address the tired dated look of the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great place but not sure i agree with the ranking”
Reviews.Author: bec026
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at the Homewood Suites for a 2 week holiday, the hotel is fantastic for the money we paid but i can't really agree with other peoples reviews about the place being out of this world. The rooms are a bit dated and could do with some modernisation but we knew before we went that this was not a 5 star hotel. The hotel itself is situated brilliantly, there are many different restaurants you can walk to at night time, only my boyfriend was insured to drive the hire car so it was good for him that he didn't need to drive all day every day. I can't fault the location of the hotel at all and i would recommend it. The free breakfast was good and this saved us a lot of money. The first few days we were there they were doing renovations to a room directly above ours, the noise was deafening and when i rang the front desk and asked them what was going on they did not seem too concerned and said it would finish at 6pm - not really very good. Overall though the hotel is excellent but like i said earlier its not the ritz, i would definately stay there again if i return to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great as always!”
Reviews.Author: minniemoo
Reviews.Content: We keep coming back to this hotel again and again. It offers amazing value for money as well as friendly service, spotlessly clean rooms and a great buffet breakfast. I rang the hotel two days before we travelled making a room request. This was honoured and we had a room on the 5th floor overlooking the pool. The beds are as comfy as ever. I just didnt want to get up! The staff are always on hand in the morning to greet their guests and are more than helpful in sorting out any niggles or problems. The same applies to the front desk staff and Toasy at the Universal desk. Homewood's 'make your own waffles' are legendary but where oh where has the strawberry sauce gone to? It was so good! We love the pool at Homewood as we are not big sun lovers, so the pool being in the shade is a godsend when we get back from the parks. We stayed here for five days before moving on to one of the Universal hotels and Homewood beat it terms of value, cleanliness, friendliness and comfort hands down. We all love this hotel and will definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Recommend for Families with Kids”
Reviews.Author: cruz30
Reviews.Content: We stayed the last week of August in this hotel. At first we were given a room with window air conditioner units, which appear to some of the ones they are currently renovating. These definitely didn't work with orlando's heat, we expressed we wanted a change in room and front desk staff quickly put us in a room that had the normal central air units (Thanks Ximena!). Kudos for their fast response. There is some renovation work going on on the hotel, however it takes place during day hours..most of which we were at the Disney parks so we didn't felt the noise...if you plan to stay on the hotel during the day that may be a problem. In general this is a good hotel, we found it to be clean and the room very spacious. The fronts desk staff was always very attentive when we had questions or request so we appreciated the customer orientation of the staff. The hotel is right on international drive so you have plenty of choices of restaurants close to the hotel. The complimentary breakfast buffet is good and they keep it well stock and clean.
