The hotel doesn't have room service but they have the Fridays restaurant as their recommended l "room service" provider. We had pizza from Fliperias, the Pizza delivery they recommend and it was pretty good. In general I will stay again at this hotel and will recommend this a as a good option for families traveling with kids.

Reviews.Title: “beware of building works!”
Reviews.Author: rickythegoat
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel on many occasions and have always been very happy with the service, rooms and location. We arrived on the 19th August for a 14 night stay and were given a rather gloomy room above the noisy swimming pool pump. As the hotel was full we had no option but to take the room but the next morning asked to change to a quieter room which the staff sorted out very professionally and we were given a nice room on the 4th floor overlooking the pool. All was fine until on our 8th day we arrived back from a day at a theme park at approx 3pm to the sound of construction work, you could hear the hammering in the car park it was so loud .When we got to our room there waiting was a letter from the management telling us that refurbishment s had started on the 5th and 6th floors which was due to last several weeks with the noisy work would taking place between 10am and 6 pm every day. We were not at all happy with this situation as we would be using the room to rest in the afternoons and the noise from the work would make this impossible. We immediately talked to the manager to try and change to a quieter room but unfortunately he said that no other room would be any quieter so we then decided to ask to change hotels. The next day the manager made some phone calls and got us a room at the Homewood Suites on American Way which is off the northern end of International Drive nearer to Universal Studios.(I will write a separate review of this hotel) We were pleased with the way this situation was resolved but were unhappy that we had lost a morning of our holiday changing hotels and more importantly had not been told in advance that building works were starting in the middle of our stay. The manager told us that he had only been told that work was starting 5 days earlier which seemed a bit odd but apparently this is quite normal for Florida builders! As we only spent 8 days of our prospective 14 day stay at this hotel I can only give this review 3 stars but this doesnâ€™t reflect the good standard of service and overall experience because of the problems caused by the unexpected building works.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accomodating and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: McCrorey-Reunions
Reviews.Content: We have been having family reunions for over 25 years and this was our first time going to Orlando Florida. I was blown away by the service and the friendly staff. They were so accomodating and helpful until I'm sure we will schedule more reunions at homewood suites. The staff was warm and helpful, almost as if they were part of the family! We had well over 100 people in attendance, yet not one complaint, only compliments on the food, service and rooms. You can't beat the location. International Drive is right outside the door and the trolley will take you to many exciting places for about one dollar. The hotel offers transportation to Disney and the other major parks, so getting around for everyone was not a problem. If you are looking for a great place to stay with your family, you need to check out this hotel, I'm glad we did!

Reviews.Title: “If you are a business person, this is not for you”
Reviews.Author: queenoftheroad52
Reviews.Content: I needed to get some rest after a long drive and looked forward to turning in early. You will not get any rest in this hotel! The pool is in the center of the hotel, the screaming was so loud, it could be heard by the person I was speaking with on my cell phone! This is definately not a hotel for business professionals. I stay in Homewood all the time, I am a gold member, so I know the quality I have come to expect. I was taken aback when I checked in by a card I was given that said, high capacity warning. It went on to explain I should get to breakfast early! Since this is my first nite, also, my last, I am not sure if that means they will just run out of food and tough luck or what. Instead of getting the rest I needed in order to participate in the meetings I have tomorrow, I am writing a hotel review! This hotel in my opinion is outdated and worn looking. Certainly not the quality I expect from a Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “High Marks!”
Reviews.Author: mom2girlz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful, and we would definitely stay there again. We arrived early in the day and tried to check in early. Our room wasn't ready but the front desk worker offered to register us and call us on our cell phone when the room was ready. We took a short walk over to Wonder Works and Pointe Orlando, and as promised we were contacted once the room was ready. The room was very suitable and we enjoyed having a separate living area and kitchen. The beds were so comfortable!! We enjoyed the breakfasts each morning, and several of the Welcome Home Receptions in the evening. We did have a room overlooking the pool, which could be quite noisy in the evening. The pool and whirlpool were fine for a quick dip. There isn't much deck space, but we weren't there to sunbath. After long days at the parks, this was a great hotel to come back to & relax!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: octaviavrs
Reviews.Content: stayed two wks here in july as part of our honeymoon. staff were friendly, room was more than adequate..kitchen, bathroom, seperate bathroom-sink in the main room. two tv's, massive fridge..all good.had to pay for the safe which annoyed me, it was only $1:50 a day however...but i always wondered how they knew i used it...chambermaid maybe. breakfast was a great to begin with, but novitily soon wore off as u need to be down very early..p.s its unreal how much sweet stuff the americans eat at breakfast!! hotel is behind bahama breeze, which is a tasty place to eat. if visiting florida get a rented car, a real must. shop in walmart, its about two miles up the road, and stock your massive fridge with coke and beer and water. visit all the parks and water parks, go in the eve when the wains(children)). went to bush garens a day, it was great, poorly signposted though. all in all id visit orlando every year if i could and id stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely one of the best hotels in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: jalu
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a package from Travel City Direct and were absolutely blown away. Located on International Drive (closer to Wonderworks than the Convention Centre) it's a bit back from the road and nice and quiet. If you're looking for it on Google Maps Street View you won't see it (this worried me before I went) - the best thing to do is find Howl At The Moon on International Drive - 8700 or so. It's just behind there. The rooms - one main living room with a kitchenette (the fridge was huge!), a seperate bedroom and a bathroom - were clean, spacious and always well looked after. The maid even stopped completely redressing my bed every day after I left her a note asking not to. The hotel pool is very small and is surrounded on all sides by the tall (at least four stories) hotel block so if you want to sunbathe there you'll need to move around the sides. Truth be told though the Homewood Suites' pool - and every other pool in Orlando - cannot compete with Disney's waterparks so I haven't marked it down for this. The hotel serves breakfast from 7 till 10 (at 10 they are still putting fresh food out) and this is nice if you don't want to go out to the Ponderosa, Golden Corral or any of the other places. The staff are really polite and friendly - we didn't encounter anyone having a bad day on our entire stay. We had a great stay at the hotel and would definitely say it deserves its spot on the top 10 hotels in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “There's a thief about!!”
Reviews.Author: Queenascots
Reviews.Content: I would have given this hotel a great review, great location, great staff, however some of the staff obviously over friendly as they helped themselves to my husbands credit card and had a lovely spending spree. We asked several times for a key to the room safe but were told they were on order so we left the wallet hidden in a drawer with his credit card in it but no cash (stupid us). We only discovered at the airport before we boarded our flight home that is was missing as we had not used it. As soon as we arrived back in the Uk we phoned the hotel and reported it to an under manager. We never heard back from them until I emailed the manager who did reply and told me to await a phone call which I'm still waiting on. Apart from that we had a lovely time and would have had no complaints with the hotel, very clean. Lovely toiletries, comfy beds. The pool is shaded as has been mentioned in other reviews but if you are only going for a dip and not to bothered about sunbathing it does the job. This hotel is in a great location on the nicer end of I Drive with plenty resturants nearby. If you are heading to Aquatica from here in the height of season I would recommend taking the shuttle and not your car as there was a terrible problem trying to turn left across the road into the car park and could take AGES.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: meganbowles
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Homewood Suites on 24th July until the 7th August 2008. We had the best time ever in Orlando thanks to this fabulous hotel. We have stayed in many others on International Drive and were not expecting the elegance and poshness that we got here! The Check In: When we arrived at the hotel we were shocked that for what we had paid, this hotel was so much more. We had called the Hilton helpline 2 days prior to check in to request a ground floor room (for medical reasons) and when we arrived to check in was reassured this would be fine and our we had a choice of room views. We decided to overlook the pool. The staff were so friendly and nice we felt at home straight away. We were directed to our rooms and offered assistance from the bellhop. The Room: The room was outstanding, it looks as good in the pictures as it does in reality, which is often not the same. The kitchen area was very nice and clean, the dishwasher was free of charge and the maid put it on each day for us. There was nice clean cutlery and pots, pans and crockery provided for us in the drawers and cupboards. The microwave was huge and could cook almost anything. The fridge was very big too. There was a dining table in the kitchen area also with 4 chairs. In the living room was an arm chair and a sofa (which was a pull out bed too). As a party of 3, finding a hotel with decent bed space is tricky. But this hotel once again exceeded expectations. In the bedroom we had a king size bed, which 2 people slept in. The 3rd person slept in the double sofa bed that was in the living room. All sheets were changed every other day (and was offered to be changed each day). The bathroom was lovely, nice bath, shower and toilet. Fresh towels provided everyday. Storage space was decent, the wardrobe had its own hangers and shelf at the top, and the safe inside that (this is a daily charge $1.50, thats automatically added provided you use it). There were 2 bedside drawers and a chest of drawers where the tv was. There were 2 tv's in the room and had so many channels including HBO, HBO 2, HBO Signature and ABC. We were able to watch pay per view films that were relatively new at the cinema for $12.99. Air conditioning was very good and easy to use and adjust, quick working and kept our room very cool. No sound could be heard from the other rooms or noises out in the hallway. The Pool: When I read the reviews about the pool I was lead to believe there was no sun and it was covered in shade all day long. This is completely untrue. If you decide to have a lazy day by the pool, then there is sun in the pool area from around 10am until 5pm. The pool does shade over during the day but only on one side and sun is still on the other side, I tended to get out by 11am and sit on the side where the sun ended up in the afternoon so that I had sun all day. This was not a problem as the pool area was so quiet, day and night. Only 3/4 people would be outside when I was. The pool is a good size and the sun heats it nice and warm. Deep end is not too deep, which is good. There is a nice jacuzzi, very hot, not good for those with sunburn! (Be warned). Breakfast and Welcome Home Snack: Each morning there is a cooked breakfast buffet from 7am until 10am. It consists of: scrambled eggs, spiced eggs, sausages, waffles or pancakes, english muffins, bread, doughnuts, cereals, coffees, teas, orange juice and other fruits. On Monday - Thursday there is a welcome home snack between 5pm-7pm. It is scheduled a month in advanced and the schedule is up on your fridge. It consists of either, mac & cheese, chilli & mac, baked potato bar, oriental chicken, chicken and rice, hot dogs, burgers and more. There is always salads, crisps and dips available. The washing laundry room only cost $1.75 a load (far cheaper than any other place we have used). The gym is fab, small but convienient and easy to use! The hotel provides a free shuttle to the universal and seaworld resorts and wet 'n' wild and aquatica. The times for universal were: 8.15am, 9am, 10am and 11.15am. Returning at: 5pm, 6.50pm, 7.50pm, 10pm, 10.45pm. The shuttle for Seaworld leaves at 9.15am. Wet 'n' Wild and Aqautica leave at 9.15am which is not always good if you need a sun shade as the sun shades are normally gone straight away when the park opens at 8am. We got a taxi to the parks on these days, if you go to reception the bellhop will put you directly into the taxi that sits out the front door and the price is about $14 to Aquatica or $9 to Wet 'n' Wild, the drivers do expect a tip (as does about everywhere!). Restaurants we enjoyed were TGI Fridays (just up from our hotel - TGI also does room service to your hotel room), Sizzlers (good for the big eaters), Ponderosa (for a huge buffet breakfast), Tony Romas (next to Ponderosa, lovely Ribs), Friendlys (good priced food and quick service, also does take out). Make sure if your not renting a car you make use of the I-Ride Trolley its a dollar a ride per person, or $5 each for 3 days unlimited or $13 dollars each for 2 weeks unlimited. It comes around every 20 minutes or sooner and is air conditioned inside. It goes all the way along international drive and stop 21 is just outside the hotel. All in all this was a fantastic hotel and we are already looking into booking again for next time. We just loved our stay and did not want to leave. I cannot give you one negative about the hotel! If you want more info then just ask! I'm sorry if you are now straining after reading this long winded review, but I find it frustrating when people give very short reviews and never explain their reasons for being negative. Hope you enjoy your stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Always the best!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Liylly
Reviews.Content: It is the sixth time we stay in Homewood Suites Convention Center and it`s the best place to stay in Orlando!Great breakfast,clean rooms,nice staff,specially Mr.Magana(manager) and Scott(night manager).There are also manager`s reception from Mon -Thu,which is a nice treat for guests.There are several great restaurants in walking distances,easy access to I-4 from the back exit in Universal Blv.I strongly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for a parks holiday”
Reviews.Author: SouthamptonClaire
Reviews.Content: Great accomodation, very modern, lots of space in the room. The staff were very friendly and helpful especially toasie who helped us us arrange all our transport and park tickets. The pool is small and ofter shaded but we spent all our time at the parks or out in the local area. The location is fantastic and we decided we did not need to get our free hire care that came with the holiday. We would return to this and other homewood suites anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Dead-metal
Reviews.Content: A great hotel. Good location on I Drive for the theme parks. Free breakfasts and evening snacks. The rooms are big, comfortable and very clean. The staff are very helpful. I have booked again for 2008 and 2009.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: pmb1001
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after a two week stay here, We were a party of seven that included two kids and had two rooms. Overall we had an excellent time with no major issues during our stay. We booked in very late at night and were quickly in our rooms with little or no fuss, which was great after a long journey. How ever one of our allotted rooms turned out to be rather noisy due to being located next to an air conditioning fan. We went down the next morning to get this room changed, Within ten minutes this had been done and the members of our party were moved to another quieter room. This was the only issue we had during our two weeks stay.Overall we were very satisfied with the quality and comfort of our rooms. We used the free breakfast and lunches sometimes , they were o.k. Nice option to have We also used the free transportation povided to Disney ( this goes to Epcot from where you have to use the Disney transportation to get to the other parks). We also used the transportation to Universal, Use the 8.15 one to get to the parks early and get on the coasters with little or no wait.This was great The pool was nice , clean and a great place to relax after a day at the parks, we used this a lot, It rarely got too busy and is very shaded all day so not great for sunbathing but this suited some of our party perfectly, you can use another pool that is located across the street at their sister hotel for sunbathing if required- just ask at the front desk . We found the staff to be very good and the managers were always around if needed, they were also very friendly and chatty. We used the Taxi firm( Sterling) that is used by the hotel a few times as we had no car, Found them good , We used them to go to Boggy Creek which is located near the airport, we got our price before going and the driver waited for us until we were finished before bringing us back, we did not find this expensive as there were seven of us in our group plus not waiting for a return shuttle was great. Overall I was very pleased with this hotel and will stay here again When we go back to Orlando in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rogzog
Reviews.Content: I can't speak highly enough of this place - it was great. Here are just some of the things we liked about it Great room layout with separate living room and bedroom so I could sleep while hubby spent his jetlag on the pc! Free wifi Free breakfasts - lots of hot and cold choices Free light evening meals Mon-Thurs (with drinks including wine or beer) - if you were a family on a budget this would have been enough to see you through - a different spceial every night eg meatballs, spag bol, baked potatoes etc The staff were all so friendly - and it's great that the manager or his assistant is there every breakfast time so you can mention things in passing When we did mention something it was sorted the same day Lots of choices of places to eat out nearby The pool was never crowded The dining room was busy but we could always get a table Great comfortable bed Efficient air conditioning In fact the only negative at all was the practice of putting the dishwasher on every day, no matter how small the load. Apparently Florida state law says they can't wash dishes by hand. After the first day when we discovered a single glass in the dishwasher (that had only been used for drinking water!!!) we asked our maid not to wash any dishes at all until we left! What a horrendous waste of energy! Why don't they do what Travelodge in the UK do and just swap in clean glasses and mugs and do all the dirties in one or two dishwashers? Still, this one criticism isn't enough to outweigh all the good points - we'd definitely be back like a shot if we ever had to go to Orlando again. R

Reviews.Title: “faultless service”
Reviews.Author: simplybest1
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor Member Leicestershire U.K. I have nothing but praise for this Hotel, the Manager and his staff are a credit to the Company.Nothing was to much trouble and all my needs were attended to immediately, my family and I had a wonderful stay and would definely consider coming here again. The free breakfast and dinner from mon-thurs was very good, but you need to be very early to get a table.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for amount spent”
Reviews.Author: Tyroltrekker
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Hotwire and had a great $48.00 a night rate for our stay. We found the rooms to be comfortable (we were in a two room suite). The suite had an extremely comfortable king sized bed with numerous pillows and a sleeper sofa that had the typical feel of a sleeper sofa (not quite a bed, but adequate). The room had a full size fridge, cooking range, microwave which is a definite plus if you are staying for several days or have a family traveling with you. The room also featured two televisions and one bathroom. The room was clean and quiet and we did not hear anyone in the other rooms. On the downside, the one bathroom in the room was in the master suite so anyone sleeping on the sleeper sofa would have to walk through the master suites to access the bathroom. If the hotel ever did a remodel, they should consider adding another door to access it. The hotel did have a hotel and jacuzzi in the courtyard which was great for swimming, but if you intend to get a great deal of sun, think twice. The design of the building obstructs the sun reaching parts of the courtyard. An evening reciption with wine, beer and sodas is available as well as a great hot breakfast buffet with self made waffles, bagels, toast, eggs, meat, cereal, yoghurt, fruit, sweet rolls etc. There was plenty to appeal to even the pickiest child eater. We found the hotel staff to be professional, but not overly friendly. Any issue or question brought to their attention was rapidly solved.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are correct, good place to stay when in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: SWsalesGuy
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews about Homewood Suites, we made our reservations to stay for the weekend. Our stay was like many others here. The front desk was very cordial and check in was prompt without any problems. The suite consists of a kitchen, living room and bedroom. In the living room was a sleeper couch that accommodated the kids. They had complementary breakfast but we we got up late both mornings and missed it. (available until 10am). Room was clean and the AC wasn't loud (important since it will be running while you sleep). The one downside is we did a little cooking and the teflon pan with pretty scratched up. They didn't have a spatula, so I think people used a forks. (I'm not lowering my rating since I didnt ask the front desk for a replacement.)

Reviews.Title: “You will get short changed!!!”
Reviews.Author: JoeBloggins
Reviews.Content: I just checked out of the hotel this morning and although I have no complaints about the facilities my experience left a sour taste in my mouth. I attended a conference to the conference center nearby and I booked the hotel through the conference directly. The advertised rate was $139 per night. When I showed up, I was told the rate was going to be $169 per night because I had asked for two double beds instead of a single king size bed. I have no problems paying extra if I know about it ahead of time and if I am getting extra for the price. If that was it, I would have lived with it. But there is more. The hotel advertises complimentary shuttle to Disney (Epcot taxi area). As requested by the hotel, we booked the shuttle 24 hours prior. When we were ready to get on the shuttle, it was already full. The driver said not to worry, someone else would bring us over to Disney shortly thereafter. Sure enough, a driver showed up in a mini-van a few minutes afterwards. Once onboard, he asked where we were going. Being the only family onboard, we asked to be dropped off to Riverside (our hotel lobby). When we arrived, the driver asked for $47 saying the complimentary ride was only to Epcot taxi area and not to Riverside. OK, we asked to be dropped off 3-4 miles further than the complimentary ride but that wasn't worth 47 dollars!!! When I called the hotel to rectify the situation, all I got was excuses. If you want to stay there, expect to be short changed!!! Staying on Disney directly is a better deal if you can.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dylema
Reviews.Content: we loved everything about this hotel.the staff were friendly and helpful the room was a nice size and lovely comfy bed.breakfast was great and really set you up for the day,we also enjoyed the evening reception it was nice to relax after a day at the parks .our children loved the pool as it never got too crowded it didnt bother us that it didnt get too much sun it was nice to have somewhere to cool down.we will defintly be returning to the homewood suites.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely happy once again!!”
Reviews.Author: moneyaware
Reviews.Content: Just back from our fifth year in homewood suites international drive. Had a fantastic room on ground floor which we requested, usual choice of breakfast hot or cold whatever you felt like. Managers reception from 5-7pm ideal for families with small kids (could give them their dinner at no charge), and a few beers for the adults. Pool not busy but shaded (which suited us fine as we dont like to be burnt. Very clean in pool and surrounding areas. Staff stay the same from year to year to year which is a fantastic sign of any hotel. Virgil the man who looks after your bags is the best!!!! Already pricing next year. ma

Reviews.Title: “Needs an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: spyderman99
Reviews.Content: We booked because this is a Hilton facility and based on the pictures at the hotels website. When we arrived it became apparent the pictures were slightly decieving. Overall the facility is in need of an upgrade. The pool is much smaller and not as nice as it appears and the two room suite was much smaller that we expected. The air conditioner ran constatnty when set on 75 degrees and would not run at 76 degrees. When the AC unit was running it had a loud squeek that unfortunately did not start until after midnight so we could not get the problem fixed. We were booked for 5 nights but only stayed one. On the positive side the breakfast was really good. Credit to management for not charging us for the room during our one day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Homewood Perfect for Families”
Reviews.Author: MNTourist08
Reviews.Content: Traveling with our 9 month old son. A dishwasher is essential for washing bottles and hotel provided us a crib. Breakfast and managers happy hour (drinks and light dinner served) saves lots of money. Agree with previous posts that pool doesn't get much sun and is chilly. Can't comment on location since we were visiting family, not theme parks. Plenty of restaurants and shops within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Extras to Make You Happy”
Reviews.Author: TC1968
Reviews.Content: Really just following up on the other reviews, this is a fine hotel. Staff are helpful, it's close to a lot of bars and restaurants, theres shuttles to the major attractions (though not always 100% reliable!!). Rooms are big and very well equipped with some nice extras - safe, kitchenette, free wireless internet, clock radio with ipod doc. centre. They also throw in some nice little extras like a business centre and "welcome home" beers and snacks on weekdays 5-7, The breakfast is OK, but a little limited and the pool area is small and a bit shaded, but tends to be very quiet so you could follow the sun or shade around, as you liked. One small gripe is that it was a bit noisy - the constant buzz of the aircon and the garbage truck that reverse-beeps its way round the carpark every morning before 7am, may irritate lighter sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for our holiday”
Reviews.Author: cheerfulchicken
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family in July 2007. It was a great base to stay. The rooms were clean. The cleaners didn't seem to clean the rooms at all while we were there but that made it seem more homely as we were able to relax and not worry about our family time being interrupted. If you're English and like a cup of tea i would definitely bring a kettle and your own tea bags. Their tea tastes like p*ss and they don't provide a kettle. It was very nice to have a suite as it was possible for family members to take a break from one another at times. There was a small problem with small insects climbing along the edge of the carpets in the bedroom and kitchen area but this was soon dealt with when reception was informed. We've been to Orlando 3 times before and this was by far the best hotel we've stayed in. Oh, and they have excellent facilities for laundering your clothes too.

Reviews.Title: “noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: mickey42
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for ten nights on the 080508 the hotel was clean and well placed for disney. but from the start the air conditioning hummed away day and night i never slept once and only made 3 days before checking out. we had to leave and check in to the wyndham for a good nights sleep. stay at the humming hilton and i guarantee you wont rest for the humming noise. i was shown lots of rooms all of which were equally noisey. staff were very helpful but like lying on top of noisy fan.

Reviews.Title: “Service, service, service!”
Reviews.Author: kadelia
Reviews.Content: We had a one-night stay and two business meetings at this location, and the staff will be the reason we return here for business! Everything they did was above and beyond what I've experienced at other hotels; not just polite but, "let me do the extra" at their initiative. I truly felt the service level was that you would find at a five-star resort! We had a suite in which we held our meetings, the rooms were clean and the staff allowed us to add our meeting location to the bulletin board downstairs (their suggestion). The hotel has bellhops that really help you with your luggage and double as concierge's (calling taxi's, etc)--what a lovely service to find at this type of hotel! Again, as a business location this was great; management was excellent. It is VERY close to attractions and International Drive has a bevy of restaurants in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best ......!!”
Reviews.Author: hel1304
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this hotel except for excellent!! In fact we have already booked to go back next year. When we arrived we had to be moved to Crowne Plaza for the 1 night as a conference had overrun which meant our room was not available. This was organised very well and they let us keep our suitcases at Homewood until the following day (apart from the 1 suitcase we kept) - Crowne Plaza was also a nice hotel! Back to Homewood Suites for breakfast - plenty of choice, bread and rolls, scrambled eggs, potatos, sausages, cereals, fruit, cakes, yogurts, juices, variety of teas, coffee, milk ... list is endless and always replenished by the friendly staff (used to save 1 choc muffin for my daughter if they were going to run out before we got down for breakfast) Reception staff and Toasy on Universal were brilliant - really friendly with the children and appeared to be really interesed in what we were upto. We did not drive so took full use of the shuttles which we found was great and when we did not take the shuttles we used the I-ride and lynx buses which were very cheap and easy to use. Location superb - walking distance of soooo much! Loads of good restaurants, shops, 2 crazy golfs - what more could we want! Rooms were adequate for what we needed and the bed was so commmmfy - rooms were cleaned to high standards everyday. OK - the pool does not get much sun, but it suited us to get the kids out of sun after time spent at the parks! If we did want to sunbathe you are allowed to use the sister hotel! All in all this was a fantastic stay

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Sicard54
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here based on Trip Advisor reviews and we wanted a suite. All reviews are accurate regarding pool lacking sun, cleanliness of rooms, friendliness of staff. Our stay was very good and we would definitely recommend this hotel. We believe the strengths of this hotel are its cleanliness, staff friendliness/assistance, breakfast buffet, and proximity to everything. The only things I would pick on (minor) are that I wished they had an elliptical machine in the fitness center and they could be more environmentally friendly as they don't have CFL lightbulbs or offer to not wash your towels/sheets every day to save on energy. Overall, a great value and a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Unicorn28
Reviews.Content: The reception staff was very friendly. The room was clean, bed was comfortable & it was very convenient having full size fridge to keep stocked with cold drinks & avoid paying theme park prices. There is an in room safe ($1.50 charge). There are laundry facilities on the 5 & 6th floor & soda machines on the 2nd. My room was overlooking the pool which seemed a good size but always busy (even at night but I was there during spring break) I donâ€™t think the pool area got sun in the afternoon / evening as it was in the middle of the hotel surrounded by rooms. The Breakfast area can get very busy & we had to take our food back to the room on one occasion but if you get their early enough you can get a table. The Breakfast buffet had a good choice & food was tasty. There are fruits, cereal, juices, eggs, potato, bacon, pastries / breads & you can make your own waffles. There always seemed to be a person stocking up the buffet so everything was fresh. There is always an evening drinks reception Monday to Thursday 5pm to 7pm but I wasnâ€™t back in the hotel at this time. There is a small shop at reception which sells snacks & a Universal desk selling tickets. They also provide shuttles to some parks but I had a car so I didnâ€™t use them. The car park is large & we never had a problem finding a spot by the front of the hotel. Location is excellent, there are many restaurants / bars & a cinema within walking distance. The hotel is also beside an I-ride trolley stop. The only problem I had with this hotel was the lack of a business centre. They do have a small room with two PCâ€™s but only one is attached to a printer (to fax or photocopy you must go to the front desk. I would definitely stay at this hotel again & have no problems recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good for our price”
Reviews.Author: disneygrl27
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our quick family weekend getaway this past weekend, April 26-27. We booked this through a website where we pick the price we want to pay. The suite was spacious, with an ample supply of linens and toiletries. The kitchen was complete with dishes & flatware-the furniture was a little dated, but great for the kids to jump all over-which we all know they will. The breakfast buffet was alright-the make your own waflles-not the best of ideas, but the food was good. Eggs, sausages, cereal, yogurt, donuts....I didn't care for the fact that they use styrafoam plates and plastic utensils-this is a Hilton and I expected more-which I worte on my hotel review paper in my room. The dining area could be bigger, and the tables will only fit 4 people-for larger parties you must either borrow a chair from a neighbor or if you're lucky push 2 together (we weren't lucky). The pool wasn't heated-we passed on swimming. We found that this hotel was mainly older travelers so the TV was news-not very stimulating for the kids-i didnt really feel it was kid friendly, although the staff was really nice to the kids. I am happy with the price I paid for this stay. The staff was very nice-super speedy check-in, and finding the elevator & room number a breeze. As far as the room went-it was great-very comfortable but I would not have wanted to pay full price-I like a more kid-friendly stay and I like to eat on dishes.

Reviews.Title: “More than happy”
Reviews.Author: Wallychops
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 weeks at the Homewood and really enjoyed it. The hotel was in a brilliant location at the back of Bahama Breeze, Olive Garden across the road, Walgreens and liqour store either side. Although the hotel furnishings were a little dated it was spotless and all common areas were visibly maintained constantly. We had no car so relied on the shuttle, which there were a few issues with but on the whole for me a lot less hastle than having to drive myself. In brief for Disney departs 0830/1020/1115 returns 1815/2030/2145 all to/ from Epcot. You have to prebook both times the night before which means you have to plan ahead abit. To do the late shows was OK obviously from Epcot, MGM you need to get a wriggle on, and MK you need either a taxi or as we did catch the Link bus, which is a bit long winded but at $1.75 who cares! I was very grateful to another advisor on this site for that info as none of the front desk staff appeared to be aware of it . The shuttle to Universal/Seaworld/Aquatica worked on a seperate timetable that varied slightly week to week and did'nt have be prebooked. The breakfasts are really good, plenty of choice everyhing was always being topped up and kept clean. Seating could get a bit tight but they had no problem with you taking stuff to your room. Never managed to get back in time for the mangers special but others we spoke to said it was OK. Also never once sat by the pool, although can see other peoples point, even if you are not wanting the sun there is not a great deal of room around it . All in all everything was excellent at the Homewood and I would stay there again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and huge free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: tingles
Reviews.Content: Booked on Tripadvisor recommendation as part of our 3 and half week tour of Floriday, stayed 6 nights. The location of this hotel is great and ideal for Universal and the water parks. You are within walking distance from loads of restaurants on Idrive and can hop on the trolley for loads more. The hotel staff are great, very helpful and the breakfast was a huge hit with our kids because they have a waffle maker that my son took great delight in using every morning. Although the breakfast was great, with a good choice, the evening welcome home dinner was not up to much compared to other Homewood Suites we stayed in on our holiday. The pool area was enclosed and got no sun at all that we could see, but you can use the sister hotel just opposite and they have a nice sunny pool, so thatâ€™s not a problem. The room was very nice with everything you could want but a bit cramped when the sofa bed was in use. The main bed was very comfy with great pillows and the staff were more than helpful, loading the dishwasher every day. I would definitely stay here again for its great location, free huge breakfast and comfy rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, great hotel and lovely pool.”
Reviews.Author: westcountryfamily
Reviews.Content: We (family of 5) stayed here in April for 2 weeks and had a fabulous time. The hotel is perfectly situated on I-Drive, within walking distance from many good restaurants. The staff were always pleasant, helpful and friendly to us. I have read some negative comments about the pool. If you are unfortunate enough to want to sun worship next to the shaded pool, when there are numerous more sunny places in which to sunbathe in this beautiful area then you might be disappointed. However, we found it a great place to actually swim/play in after busy days in theme parks (who needs to be next to a pool if all you want to do is sunbathe?). Our room was lovely with plenty of room for five of us, comfy beds and the sofa bed was ideal for our 13 year old. Good and cheap laundry facilities for active family in hotel. The breakfasts were ideal, plenty of choice and often replenished. There was no problem finding space in the dining room, and even if there were, you could always take a takeaway for your room. Managers Special (Mon-Thurs 5-7pm) was a real plus. As much beer, wine and soft drinks as you wanted and reasonable meals/snacks if too tired to go to a restaurant. Also, a number of local restaurants deliver to room if necessary. Hotel is located nicely for Universal and Seaworld (didn't use shuttle as had a hirecar) and only 20 mins from Disney. Having read one previous review, I woud recommend that if booking, you should request an exterior room (not overlooking pool) as the pool is open late and there may be some noise and is enclosed . Overall, we would strongly recommend this hotel and we had a brill holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Cant Fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: NickRUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel at the end of August 2005. There is nothing I can fault about this hotel whatsoever. We got there late at night after delays, the porter took us up to our room, we didnt like it as we were one of I think 5 rooms with no view whatsoever other than a brick wall, he called front desk and moved us to another room which was next to a lift so again we said we didnt want this and he took us to a 3rd room which had a pretty nice view of the pool, So I appreciate the service they gave us. The rooms are very spacious and the kitchen area is much appreciated espeically in the summer months when it's really hot and you can just get a nice cool drink. Bed's are comfortable even the sofa bed wernt too bad (I actually chose to stay on it, so it cant have been that bad!), just a little too small as at only 6ft my feet were well off the bed so I feel sorry for anyone taller. Out of 19 visits to orlando, we usual go out to a restaurant usual ponderosa for an all you can eat to fill us up, but we didn't have to go out once as the breakfast was excellent, all kinds of foods hot and cold. (cereal, pancakes, sausauges/pattys, bacon, scrambled egg, boiled eggs, bread to toast, bagels, waffles, grits, donuts, muffins, orange/apple juice, coffee/tea) and during the busy summer months, it wasnt all that busy in the breakfast area. The welcome home evening wasn't up too much to be honest, depends on whether you want too eat much for your evening meal or not but I couldn't say no to the free drinks. Never tried the shuttle to the theme parks as we had a rent a car, but my girlfriend and I are going back this summer so I will have to try the shuttle out as I am too young to drive, I know they run around 8-10 to all theme parks coming back between 4-10 in the evenining. Hardly used the pool as we were out a fair bit, wouldn't recommend it to sun seekers though, as it only got a maximum 3 hours sunlight. All in all, I had nothing but a great time at this hotel which is the reason for me booking it again. The staff were great, the breakfast was superb, the rooms were good, maid service was good and regular, and the hotel is based in a great location next to an Iride stop and close to many fast food and dining restaurants as well as attractions, shops (most noteably pointe orlando) and grocery stores. I would recommend this to anyone, it is underated by the 3 stars, and underpriced as by what is offered and as you get a suite, it is a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: ExpatinNorway
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but highest praise for our visit at the Homewood Suites Orlando Convention Center in early March 2008. I travel frequently for both business and pleasure, and I cannot remember a time in a hotel previously in which my experience was so thoroughly positive. I stayed for a week in the hotel with my wife and 2 kids, and was totally impressed with the hotel and its staff. All the staff of the hotel we encountered were, without exception, very professional, competent, and were consistently prompt in attending our requests. Attention to detail was impressive. During our week, we had several instances in which we needed some extra help, including needing some extra sheets at 1:00am because of an â€œaccidentâ€� in bed by one of our kids (new sheets arrived in less than 5 minutes). I asked to use one of the grills (they have 2) one evening, and it was already started for me when I arrived at the pool/grill area and I also noticed it was squeaky clean (not grungy and full of grease as Iâ€™ve seen with other â€œcommunalâ€� grills elsewhere). The staff at the breakfast area does a tremendous job keeping things stocked and clean in a very heavy-use situation that could quickly turn into chaos. Our housekeeper was happily flexible in working around our erratic schedule (one parent at a conference, another spending time with the kids). The front desk staff was always available and have answered my questions and provided me with good information. The gripes about the pool-sun issue are generally accurate, but the pool itself is nicely heated, the hot tub is generously hot, and the the pool area is very a pleasant gathering place. A tip for the true sun worshipers that won't be satisfied with the enclosed situation of the Homewood pool - just a short walk across the parking lot (less than 50m) is a very open pool at the Hampton Inn, that is free to use for all Homewood guests (both hotels are owned by Hilton) - viola, problem solved. In summary, my wife and I both agree that this hotel has really been a dream. My congratulations go out to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mclaren1Ireland
Reviews.Content: Great rooms with seperate live area (rare in Orlando). The staff are really nice. Great location on I Drive. The breakfast is great. One of the best on I Drive for the money I am going back in 2 weeks to get married & my nearly all of my guests are olso staying, on my reccomendation. Definitly reccomend

Reviews.Title: “Holiday”
Reviews.Author: 84nod
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites for 14 Days 14/03/2008-28/03/2008. After reading all the good reviews of this hotel on trip advisor. We wish we had not bothered, why all the good reviews?The reception / front desk staff where unfriendly and unhelpful they seemed to be doing you a favour by serving you. The same with the so called security staff, speaking of which anybody could enter and wander around the hotel without anyone challenging them, even eating the breakfast and managers welcome snacks without being a guest of the hotel.As stated before the pool is a problem without much sunlight, if you are unlucky like us you will be given a room that overlooks the pool courtyard, this retains the sound of all the air con units and pool filtration plant which echo around this area, so you will not be able to get a good nights sleep. Talking of sleep the beds are not very comfortable and the fold up bed cum sofa that our son had to use is well past its sell by date. The room itself needs to be renovated as its age is showing. All in all we wish we had stayed at the Hampton Inn, Pointe Orlando again, we stayed here in April 2006 The staff there do there very best to make your stay that much better.

Reviews.Title: “Homewood Suites - Absolutely Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: ej1970
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a two week stay at the Homewood Suites with my family. I am very pleased to say that all the reviews which I read before going were accurate. The staff are absolutely wonderful. They can not do enough to help you and they really made our stay really enjoyable. The rooms are fine maybe a little dated but size wise they are ample. The breakfast is perfect, lots of selections - does not seem to differ from many of the buffet breakfasts on offer in many of the local restaurants. From Mon - Thurs there are welcome home drinks and food served by the hotel from 5 - 7. We only made it back for this once, but the was wine, beer and soft drinks - each night there are different meals it is a nice touch. The location of the hotel is perfect, we did not hire a car, we used the hotel shuttle to the parks and the I Ride to get out and about. There are lots of restaurants within walking distance of the hotel so a car is not really necessary. The one drawback of the hotel is the swmming pool, it is is a courtyard so it does not really get any sun, there was hardly anyone at the pool and we never used it ourselves. While we were there is was my daughters birthday, I asked if something to be arranged, on the day of her birthday when we came back from the parks in the room they left her a birthday cake, balloons and a card signed by all the staff it was a lovely gesture. I would have absolutely no hesiation in recommending this hotel, the location is perfect, the price is extremily competitive, the staff are wonderful and it will help make your holiday memorable. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “TripAdvisor reviews were spot on”
Reviews.Author: Wahoolio
Reviews.Content: Stayed here March 16 through March 23 with wife and kids ages 9, 7 and 4. This trip we visited Universal parks, Sea World and Aquatica. Picked this hotel based on proximity to these parks and reviews on TripAdvisor. Great staff, breakfast more than adequate, clean and spacious rooms with kitchen amenities. Great hotel value and location for a family hitting the theme parks in this area. As for some of the pool complaints you may have seen in the reviews, they're accurate to the extent the pool is in a courtyard surrounded on all four sides by hotel rooms stacked five stories high. When the sun goes down in late afternoon, the wind whips up and it can get a bit chilly. Then again, come July - Sept., I don't think it would matter too much.

Reviews.Title: “Great as always”
Reviews.Author: kennysmom
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Homewood Suites every March for a long weekend. It is consistently excellent. The breakfast is a nice selection of all sorts of breakfast foods. The rooms are comfortable and housekeeping does a great job daily. The staff is very helpful, especially when our airport limo didn't show up to return us to the airport. The staff quickly found us an inexpensive taxi and we made it to the airport on time. It has gotten to the point that my family doesn't care what parks we go to as long as we stay at the Homewood Suites! Thanks so much Homewood Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Homewood suites-made a good holiday fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: apogee68
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 14 night stay at the Homewood 1/3/08-15/3/08.All the staff are very helpful,but toasy,virgil and our maid maria b were fantastic.Rooms very clean,comfy beds and shuttle service to the parks was very good.Great choice of food for free breakfast.We wil only be staying here on future visits to orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: donnabor
Reviews.Content: We were at the Homewood Suites for 5 nights attending a convention at the Orange County Convention Center. We couldn't have asked for a better place to stay. We had king suites that were huge and very well equipped complete with a full-size refrigerator and dishwasher. The rooms were clean and the showers were the best we'd ever had in a hotel room. The breakfast was very good and the evening light meals they served were very appreciated. However, the best thing about this hotel was the friendliness of the staff. Every single person we encountered was helpful and friendly right down to the bellboys who "welcomed us home" every time we came in. The location is also a great reason to stay as we were in walking distance of many wonderful restaurants. All in all we had a terrific experience at this hotel and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks, Tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: Chorizogolf
Reviews.Content: We were directed by Tripadvisor comments to choose this hotel for our last night in Florida. We were really impressed. We were upgraded to a two bedroom suite (how could we use 4 beds in one night?) with two bathrooms. There was a management freebie reception in the evening and an excellent hot breakfast in the morning - all for $120.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: Solange72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after a cruise and chose it based on tripadvisor reviews. Accomodations were spacious and comfortable. No room service but we ordered a pizza. Staff was exceptionally kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: pycky
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, nice area, easy to find, plenty of parking, close to attractions. Rooms are equipped with TVs, refrigerator, microwave, stove, coffe maker, toaster, pots and pans, cups and glasses, silvareware. Shuttle comes and goes to Disney and Universal 3 times a day. You have to make reservation 1 day in advance for Disney shuttle, to Universal on the day you need the service. Pool is in the courtyard, does not get much sunlight, but it is nice, clean and large. Rooms are rather small but cozy. Breakfast; potatoes, eggs, sausages, waffles, muffins, pancakes, bagles, butter, jams, coffe, milk, tea, juice, joghurt, apple, bananas, different cereals. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: disneyloverontario
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Homewood for 10 nights and all I can say is this is an excellent place to stay. All of our needs were more than met.. The staff there are so pleasant and knowledgable about anything you could ask or need. We didnt get a car while there and the shuttles to the parks were great and you are within walking distance to anything and everything you could need. Including more sightseeing places etc. The I- Trolley that runs is so convenient as we took a day off to shop and for $1.00 per person each way it is the way to go.One day we decided to come back early from universal and the cab cost was only $8.50. We then got to spend time in the pool and hot tub..The breakfast is a great way to start the day and has so many choices.. We didnt do the meet and greet supper but it looked great. I loved the idea of the separate bedroom as my Granddaughter and I were ready for bed by 9 and my husband wanted to stay up so off we went and closed the door and right off to sleep. Our overall stay was more than perfect and will gladly do the Homewood again. We have previously stayed at the same place for about 10 years but we will now be staying here. Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Second Choice To Embassy Suites/Jamaican Court”
Reviews.Author: wearytraveler1974
Reviews.Content: In January 2005, my wife and I stayed because the Embassy Suites on Jamaican Court (which is nearby) off International Drive was booked. Like the Embassy Suites staff, we found the staff, accomodations, rooms, etc. just fine. This hotel is a bit hard to find, so let me give you some landmarks. If you're coming from Sandlake Drive (off I-4 Exit 74A), make a right onto International Drive. Follow your nose, but watch for a Bahama Breeze and TGI Fridays restaurant on the left hand side. The hotel is in the back and the entrance is between these two restaurants. Follow the road all the way to the back. I will tell you this - watch your timing when you get here as both restaurants get VERY busy and the parking lot tends to get a bit congested. Your best time is to get here between 2pm and 4pm. If your room is not ready, then just hop over to either Bahama Breeze or TGI Fridays for a drink and wait until your room is ready. Room service, last time we stayed here, was provided by TGI Fridays. :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend getaway!”
Reviews.Author: annegel623
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I wanted to get away for the weekend and decided to drive to Orlando (We live about 2 hours away). We always pick different hotels to stay at when we go, but this was by far the best hotel we have stayed at so far! Free breakfast in the morning (and served until 10 too!) with every breakfast food you could imagine! Our bed was extremely comfortable and neither one of us wanted to get out of it. The hotel room itself was VERY clean and had everything we needed. The fridge was huge and perfect to store our leftovers from the night before... and the microwave was handy to re-heat them the next day. The hotel itself is a perfect location! Right on I-drive by the upscale restaurants... Tommy Bahamas is a MUST! We didn't use the pool at all, but our room looked out to it and it looked very inviting! Wireless internet was awesome in the room-- full service and no problems at all! I felt very safe here too since the doors all around the building are locked and you need a room key to get in. Only complaint was that we drove by it at first.... it's directly behind the Bahama Breeze, so you can't really see the actual building... you really need to look for the hotel sign out front to turn in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrishHoliday
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent 13 nights in the Homewood Suites from the 18 of December up to New Years Eve. My wife, thirteen year old boy and myself had never been to Orlando before and we spent the best part of 8 months looking at reviews of this hotel and where not disappointed. â€œIt is exactly what it says on the tin.â€� This is not a four star hotel or a hotel pretending to be. It offers good value for money, great service and ideal location. If there is a better placed hotel on I-drive, it can only be next door. Great selection of restaurants, all within strolling distance (5-10min.). Universal studios 15 min drive and Disney within 20-25 minutes. Great Breakfast, loads of choice, scrambled eggs, sausage, hash browns, cereals, fruit, bagels the list goes on and you donâ€™t have to eat here go to Denneyâ€™s (2 min walk). Beds where very comfortable, we had a one bed suite and used the fold out couch for my son. Large main room with a kitchenette, 2 ring cooker and microwave. Bedroom and main room had TVâ€™s so he could watch what he wanted. Good choice of TV stations, HBO for movies. The staff are fantastic; we had two small problems with our room within minutes both were fixed. The lady at the Universal Desk, brilliant. I had pre booked my tickets so I didnâ€™t need her for universal but she gave great advice re restaurants and shopping, stop and talk to her, even if itâ€™s just for the discount coupons. The managers evening is worth a visit, free drinks and something to eat. We used it a few times just to sit down with drinks before we headed off out to eat. Oh, yes the decoration may be a bit tired, so what, are you going to spend all day here? Two complaints Iâ€™ve seen on this forum time and again are swimming pool and tables at breakfast. Well, we took the advise of contributors to this forum and didnâ€™t use the hotel pool instead we check with reception and used one of the neighbouring Hotels pools (sorry canâ€™t remember which one) thatâ€™s were we spent our afternoons after shopping and parks. The breakfast room can get busy, so go early never late, 7-7.30am, or be prepared to hang around waiting for a free spot, or like us stack up and head for your room. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Just read the reviews and be sure it's what you want.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but dated”
Reviews.Author: ukholidaymaker85
Reviews.Content: The free breakfast at this hotel is excellent and overall the hotel represents excellent value for money. It would be good for families with children wanting to go to themeparks. The location is good so that you could manage without a car. The staff try very hard indeed. We were disappointed however to find the rooms rather dated and tired and somewhat disspiriting - don't stay here if you plan to spend time in and around the hotel grounds. The pool is in an internal courtyard - maybe good for kids in high summer but no sun at all for winter vacationers.

Reviews.Title: “Great for convenience and value”
Reviews.Author: LetsgoFtLaud
Reviews.Content: We arrived and the room was clean and we were happy to find it right down the road from Sea World which made it convenient. Is in the western part of International Drive which is less packed than the older part of that area. For the price you get a very nice breakfast and the staff is friendly. I like a little more fluff in my hotel but we chose to bypass the Hilton this time as my son was in tow. Overall the price works for what you get and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “very good service and price”
Reviews.Author: smakhoul
Reviews.Content: stayed in the hotel from 15-18 october 2007. good rooms, very clean, good size. we had king size suite which had a bedroom, bath and sitting area with little kitchenette. fridge, microwave, coffee maker and a dishwasher. 2 tvs with good selection of channels. area was perfect near to every thing. we had our car so we were not sure about the shuttle bus to attraction. most things are about 15 minutes drive. good selection for breakfast, not many healthy options/fruits/cheese but this is in similar hotels in the states.(free) afternoon, they had a free small buffet which they change every day, didn't try it myself but others said it was OK. room service is from TGI fridays. nearby, 2 outlet malls, premium outlet, top class shop (on the expensive side ) and prime outlet down the road (international drive), also is good. millienuim mall is great but very very expensive. they have cheesecake factory over there florida mall is nice as well, and they have buca di beppo (one of the best/nice family atmosphere I've been to) so make sure you try try it if you have never been there, also, they have panera bread for breakfast if you don't want to eat at the hotel. finally, near prime outlet there is a restaurant called texas de brazil. the best one in all orlando, a little bit on the expensive side. they have a salad bar with 4 hot selection 9beans, rice, muchroom, and potatos) and huge selection of salad. then they have a huge selection of BBQ on your table with side of bannas and mash. also pao de queso. then desert9no space left after the meal) 4 of us was $250 including the tip and not much alcohol but if you can afford it, please go and you won't be disappointed( my wife is vegiterian and still love it). as all the rest of attraction like disney, epcot, universal and sea world, I'm sure that you already know every thing as you're checking hotels so you made up your mind about coming to orlando so you know about them

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room with a Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: venicefloridamom
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights and we were very pleased with the experience. We had 2 double-beds, which felt a little small, but the room was very clean with ample space for our family of 4. The kitchen had a table with chairs for 2, a 2-burner stove, full size fridge, coffee-maker, microwave and dishwasher. Dishes, glasses, silverware and pots/pans were included, as was dishwashing detergent. We had everything we needed! Breakfast was a full spread - with 3 waffle irons always at the ready (and no lines), along with eggs, sausage, potatoes, and then all of the usual muffins/bagels/cereals/fresh fruit/yogurt options typically available at hotels. I was particularly pleased with the drink selections - which included both skim and low fat milk. The fitness room was well-equipped with a treadmill, stair climber, rowing machine, dumbells and an all-in-one weight lifting station. TV, towels and water were right there in the room. As for location, it is right in the middle of a huge selection of restaurants and shops, many within walking distance. The hotel is hidden away behind a row of restaurants, so check the hotel website for directions. We really enjoyed the Ming Court and Cafe Tu Tu Tango and highly recommend! It's also a very short drive to SeaWorld and Universal (shuttle is available but we chose to drive). We wouldn't hesitate to stay at this hotel again next time we're in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: DSchrute
Reviews.Content: Just spent last weekend at this great hotel. If you're looking to be somewhere between both Universal and Disney, this is a great location. Being on International Drive, it's right in the heart of all the action. The room was exceptionally clean, with it's own full sized kitchen and a free hot breakfast buffet. We got a great deal on Expedia of only $74 a night (off season) for a two room suite with a King. Geat service, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “good value great service”
Reviews.Author: fajaragirl
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 10am and were given a room straight away which was a bonus. Very comfortable with separate sitting room/kitchen. fully equipped. TV in bedroom and sitting room with a channel telling you all about the nearby parks very useful. Everyone was very helpful and the room cleaned daily. Breakfasts were excellent and if you wanted to take it back to your room to eat that was no problem the free food in the evenings mon-thursday was not that good but hey it was for free, wine and beer and soft drinks were free too. Personally i don't like eating and drinking from throw away products but it was all so cheap that it didn't matter too much Pool a bit small but adequate , Great hot tub near the pool. I would definitely stay here again but not booking it through expedia it turned out to be a lot more expensive than booking direct with the hotel. Still you live and learn Excellent hotel and staff ,near lots of shops and the I ride trolley stop to sea world.

Reviews.Title: “5* Quality for the price of a 3*”
Reviews.Author: sam2607
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. Staff in the lobby, on reception and guest services are very helpful and welcoming. The rooms are superb. The kitchen is very well equipt if you feel like cooking your own meals, with a supermarket only a short walk away. There are also plenty of nearby places that will deliver. The beds are very comfy, including the sofa bed! The bathroom is modern and clean, and there is a TV in the bedroom and lounge and a small dining table in the lounge. Breakfast in the morning is very good, serving cereals, fruit, pastries, bread, waffles, tea, coffee and hot breakfast. Although i never ate at the welcome home lunch i did take a peak and it also looked great. The pool is a little small and enclosed, however this posed no problem as we never spent anytime around the pool as there is much too much to do otherwise. The location of the hotel is perfect. It is no more than a $10 taxi ride from all the main parks and about $20 to disney. Though it does run free shuttles buses to all the parks which are very useful. In Orlando, I highly recommend the Cirque du Soliel and the Blue Man group shows, excellent nights out! Overall this hotel is excellent value for money, and we throughly enjoyed our time there, i just cant belive it isn't higher than a 3*!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrissy78
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in Jan 07 through Alpha rooms and thought everything was fine until I got there and checked in! I had requested a twin room for me and my 9 year old son but Alpharooms had booked and paid for a double room and charged me for a twin! Mario on the front desk was great and explained what had happened and 'upgraded' our room for free. So luckily both my son and I was able to have good nights sleep in one of the best and comfortable beds I have ever slept in! Do not book through Alpharooms! The check in was fast and Eva (receptionist) was extremely helpful, (my son wants to marry her)! Our room was on the second floor and although it was near the lift it was very very quiet. Breakfast was good but as it is more of a business hotel breakfast finished at 10am...although there are many other places on International Drive to eat at. The welcome home snack was ok but not great. The pool was a good size and depth and my son was able to play about and swim comfortably. Even the gym was good! I was a bit disappointed at how far the hotel was from everything but it was only a short stroll from I Drive and looked a lot nicer than others on I Drive. Bedrooms are huge (it felt like little flat) and are very clean. In short great hotel from the beds to the staff and free transportation to Universal. I would recommend you stay at this hotel if you are driving as we kept getting caught in the rain! All in all a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: jfmelle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Homewood Suites for 9 nights in September 2007. I booked the hotel in advance myself, through the hotel web site. I paid in advance, a special rate. I stayed there with my wife, and reserved a standard King size bed room. I must say that the hotel was exceptionally clean, bed was really comfortable, and hotel personnel was extremely polite and helpful in the few moments a needed them. A lamp needed to be changed, and was changed almost as soon as I requeste that at the front desk. At the end of the day, a recorded message at the phone mail box was informing me that the lamp was changed and asking me to double check it. Breakfast was great. Scrambled eggs, waffles, muffins, bread, cream cheese, juices, coffee, etc... There was a good replenishment everytime it was necessary. Finally, the wi-fi internet was free, and it really was fast. In summary, it was a great stay, with no complains at all. The hotel also offered a free managers reception every afternoon. I always arrived late at night, and couldn't enjoy it. In terms of location, the hotel is very close to the Convention Center, in a very nice neighborhod. There are plenty of restaurants within a walking distance, and even a supermarket/ drugstore. Universal theme parks are 15 minutes away by car, and Disney parks are no more then 25 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel stay!”
Reviews.Author: PhillyGirl38
Reviews.Content: The Homewood Suites near Universal was the perfect place for our family to stay during our Orlando vacation. Everything was super-clean and comfortable and the staff was wonderfully attentive. The offered a great selection of items for breakfast as well as a "Welcome Home" reception in the early evening with drinks and snacks. The free shuttle to Universal was a great alternative to parking! My son had fun swimming in the large pool and I enjoyed a good workout in the gym. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: TheEdwards'
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 2 weeks at the Homewood and don't have a bad word to say about it. Reception staff were polite & efficient, check-in was quick & easy. Suites were spacious, (we had 2 adjacent 1 bedroom suites), king sized beds were comfy and the pull out in the lounge was fine and spacious. Kitchens had a large fridge & freezer, dishwasher, micro etc. Breakfast was free every day from 7 to 10am including 5 cereals, scrambled egg, diced fried potatoes,either sausage or burger, make your own waffles, pancakes, toast, bagels, french toast, cinamon rolls, danish pastries, preserves & cream cheese. Tea, Coffee, juice, lemonade and coke available. There was a stready influx of diners every morning but only on Labor Day did we not manage to find a table (but there were 6 of us) so we took breakfast back to our room. (the maid then fills the dishwasher and returns trays back to the kitchens). It was useful having breakfast included, this meant we only went out for a buffet breafast once as a last day treat. Managers Welcome Home reception is on Mondays to Thursdays from 5 to 7pm. Even though this is advertised as 'snacks' it was pretty much a full meal. Each night consisted of soup, salads, dips and a meal which changed each night (eg Sloppy Joes, Chicken & Rice, Spag Bol, Chicken Alfredo etc) and free sodas, Bud lights, red, white or rose wine. As many have commented the pool is in the shade for most of the day, but we found this a welcome respite from the sun. The housekeeping staff were always very friendly and happy, seeming to take a genuine interest in where people are going etc. The location is very handy, though not directly on I-Drive (behind Dennys and Bahama Breeze).

Reviews.Title: “fantastic value/great customer service/best hotel we have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Bonyturn
Reviews.Content: We arrived here on 28th August. very quick check in - mentioned it was our 1st wedding anniversary. Within 10 mins of getting into our room, Virgil, the concierge, brought us a gift of 2 small bottles of wine & some shower/bath products - very impressed! The rooms were very big. There were two TVs. The bed was massive. The fridge freezer was huge. The apartment was cleaned well daily. the location is set back slightly from I-drive, so little noise. The pool gets sun from approx 11am thru to 5pm, but you need to swap loungers after 2pm to follow the sun. Toasy, the Universal lady, was fantastic. very knowledgeable & very good at her job. The best restaurants nearby are the Mexican/Tony Romas/Dennys. Most taxi drivers could not locate the hotel without some assistance so may be best to bring a hotel card with you. This was the best hotel we have ever stayed at ( and we have been to many all round the world).

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!”
Reviews.Author: Eggg
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many great hotels all over the world and I would rate the Homewood Suites up there, especially factoring in the low rate for a one bedroom suite and very adequate breakfast. The room was spotless and I should've asked what kind of beds they had because it was one of the best I've ever slept on with nice linens and a comfy duvet. The housekeeping staff was very accomodating when asked for extra towels, shampoo, (nice touch, Neutrogena products) and more blankets. Why more blankets in the middle of summer? Because the a/c works great, especially after a long hot day at the House of Mouse. The staff at the front desk were great too. We arrived at the hotel around 8:30 am and they were more than happy to store our luggage til we checked in much later in the day. Also, when I requested more popcorn (hey, I had three kids with me!), they told me they were out but to go ahead and take a pint of ice cream from their small convenience store, next to the front desk. Never had time to use the pool as our stay there was only 3 days so can't comment on it. An added perk? Free internet usage in their business center and although there is only 2 computers, I never had a problem finding one available. On the last day we were there, I requested a late checkout, kind of pricey, almost what we paid for one night, but our flight wasn't leaving til 7:30 pm so having the room til 5 pm made our last day in Orlando much easier not having to pack early or lug around all our luggage. All in all? A 5 star experience at this hotel and would highly recommend to anyone visiting the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Bliss”
Reviews.Author: thetravellingcouple
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during the first week of or two week honeymoon. We had a little apartment to oursleves, with large bedroom, little sittingroom/kitchen. Everything in the apartment worked and was clean and fresh. The kitchenette allowed us to have our own breakfasts and make tea/coffee when we pleased. We were on about the 5th floor, there were a couple of lifts to use that were in good order too. Rooms were tidied/ cleaned daily and towels changed if you requested. The hotel is well situated and there are plenty of eating places - both restaurants and buffets in the surrounding streets offering food at good prices. In fact, Orlando is a great place to be self catering as it is really cheap to eat out! We enjoyed our stay and it was a great base for exploring Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: shell13
Reviews.Content: we stayed here july/aug 2007 and found the hotel to be clean and nice. the staff were friendly and helpful, always polite and happy to help. the breakfast was ok and there was a variety of choices but these were the same every day and by the second week we got bored and ended up eating either in room or out but this was just us other people had no complaints . only tried the evening meal once but it was ok. the pool was a good size and being in the middle of the hotel felt safe, for those people facing the pool you'll be relieved to hear they are very strict about the 10pm shutting. we would not hesitate to stay again. please feel free to ask any questions

Reviews.Title: “Loved Homewood !”
Reviews.Author: littlerockertoo
Reviews.Content: stayed here july 21-24 2007. had a Great stay! Big suite with King bed (comfy), several pillows. big tv with playstation in bed room. nice vanity with neutrogena toiletries. big bathroom with quiet toilet. central heat/air. big living room with another tv with vcr . full kitchen -fridge with ice maker, dishwasher, garbage disposal. Breakfast was Great! pancakes, waffles, french toast, toast, bagles, muffins, cereal, juices etc . except it was always busy & crazy at breakfast time. very quiet hotel on I-drive close to everything. the visitor center is just around the corner from this hotel within walking distance so that was a plus! the trolly takes you up & down I-drive but can get very crowded & they drive kinda fast/crazy. one lady fell getting off! if im ever in Orlando again I will only stay here at the homewood as it was THE Best!

Reviews.Title: “Nice for business travel”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Robles
Reviews.Content: I went to a technical convention (Tech-Ed 2007) in Orlando and needed a nice place to stay. I stayed at the Homewood Suites for 7 nights and had a wonderful experience. The hotel is ALL suites and I got a two room suite. King bed, vanity area, kitchen (with table) and two televisions (one in the bedroom and one in the livingroom area). I cannot tell you how nice the staff was. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. I also got a really nice breakfast in the morning and light dinner in the evening if I wanted. This is all included and came as a bit of a surprise because it was pretty good. The room was the best part. I didn't have to lay in bed to go online or watch tv. That is something I really hate about extended stays in hotel rooms. I also had to work while I was there and it was nice to have a seperate area to do that in. The windows actually opened so I could get a nice cool breeze in the evenings and give the air conditioner a break. I actually ended up having to do laundry while I was there and they have a nice laundry facility and I was able to buy laundry detergent and such in the little store they have on site. Very convenient. I would definately recommend this hotel for business or a family getaway as it is VERY close to the Convention Center and Disney / Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “A Magical place”
Reviews.Author: sparklew0rks
Reviews.Content: My family and i absolutely adored this place. We stayed here near Christmas and the beautiful decorations made the place seem magical. There is a fishtank in reception that my daughter loved! We truely felt at home here. The staff were lovely, they seriously could not do enough to help.
