Alot of Americans stay here and we found them to be really warm and friendly, our 7 year old daughter was mezmerised by the accents! The pool was heated so even in december when the locals were in sweaters we were swimming in the pool at 9 o clock at night, usually on our own!! The jacuzzi was heaven. We used free transport and it was spot on, these little mini vans would turn up and whisk us off to the theme parks in no time, they only take you to epcot but it was no hassel using disney transport to get to chosen park. We used I Ride trolley to go to seaworld as there is a stop 2 min walk away (although there is a free bus) universal transport is a coach, also fine. Breakfast was great loads of choice, there are free drinks and food in the evenings too!! What more could you ask for?? TGI fridays is nearby and they also deliver room service, which was really nice. There is adventure golf, cinemas, restaurants nearby too. Our bed was huge and comfy, maid service was excellent,. We would recommend it to anyone. Having read such awful reviews of so many hotels in orlando, you MUST stay here, don't risk staying anywhere else!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: djcDublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Myself, wife and 2 children had no complaints with this hotel. The little things that made a difference to our stay: Good breakfast, free drinks/snacks reception 5pm-7pm Monday to Thursday, friendly and helpful staff, free use of hotel gym, ATM in reception, computer games in reception area, free towels at pool, pool open till 10PM, washing/drying machine facilities, clothes iron/ ironing board in room, hair dryer, TV in each room, free newspaper delivered to door most days, small shop in hotel, hotel's close proximity to local restaurants, cinemas and shops. All of the above contributed to an enjoyable two week stay in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. Can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: Corkonians_7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Homewood Suites from the2nd - 23rd of June along with my wife and son aged 11. From start to finish it was fantastic. We checked in in 5 minutes and our rooms excellent. For the duration of our stay there the staff were very friendly and helpfull. The pool area was quiet and very relaxing. The shuttle service to and from the parks were first class. The breakfast in the morning was plentiful and very well set up. The manager's evening was very relaxing after a long day. Not forgetting Toasy at the front desk who was also very helpfull. A huge thank you to all the staff for a very relaxing stay. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: MarkCornwall_UK
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. My wife and myself and our two boys aged 15 and 7 stayed for two weeks. We booked a two bedroom suite which was well worth the money for the extra space. The hotel is well run and the staff are courteous and helpful. The location in the middle of iDrive is ideal. The breakfast buffet was simple and fine and ideal for hungry kids. The late afternoon free drinks and snacks between 5-7 Mon-Thurs were also a nice touch. We have stayed in some far more expensive and luxurious hotels but we felt so comfortable and looked after here it was great value for money. The pool is nice and although it does lose the sun early its never to cold to swin in. The pool is also great for kids who can play and have fun unlike many "stuffy" hotel pools. The hotel runs shuttles to all the parks and the iDrive trolley is right outside to ferry you up and down including a stop at SeaWorld. Its a small shame that the Disney shuttle comes back so early as you have to catch a cab if you want to stay for the parade or firesworks at Magic Kingdom. We will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “just basic, too crazy”
Reviews.Author: Digest
Reviews.Content: stayed in various homewood suites, this one was my least favorite. good location if you are looking for sea world and universal, a little out of the way to disney. the staff did not seem as friendly as most homewood suites the property is a bit larger than your average h.s., which makes it more noisy and the breakfast was crazy, never ate there rooms are smaller than normal and the place looks a little used up, could be because of the family environment, manyf undisciplined children running all over, out of control, parents no where in sight walking distance to capitol grill and the seafood place next door, pretty good food for orlando do not go to the store down the street, it was horible, go to pubix instead

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Will visit again.”
Reviews.Author: esshua
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel May 29-June 3. I booked our stay on the Hilton website and received an excellent rate of $135 per night. This rate was the nonrefundable Hilton Net Direct rate. We had a 2 bedroom suite. One bedroom had a king bed. The other bedroom had 2 double beds. Since I am a Gold Hilton Honors member, I was able to check-in online by using the new e-checkin feature. I selected my actual room number (#317)online and the process was very quick and easy. Arrival was a breeze. All I did was sign and my keys were handed to me. There was a bellman available to help us take the luggage to the room. What I liked best about the hotel was the location. Excellent location. There were neutrogena products in the bathroom and the housekeeper did a very nice job of cleaning our room each day. We called down for additional towels and received them in less than 5 minutes. Due to the full parking lot, we sometimes had to park around the side of the hotel at night. But the hotel is well lit and we could enter from the side door with our room key. The hotel staff was nice and friendly. They gave good directions and remembered my name! I was totally impressed by that. The breakfast was good. However, we grew tired of it by the 3rd morning and decided to skip breakfast or grab a bite elsewhere. We just wanted more variety, but you cannot beat the fact that breakfast was included. We didn't utilize any of the hotel transportation or the trolley so I cannot speak on those.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Disney Trip”
Reviews.Author: EuropeCruiser
Reviews.Content: My family and I just came back from a great 4 night stay at this hotel. We wanted to get to Disney with the kids (5 of them) and this was a great place to stay for that. It took us 10 minutes to drive to the parks each day, and we certainly saved hundreds of dollars in food we didn't have to buy, due to the free breakfasts, and evening "snacks"! The hotel had free shuttles to Disney and Universal, and maybe others, but it was so easy to drive, we chose to go on our own schedule - it worked perfectly. Other than a brief issue with the hot tub not working for a few hours, everything was great. I heartily recommend this hotel to others going to any of the parks in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic again”
Reviews.Author: BarryLongridge
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Homewood Suites on Thursday 17th May. Check-in was a breeze and we were soon up in our rooms (3rd floor- lift is still a bit slow, but you can take the stairs) Rooms are fantastic, everything you could wish for, and the bed is wonderful!!! Also, safe in room is a good idea. The rooms were kept spotless everyday (we had Alzona cleaning ours, wonderful woman, very polite, always smiling) The breakfasts are really good, cereals, fruit, porridge, muffins, cakes, juice, coffee/tea, sodas, hot items (usually sausage, potatoes, and scrambled eggs - why no boiled eggs?), and my wifes favourite - waffles with jam/maple syrup and cream!!!! As we were at the parks most days, or out for tea - loads of options for food within 3 blocks, we only had the managers tea - time special once, but it was good, and free beer!!! All the staff go out of their way to be helpful, polite and to take the time to talk to you. The badges they wear (W.I.T.- Whatever It Takes) say it all. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Orlando who wants to stay in the middle of I-Drive. Car parking is free, and the parks are all near - Wet n Wild - 5 minutes, Universal - 10 minutes, Disney 15-20 minutes. Thanks Homewood, keep up the good work, and we'll see you next time!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms but problems”
Reviews.Author: fbird74
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel for one night on the first night of our vacation and two nights at the end of our vacation. We arrived at 9:00 pm to be told that they had given our rooms away but they had booked us at another hotel. When we queried the staff as to the amenities at the "new" hotel we were told that they were not sure if they had a complementary breakfast but we were welcome to come back here for breakfast. I asked for a phone so I could call home to advise family of the new phone number in case of emergency and they were not able to provide me with a phone. We were to meet friends that night at 9:30. By the time we argued with staff and got into our new hotel it was 10:30. The night supervisor was rude and uncaring. The hotel they sent us to was not the same quality as the Homewood Suites. The last two nights of our vacation we had no problem at check-in. The hotel room was very nice. I spoke with the assistant manager regarding our problems on our first night. I was told that it was the hotel's policy that if a guest wanted to stay beyond the number of nights they had booked they would accommodate them and bump someone who had a reservation to another hotel. I would not stay at this hotel again as a "paid reservation" doesn't seem to matter. You never know where you'll end up staying.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: awallacelfc
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2 week stay in the homewood and would definitely go back every year for what we paid for the holiday (about Â£1550) for me and my partner it was definitely value for money. We booked through travelcity and everything ran smoothly,we decided not to use a car because of the free shuttles provided by the homewood and found them very useful . They ran you at 3 different times in the morning to most theme parks about 8.30,10.30 and 11.30 and brought you back at 6.15, 7.40 and 9.45 there is a slight change for universal and also they return later in summer months.Also they were always on time and it is usually the norm to give the drivers a tip of $1dollar per person so it works out alot cheaper than driving which costs you $10 dollars a day to park in theme parks. On the odd occasion we decided to stay after the last bus in pleasure island and city walks so we had to get a taxi back to the hotel which cost $25 from pleasure island and only $10 from city walks,both are well worth staying later for and you can get into the clubs for free by using your disney and universal flex tickets which we bought over the internet before we went we paid Â£155 for disney pass and Â£95 for universal but they didnt include bush gardens. The homewood itself is a very nice hotel and in a brilliant location,the decor could do with some updating but apart from that its good,the rooms are big with a separate living/kitchen area.They also provide a free buffet breakfast every morning and a managers buffet every mon to thurs with free drink.We never stayed for the evening buffet because there are plenty of nice restaurants within 2 minutes of the hotel including bahama breeze and the olive garden but you get any of the many restaurants on international drive by using the I-ride bus which costs $1 for a single fare.it also takes you to the various shopping outlets and malls which we found out the clothes etc are about half the price of the uk so next time were taking another suitcase Overall we had a fantastic holiday in a lovely hotel but wished we booked 3weeks instead of 2 because we couldn't fit everything in. Please email me any questions i would be happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a family base”
Reviews.Author: CraigRBury
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 14 night stay at the Homewood Suites with my wife, 3 year old son and 6 other members of my wife's family. The hotel was fantastic. The location itself, in the middle of International drive, was perfect for us to shuttle, or I-Trolley to the various parks and shopping malls!! None of our party drove by the way, and i am glad we didn't because the shuttle service from the hotel was brilliant especially Hassan who went out of his way on numerous occasions to help us!!! The hotel was superb, from the friendly staff to the spacious rooms with Queensize bed and any every facility you could wish for or need on holiday. 2 televisions, microwave, fridge/freezer, dishwasher, iron and ironing board and hairdryer, i know these are not important to some people but believe me they all do come in handy at some time. There was also facilities to do some washing if need be, and a spare room downstairs to go on the internet to catch up with home , having said that the hotel did sell that days Daily Mail for the days news back home. I am not a breakfast person myself, but the rest of the family really enjoyed the free breakfast the hotel put on for a good start to the day at the Theme parks!! like a few of the other reviews, it could get crowded then, but never so that we never managed to get a couple of tables. Absolutely the best thing about this hotel was the "managers happy hour" Monday to Thursday 17:00 - 19:00, free beer or wine and some really tasty snacks in this time. It was also a great time to sit down with family who were weary from a long day at the parks to relax and discuss the many high point of the day. It was also a good social couple of hours to get to know some of the other people who were staying at the hotel. To end this review i wouldn't hesitate in reccomending this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at Homewood”
Reviews.Author: bearhug
Reviews.Content: Due to a problem on check-in, the manager was extremely helpful and gave us a free upgrade to a 2 bedroom suite and all I can say is WOW. This hotel has everything you could want and is within walking distance to restaurants and bars. The free breakfast and managers welcome party are great. Not just snacks but proper meals. Staff were friendly and housekeeping did a great job. Would definitely recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: GaGaGirl
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Homewood Suites. We got a great rate of $79.00 about 50% off their regular rate (timing means everything). The beds are fabulous. My husband and I took our grandsons for a short Disney vacation. The complimentary breakfast was more than adequate. They serve fruit, cereal, juice, coffee, muffins, pastries, sausage, eggs, potatoes and the make your own waffles were great. It's in a great location for everything you'll need within walking distances. The Walgreen's has great Disney souvenirs. There were a wide variety of restaurants to choose from or if you perfer to cook, the Suite has a full refrigerator, microwave (great for late night popcorn) and a 2 burner stove all the utensils you need, dishwasher even a garbage disposal. Although I did'nt utilize the kitchen as I had planned, we did make coffee in the AM. Housekeeping took care of washing any dishes we left and also arranged my grandsons stuffed animals on the bed each day. Our grandsons loved having their own T.V. to watch cartoons while we could close the door to the suite to watch other shows (when time permitted) The staff was very polite and helpful. The room was very clean. Registration was a breeze. I would highly recommend Homewood Suites especially for families. I forgot to mention that they did have shuttles to various attractions, but we opt to drive to DisneyWorld which was only about 15 to 20 minutes away. If traveling with kids the hotel is also only about 2 minutes away from one of Largest McDonald's in the World. My grandson's loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the bed!”
Reviews.Author: OrangeFloridian
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on May 4, 2007. The room was very clean and the staff was very nice. Everyone was very friendly and anxious to assist. The bed was very comfortable (one of the most important details in a hotel room). The living room was small but comfortable. Lots of restaurants/stores within walking distance. The breakfast was very crowded in the morning. I would recommend this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LesleySheffield
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Homewood suites in Orlando for two weeks with my husband and two kids. The first room we were given was on the ground floor and just outside the window were large air conditioning units. These were very noisy so we asked to move to another room which they arranged for the next day. We were very pleased with the room. The room itself was divided into two with a proper wall and door. In the first part of the room is a kitchenette, a sofa which makes into a double bed and a large Tv and in the 2nd room was a very large and very comfortable king sized bed. The bathroom was very good and the whole thing was extremely clean. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The breaksfast in the morning were very popular especially with our children. There was no extra charge for the breakfast which was self service but there was a lot to choose from. All the obvious yoghurts and cereals and pastries but also you could make your own toast, toast your own bagels or make your own waffles and then cover them with maple syrup. There was also plenty of fruit. Some evenings at 6pm the hotel also provided food and drink for free as part of the manager's welcome at 6pm. This included lager, wine and snacky food such as crisps and nuts. The hotel pool was kept open until 10 pm which was great for the kids when we came back in after a long day at a theme park. We used the free hotel shuttle buses to Disney. This was a good service and saved a lot of money on taxis but if you came back with the bus you had to leave at 6pm which was a bit too early. We had a wonderful time and would like to come back some time. This hotel was extremely good value for money and we would stay here again. Only down side was the lack of decent restaurants in walking distance, there are plenty of restaurants nearby but many of them were poor quality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewfoundlandGak
Reviews.Content: Just got back to canada from a vacation to disney. During our second week we stayed at the homewood suties 8745 on international drive. Excellent services and one of the most comfortable stays I have ever had. The hotel is located in a perfect area. Easy access to the I-ride, dining and retail outlets. Took a direct bus to bush gardens only one block away. Execllent breakfast and dinner Monday to Friday. Quality room and comfort. Highly recomment this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: John73
Reviews.Content: My wife and my 15 yr old daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 3 days from March 30 to April 1/07 and we really enjoyed it.The rooms were clean and the king size bed along with the sleeper sofa were really comfortable. The room itself had full size fridge,dishwasher and countertop stove and there were 2 tvs.The location on International Drive was perfect within as was within a 5 min walk to restaurants like TGI Fridays and Dennys,Bahama Breeze and a Wal Greens store.There is also a Liquor store and grocery store within a 5 min walk too.As stated in previous trip advisor reviews this hotel is set back away from the busy International Dr roadway which is a good thing for the noise level etc but only a short walk to the main restaurants etc.Universal Blvd is a road that runs parrell and behind the hotel which is easy getting to Universal Studios and there is a lot less traffic on this road than International Dr.The hotel offers a free full buffet breakfast which is busy but we always found a table around 9am.We didnt get to have their free food and beer/wine reception as they only have it from Mon to Thurs evenings from 5 to 7pm.We spoke to a lady named Dosee at the Universal Studios desk in the main lobby of the hotel and she was very friendly and helpful with directions to shopping in Kissimmee and Universal Studios.She also sells tickets to other attractions on International Dr area such as the Titanic which we really enjoyed and is only a few mins walk away from the hotel.We would definitely stay at this hotel again and I would recommend it to others.The price per night is reasonable and the hotel offers complimentary shuttle servcie to Universal Studios and Disney too.Folks you will enjoy staying at this hotel and remember you cant please everyone all of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: californiamom
Reviews.Content: I stayed here solely based on the trip advisor reviews. Here's what happened to us. I fully agree with the other review re express pass, elevators, etc. When we did the math we also were frustrated and felt duped. Universal is a busy place. It's actually a very, very busy place. There are no fast passes for anything. There is an express pass which you can buy. The day we wanted to go we couldn't even buy one because they were sold out. If we had stayed at a Universal hotel, we would have one included automatically. As a result of not having one of these passes, every single ride that we tried to go on had a wait of at least one hour minimum. The express pass ride wait was about 10-15 minutes if that. We spoke to a family who had a pass. They went on so many rides they couldn't count them. We paid all this money to go and ended up on three rides because we were tired of waiting in the heat and humidity. You need an express pass for Universal during busy season or don't go. Now, with that being said, on to the hotel. Here's the positives: two rooms, location of hotel to restaurants (24hr Denny's right next to the parking lot for food), washer/dryer, kitchen, Universal concierge in lobby (but with limited hours). Now here's the negatives: breakfast buffet an absolute zoo, never got into the jacuzzi because absolutely packed with people and was too small, luggage carts hard to come by, the slowest elevators in history which actually broke down twice and we were on the 6th floor, hot stuffy hallway, swimming pool located between two buildings so limited sunlight, rotten set up for bathroom - bathroom with very bright flourescent light. The toilet and tub are in one room with a door. Outside of that is the sink. About three very small steps away is your king bed. (No door separating sink from bed.)I had to go to bed when my husband did because of the proximity of the sink to the bed. There is a sink in the kitchen area, but no toilet. The sink, toilet, all of that is just simply way too close to the bed. Before booking this hotel think seriously of your situation. If you come in late at night, you will be hauling a lot of luggage if no cart is available - not exactly the right way to start a "vacation." We live in Los Angeles and when we come to Orlando it's usually for ten days to two weeks. There is no valet parking and no bell man. This hotel would be okay if you were just staying for one night and had very limited luggage. Other than that, I wouldn't do it again even with the incredibly low price I paid. As I said earlier, the express pass for Universal is a necessity. Add that to the price of the hotel and I would have been at the price for a Universal hotel with a bell man, valet, larger pool, etc. Too many negatives.

Reviews.Title: “1 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: lwade
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many different types of hotels, my experience with this one was bad, i stayed one night on 4-11-07 had booked a 1 bedroom suite with two doubles and non smoking. I arrived late by taxi from another resort, went in to make sure the room i asked for was open and that i was at right hotel, was told yes, Checked in , the desk clerk told me we were on sixth floor, I asked him if he had any rooms on first floor, his answer was no, the hotel was full. ok so we went to our room opened the door , the smoke smell was bad, know one in my family smokes and we had our kids, I called the front desk, Scott the manager on duty said he understood so he was going to upgrade me to a one bedroom suite with two doubles and non smoking, A room like i booked and paid for anyway, is that really a up grade??? The clerk who checked me in flat out lied, telling me there was know room on the first floor and then to put us in a smoking one king bed room suite, the manager here must have not a clue how to deal with this, if it were me and my clerk had told a lie, then i told my guest i was upgrading them to a room they had already booked and paid for i think it would only be fair to give the guests their room for the night since it is 11:00 pm and i understand how hard it would be for my guests to find another room this time of night, without a car and to have 4 kids, but of course I could think to my self this is only 1 guest out of every how many stayed here and could care less if they come back, I will never be back, i hated the service at front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lesley11
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying 8 nights in this hotel and really enjoyed it. The hotel is very clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is plenty and the light evening meal is a nice treat complete with complementary beer and wine. If you are driving to the hotel at night though be aware that it is located behind the Bahama Breeze restaurant and TGIFridays, it is not right on International Drive. The pool is nice and warm but since it is in a courtyard it is all or partially shaded a good part of the day. This is only a problem on cooler days. We had one problem during our stay: our television in the bedroom blew something and went on fire. We tried to call the front desk 5 or 6 times and noone answered. My husband ended up running down to the front desk to tell them. The hotel staff promptly replaced the tv but had the situation been more severe there could have been a problem. In spite of that though I would definitely stay at this hotel again. It is in a great location for all the theme parks, restaurants, shopping, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Homewood OK but must face infrastructure issues.”
Reviews.Author: TravellingPillsbury
Reviews.Content: Booked Homewood Suites based entirely on reviews in Tripadvisor. Had 15 and 17 year old niece & nephew visiting from abroad. Went for 2 bedroom [king plus 2 doubles] suite. Thanks to all prior reviewers. We weren't initially sorry - but except for a few small 'down' sides, we'll make different plans next time: Temperature control for whole place was in kids room [the one with 2 double/full size beds]. Kids like warm bedroom - we like cool. Compromise necessary, but somehow a bummer as we'd paid the same [$300] as 2 smaller rooms in a much nicer hotel [which would have had their own controls]. Kitchen area has table with 2 chairs - although there's room for 4 chairs [and for that matter: 4 people in the suite]. What were they thinking? Ice machine on ONE floor only [2nd: and by the way - do NOT book rooms 220 to 240 (approx > do some research) as I recollect they were across hallway from EXTREMELY noisy massive ice cube dump that happens when you take the sonically amplifeid tray from your fridge (no other vessels are provided in the rooms) place it inside the maw of the ice monster and push the button. Spring breakup in the arctic is quieter. Sinks are inside bedroom, while toilet & bath have their own room. Wonderful concept, badly executed. Would have been fine except for loud [and blinding] fluorescent fixture that lights up room. Advice: go to bed and wake up at same time as spouse [or sibling]. Good luck with that! Hallways may be an experiment in sensory deprivation: hot, stuffy and airless. And the 2 elevators [yes TWO for a 6 story hotel with about 48 rooms on each floor] were much worse than the hallways: if you're mildly claustrophic, don't use them. There's no air movement of any kind. I've heard that some top hotels and condos artfully employ positive and negative air pressure zones in hallways & rooms to keep cooking and other smells from travelling between rooms via the corridors. This may have been a failed attempt to do the same. Tsk-tsk. Free shuttles to theme parks are for organized people who have their kids on leashes - not for an uncle and aunt with 2 rent-a-teens. We tried the Star-something company van to Universal for 12 dollars for the 4 of us and that was fine. Came home for 8 dollars plus tip in a regular taxi. Go figger. Next day missed free shuttle and bellman called taxi which never came. We decided to drive and parked for 11 dollars in a wonderful secure multistory lot right on the Universal property. Would do that again: more flexibility after leaving park [ie. wanna go to the skydiving tower or wetnwild or somewhere non-Universal for dinner instead of the hotel? yes, please]. Some basic mathematical heads-up reminders: A. There are 2 elevators B. There are 4 luggage carts C. There are 6 floors with 48 rooms on each floor [?] Do the math. Here's our experience: On checkout day we want to spend day at the theme park so must get the heck outta hotel efficiently and either leave stuff in car in hotel lot or park at theme park [see remarks above]. We're in the southwest corner of the building, with an elevator nearby. The other elevator is in the northeast corner. Staff closes our elevator [with an "out of order" handmade sign on each floor]. I get a confession from desk clerk later that there is a conference on the main or 2nd floor and the attendees got tired of the "noise" from the guests. Hotel closes HALF the elevators [yeah, ONE of them], favoring the conventioneers over the hotel guests. Nice. What are our other options? Haul it yourself, piece by piece over about half a kilometer. Think of it this way: no one travels like Marlena Dietrich anymore, except families who stay in suite hotels. We weren't unique. Family size guests are encouraged by the suite hotels to "move in" - given the suggested amenities [tables, chairs, stoves, microwaves and friges] - but the available infrastructure [yes: elevators and luggage carts] is woefully lacking. Having cruised at suite level on major ships we've seen what it takes to move three thousand and more bodies and their stuff efficiently, and Homewood [Hilton, et al] haven't got a running start at covering the essentials. Take a lesson from Carnival [the most affordable of the mass market room and food providers]: get your elevators and baggage handling happening. As it was, I had to plead for an EXTRA HALF HOUR leeway to official checkout time. Give me the 4 and 5 star childless pomp and circumstance hotels [that we normally stay at] anyday over this. Next time the two nearest and dearest show up we're heading for Universal Portofino or something resembling a proper hotel, and we'll get 2 rooms and eat out [just like we did this time] Here's some more basic math [more for my own benefit right now, just typing it out]: Express Plus passes for a Thursday for 4 'adults': $80 Express Plus passes for a Friday for 4 'adults': $120 Express Plus passes for a Saturday for 4 'adults': $160 Parking at Universal: $11 Tip: Stay at one of the 3 Universal hotels and get the Express Plus [front of the line at ALL rides, etc] with the room, and no parking issues [you can take a boat from your hotel to the park]. More specifically, for the Friday of our stay, the Homewood & Express Plus passes and Parking was worth [300 room + 120 express plus + 11 universal parking] $431. Measure that against 2 rooms at one of the Universal properties. You may come out ahead. We'll definitely be back at Universal, but will never return to the Homewood Suites Orlando - International Drive. Luv from St Pete Beach FL [our local hotels advertise "90 minutes from Orlando theme parks" - but folks, please allow 2 to 3 hours - especially in morning rush hour thru Tampa].

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good location”
Reviews.Author: greatoz99
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in early April, paid $260/night (high because of spring break/easter). We booked a king suite (a king bedroom plus a second bedroom with 2 double beds). When I shortened my stay through the 800 number they also changed the room type to NOT have a second bedroom with 2 beds. At check-in they were going to just give me the smaller room until I raised my voice, then they 'found' a 2 bedroom suite (each had 2 beds). Breakfast was very crowded, they ran out of trays after the first day, but food was very good. Tip for people staying: you can get to the hotel by cutting through the parking lot of the Springfield Suites/Hampton Inn on Universal Blvd (this avoids i-Drive and gets you to Universal much quicker). You can also get out this way, just have to make a U-turn on Universal blvd to head north.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, exception: the shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: DrammenDrammen
Reviews.Content: March 17. - 26. 2007. Reviewer: Helle, Norway Our family stayed for 9 days, and we had a great time. The hotell staff were friendly, the suite clean and the bed....very comfortable. The only negative was the shuttle to the parks. You had to sign up in the evening, but when the shuttle arrived in the morning, they had no idea of the number of passengers going with the shuttle. So then we had to wait for them to arrange for another car to arrive and we lost at least half an hour every morning (the lines in the parks gets very long in half an hour!!) We ended up renting a car. But the hotel was great and we would stay here again. Helle

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yul77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night in March after we found that the Embassy Suites across the street was booked and LOVED it!! The man at the front desk was very friendly and helpful and made a point to call us by name whenever he saw us in the lobby. The price was reasonable because we only paid $109 on a Friday night (at least $50 cheaper than Embassy Suites would have charged). The suite was very clean and beautifully appointed and the king bed was comfortable. The hotel is in a great location since it's right near the convention center and only a couple of miles from Sea World and Universal Studios. You can walk to at least 5 restaurants, an emergency medical clinic, and a gift shop. The best part about our stay here was the complimentary hot breakfast. It put Embassy Suites to shame. They had an array of fruits, sausage, eggs, bagels, french toast, pancakes, toast, cereals, yogurt, juices, coffee and make your own belgian waffles. I would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TeeW
Reviews.Content: For the price, I rated this hotel an above average. The hotel offers a hot breakfast complete with waffles, eggs, sausage, etc. I was amazed at how many people were staying at the hotel because the hotel was quiet but when we went to breakfast there were so many people. We stayed in the one bedroom suite. When you walk in you walk directly into the living room/kitchenette. There is a refrigerator,stove and microwave. The bedroom is located in the back. You can close the door of the bedroom and not worry about hearing any of the noise in the hallway. The bed was huge and very, very comfortable. I am use to staying at the Marriott but this hotel really was a good find for the price. Walter at the front desk was very nice! I am already making plans to stay in June. The only downside I would say is the tvs should be updated, housekeeping missed a washcloth that was hanging across the shower and the shower made noise but other than that we enjoyed out stay.

Reviews.Title: “Too late this secrets out”
Reviews.Author: Beth502
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a 2 week family vacation because of the great reviews on tripadvisor. What a great place to stay. I would rate the rooms as average (but very clean) but the overall experience was fab. Great (free) breakfast with hot and cold choices, fresh fruit, waffles, danishs, sausage links etc etc. This probably saved us a couple of hundred dollars over the fortnight itself. Mon-Thurs from 5pm-7pm they also do a welcome reception with free beer and wine and hot and cold snacks. The staff were extremely friendly (Hi Bob!) and really helpful. There is a small shop on site and the room service is by the TGI Fridays next door. Its in a great location on I drive with a Tony Romas steakhouse just across the road (recommend the filet mignon!). It thoroughly deserves the good reviews on here but we dont want too many people booking....what if its full the next time we try and get a room :o)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for travel to Orlando I-Drive Area”
Reviews.Author: 29north
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel, many times, and have always enjoyed it. It is primarily a convention hotel but is excellent for all stays in the Orlando/ I-Drive convention area. Close enough to all Theme Parks and Restaurants, I have never used it, but I think they have transportation to most Theme Parks. Great Value for the $.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic holiday”
Reviews.Author: biggazz
Reviews.Content: Just to echo all of the other great reviews, had a great 14 night stay in February. Location, rooms, meals and snacks all excellent. Staff very friendly and a special Hello to Bob and Toasy. Will be booking again for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great home away from home”
Reviews.Author: FD2628
Reviews.Content: March 5,2007 Just returned from Homewood Suites this is a great hotel we used it as our home base and travelled to various locations in central Florida.The service was outstanding,rooms very clean,hotel staff very friendly and the breakfast was really nice.It sure made our stay very pleasant I would go back in a heart beat it is close to all attractions and resturants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice! WIll go back”
Reviews.Author: jewelly
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I went to Orlando for a girls weekend. We are 40 something. The homewood suites was nice, clean and convenient. Our room had two doubles with a separate living room with sofa, kitchen area and full size frig. I had wireless internet access. We could walk to several restaurants and bars and the malls were a short drive away. I think they have free shuttle during the day to universal. The breakfast was better than some Homewoods I've been in. They had a very helpful concierge in the lobby and a pleasant staff. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PlateMan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for free using Hilton HHonors points on Feb 10, 2007. Was an amazing stay. Had a king-size room that came with a huge living room and full kitchen. Staff was really helpful and check-in was easy. Hotel was also spotless. Free wireless Internet was also really quick. Breakfast was amazing. Had hot option such as eggs, make-your-own waffles and many cold options as well. Location is also great. I-Drive has so many things to do and hotel is nearby to I-4 with easy access to DisneyWorld. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: WillyWally
Reviews.Content: Great Value. Excellent service and nice location. The rooms were clean and well stocked. The breakfast was fabulous my kids loved making there own waffles every morning. The reception food was OK but the convenience of it was awesome. It was so nice to come back to the hotel and have a meal waiting for you! (between 5-7pm) The shuttles were fine although if I did trip over would definately stay here again but would rent a car for more freedom! Thank you Homewood for making our first trip to Orlando a huge success! Would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull hotel”
Reviews.Author: FloridaSedgefield
Reviews.Content: . We have just returned from 14 days in the Homewood Suites. The hotel was clean and well decorated. The suite really comfortable with a massive bed. Very conveniently situated on I-Drive. Suite cleaned daily and clean towels and sheets daily. A fantastic hotel. Staff marvellous and very friendly. My husband fractured his arm on our first morning, we were sent to hospital by taxi and collected afterwards. The manager and all his staff were fantastic, very helpful. We had fun on the I-ride and local busses and shuttles being unable to use the lovely car sitting in the car park all holiday. Would reccomment it to anuone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find on I-Drive”
Reviews.Author: JMB2003
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a conference in late January. This was a great hotel! Many Pros: King size bed was very comfy; ceiling fan in bedroom; nice kitchenette with full fridge, micro, dishwasher, sink; very clean; excellent breakfast buffet (awesome waffle maker!); can walk to many places on I-Drive. Few Cons: Kind of on the pricey side ($160/night); elevator is very slow; laundry room prices are very high ($1.75/load; $1.15/per dry cycle). Overall, a great hotel, and we'll definitely be back! Tip: Ask for a room not facing the pool area. It gets kind of noisy at night, plus they pump pop music from 7 a.m.-midnight in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: jdr1000
Reviews.Content: After a few stays at the Courtyard Marriot at the Village, I read reviews on Tripadvisor about this place. Very good place to stay, service is very good and they go out of their way to please you. Nice to the kids, to us and even housekeeping asked us about our day. Breakfast is very convenient, free internet as well. Hotel is a little difficult to find the first day, they should put a sign on I Drive to enter the Bahama restaurant because it is the easiest way in. My Hertz Neverlost got lost looking for it. Room was clean, crib was a little more than worn out and I would prefer a lighter color combination for the rugs and decor but that is just pushing it. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “2 suites for 2 weeks”
Reviews.Author: chrismag
Reviews.Content: 1st night put in suite 105 very noisy machinery outside window asked for a move but hotel was full so sleepless 1st night.Next day moved to suite 108 this room had a muscky damp smell i think it was from air con not too bad able to live with this. other members of my party had suite 104 no problems with this room. Breakfast was ok welcome home snacks mon-thurs 5pm-7pm again nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Debbie
Reviews.Content: Homewood Suites knows how to run a hotel. We would definately return and highly recommend this property. Quiet, off the main road Very clean High quality bed mattress & linens. Draperies that black out the light, Price includes Hot fresh breakfast, I actually enjoyed the food. Evening meal, and cocktail 2 hour service.(weekdays only?)The place looked brand new. Last yr. we stayed in the Disney Port Orleans Resort and in comparison, the Homewood Suites rooms are of equal quality for much less money.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Orlando!!”
Reviews.Author: KandyKorn143
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel in Orlando whether you're a young married couple, like myself and my Husband or if you've got nine kids! The location is perfect if you don't have a car or don't fancy shelling out for cabs all the time. There are loads of restaurants and other things to do just around the corner! The free shuttle to Disney and Universal was reliable and punctual. The hotel rooms had everything you could ever want i.e. microwave, small stove, dishwasher... and with a grocery store across the street you can save on meals too if you wish! The staff were all so attentive and helpful, we couldn't have asked for more! The bed could have fit four and the pool area was very clean! I think you get the picture. I can not say enough good things about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BabyBoomerCumbria
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week over New Year with my wife. Very good overall - quiet rooms and very comfortable beds. Staff very competent and accommodating. Our shower wouldn't work first morning there - had an engineer in the room in under 5 mins and new spout and shower switch fitted in a matter of moments. The buffet breakfast is a great idea and, OK it's not the full Cracker Barrel, but it is still a good starter for the day and must be a real bonus for anyone travelling with children. The real plus for this hotel is its location. Just set back off International Drive, you can walk to dozens of restaurants, meaning that no one has to drive and not drink. This is not true of many of the high end hotels and resorts to the south of International Drive where a car journey is essential to find food (unless you like standing around waiting for the I-Trolley). Bear in mind that it's very much a family oriented hotel with lots of children about - it may not suit couples who are allergic to kids.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home - Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: babygirll
Reviews.Content: My husband and i spent two glorious weeks at the Homewood Suites on International Drive. I must confess, I am an obsessive planner and spent months searching the net and reading practiically every review on every hotel in the I. Drive area. We picked this hotel for the following reasons: 1. Location - International Drive , right next to fantastic restaurants such as baham Breeze and cafe TuTu Tango. Also walking distance from cinema, wet n wild, loads more restaurants, shops - AMAZING 2. Free park shuttles - We did not hire a car and so these free shuttles were a fantatsic money saver. The shittles are always on time and we did not even need to book in advance due to the fact that we went in November when the parks are not too busy. 3. Free breakfast - My husband and I love our food and we loved that fact that we got a proper breakfast for free. Eating out everyday for two weeks can be really expensive. The breakfast menu changed slightly everyday but it always included sausage, eggs, hash, waffles, cakes, toast , bagels, juices, yogurt, cereals - more than enough choice for everyone. he staff were fantatsic, so friendly. Always on hand in the mornings to help. I really loved every minute of it. the suite was spacious and cosy and the free nternet access was a real bonus. We used the fitness room just once - the day after we arrived and we were the only people in there so it was big enough. I will definitely stay there very time I go to Orlando and i cannot wait to go back. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel & staff”
Reviews.Author: POMPEYSMITH
Reviews.Content: Absolutely top class in every aspect. Everything is carried out to a high standard. Our first visit to the Homewood Suites in November was a wonderful experience. The staff looked after their guests admirably and made our little girl feel really welcome even to the extent of remembering her doll's name! Food at the hotel was more than adequate and its free! The front desk staff were superb in their interaction with their customers and we cannot recommend this hotel too highly. we hope to return again in September 2007. The Smiths from Portsmouth

Reviews.Title: “For The Money You'd Be Daft To Stay Anywhere Else!!!”
Reviews.Author: thisdogibites
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Sept/Oct 2006 and had a fabulous time. We have stayed in other hotels in the area that an a higher official star rating but nowhere we've stayed beats this place on value, accommodation, location and cleanliness. We stayed on the 4th floor with a pool view. While I agree with all the comments made about the size and location of the pool, we only used it once and actually found that the lack of direct sunlight offered some respite! The breakfast and manager's dinner are just outstanding considering that they don't cost extra. The food was always hot and to a good standard, with good choice. The dinning room can get busy depending on your time of arrival but you are allowed to take your food to your room or outside to the terrace. Overall, this hotel offers a very high standard of accommodation with great facilities and has the added bonus of the meals. P.S. The beds are soooooo comfortable, they make you want to buy a new bed when you get home! We bought one of the Homewood Suites blankets for $65. Buy one, they are so cosy and a nice remember of a wonderful holiday.

Reviews.Title: “another great stay”
Reviews.Author: Marion
Reviews.Content: Just returned from another great holiday at the Homewood Suites. This is our 4th time staying at this hotel and I wouldn't hesitate recommending it to anyone. As with previous posters the pool does go into the shade fairly soon in the afternoon, but you can sunbathe from mid-morning until around 2 pm. We booked throught Travelcity which had failed to forward our booking to the hotel but the check in staff told us not to worry and they would sort everything out. Just told us to forget about it and enjoy our holiday...which we did. Look forward to staying here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, don't hesitate in booking”
Reviews.Author: craigpatt
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from two weeks at the Homewood Suites. I echo all of the positive comments about this hotel. It really is simply a great base to explore Orlando. The hotel is maintained to a high standard and the staff at the reception are superb ! You'd have to be an extremely fussy traveller not to be impressed by the Homewood Suites, afterall remember the price you are paying ! I would'nt recommend this hotel however if it is a great pool area that you are looking for as this is quite small and not in the best position to get the sun. PS: Great Gym for a hotel too !

Reviews.Title: “home from home”
Reviews.Author: letton
Reviews.Content: This hotel was by far one of the best we have stayed in when in Orlando. As already stated staff very friendly and competent, rooms comfortable and spotless. The food was plentiful and well cooked. My sister stayed in a 5 star hotel further up I Drive and had none of the facilities we had and was quite envious of us, even though they had paid a lot more for their hotel. She is now adamant that she is staying at Homewood Suites next time and has been telling everyone who will listen what a great hotel it is! One thing that I think would improve the rooms would be to have washer-dryers in the rooms instead of dishwashers which aren't really needed as I would think that most people eat out in the evening as it is so cheap. It would make keeping on top of the washing while on holiday so much easier. Other than that you cannot fault this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “loved the homewood suites”
Reviews.Author: tomvon40
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from 2 fab weeks in florida. We flew into sanford airport and stayed for one night at the homewood suites by hilton on international drive before driving down to the keys. We didnt want anything too expensive as it was only for a nights rest after the flight so, after reading many not so good reviews on hotels on IDrive this one sounded good for the price, we paid Â£41. Not expecting too much for our money when we arrived we were VERY pleased at what we got. We had a lovely adequately sized one bedroomed suite on third floor looking onto the pool. It had everything you would need hair dryer, iron & ironing board large fridge cooker, 2x tvs, sofa, table and chairs and a large comfy bed. It was very clean and had plenty of fresh towels & miniture soap, shampoo, conditioner and body cream. We found the staff very welcoming and couldn`t do enough for you. We had breakfast next morning which was a self service buffet which had a good selection of everything. If staying on I Drive again we would definately stay at the homewood suites. Great value for money..

Reviews.Title: “niece's wedding”
Reviews.Author: finney
Reviews.Content: Hi, we stayed at this hotel for my niece's wedding ,she got married at cypress grove 4adults 2 kids 13/14yrs our daughter was bridesmaid the hotel was across the road from wet&wild good location about 5min walk to wet &wild free bus to universal studio island of adventure also seaworld.The Homewood suites is next door to the Hilton which is also a very nice hotel,we had breakfast included and also Monday to Thursday from 5pm till 7pm free beer and wine also snacks,which was great oh soft drinks for the kids we would recommend this hotel and if we go back to orlando would stay here again.The hotel was behind the Skull kingdom it was our second time to orlando we stayed other side of int drive last time in quality inn plaza.Only downside to this hotel is it does'nt have it's own bar but you can use the bar at the Hilton,all in all very good holiday, this time weather was lovely last time it was August and we had 12 days out of 14 rain thunder lighting that was 2003.Good size rooms 2 double beds in the main bedroom and one double pull out bed in the living room,but the one down fall is that the bathroom and the seperate sink unit are in the main bedroom area which is not conveniant for the people sleeping in the living area.

Reviews.Title: “What more can I say?”
Reviews.Author: scenic2
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our stay at the Homewood Suites (14th - 24th October) and to be honest there is not much more I can add that other people have already said. I booked this hotel way back in January due to its good reviews on Tripadvisor and have reviewed them on a regular basis prior to going there. I was extremely happy with my choice. We were checked in within five minutes of arriving and were given a room on the sixth floor and could see quite a bit of International Drive which is about two minutes walk away. There was plenty of choice at breakfast time and the managers supper from 5 - 7pm is also great. The food offered was chinese, mexican - something different served Monday - Thursday. I tried to book a shuttle bus to Universal Studios one day with the lady behind the transportation desk but she didn't know anything about it. It turns out that the person that sits on the left behind the desk deals with Universal Studios and the person sat on the right is nothing to do with them!! They are something to do with a timeshare. On several occasions I tried to exchange travellers cheques with the front desk but on each occasion they had run out but assured me that they are widely accepted as cash. Tell that to the taxi driver who would not accept travellers cheques! Overall had a fantastic time; shuttle buses always turned up on time, hotel clean, children literally had swimming pool to themselves in the late afternoon when most people were still at the parks and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good second time around.”
Reviews.Author: sassysassy
Reviews.Content: Couldn't wait go go back to this place ! Stayed here for two weeks in May this year and found the staff fantastic- they were friendly and bent over backwards to please us ! However, this time the staff were indifferent and not at all jolly as they were early this year. We booked to stay as soon as we left in May but were not told that that refurbishments were going to take place. It was dusty and smelly. Glue fumes overwhelmed us. Will go to Orlando again but not the Homewood suites.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fab Stay At Homewood”
Reviews.Author: dazza-astra-sri
Reviews.Content: Couldnt get Homewood Universal this year so had to settle for international drive, it was just as good. Pool was shaded as stated in other reviews but we found that a plus as it was really hot while we were there and it was pleasant sitting out and not worrying about getting burnt. I totally agree with the reviews that compliment this hotel on the service, location, condition of room/hotel etc. we had a great 2 weeks and would certainly stay here again. there were some improvements being carried out while we were there, carpets in the lobbies being replaced but it did not affect us.

Reviews.Title: “W.I.T. - They really mean it!!”
Reviews.Author: ScottishKeg
Reviews.Content: Like a lot of people we visited trip advisor a lot of times and were impressed with all the good reviews about this hotel. Arriving on a busy Saturday night we were a bit nervous about what the hotel would be like. We shouldn't of worried! Staff were attentive and friendly for the whole stay. The suite was spacious and cleaned to a really high standard daily by the maids who did such a good job and were so friendly we were happy to leave a tip for them everyday. We took advantage of the complimentary breakfasts which set us up for the days fun at the parks. The breakfasts are a self service buffet with plenty of choice. I can't understand the reviewer that complained that there wasn't enough choice, we couldn't think of anything you would have for breakfast that wasn't offered apart from kippers!!!!! The pool isn't olympic sized but is fine for a dip to cool off after the parks. Yes, it is partially shaded but who comes to I drive to sunbathe all day long. The only thing we found a problem with was the shuttle service, great in the morning going to the parks in a big coach but for the return journey they send a minibus and try to jam in loads of people and overload the vehicle. Not comfy and not safe! In saying this the shuttle is run by an independant company so not really the hotels fault. We can't understand why the hotel is only ranked 6th. It should be up there with its sister hotel at number 1. Staff wear W.I.T. (whatever it takes) badges, They mean it!! We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Top marks”
Reviews.Author: phin_fan
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel, just couldnt fault it. The suite was large and very comfortable, the breakfast sets you up for the day ahead and when you return that night there`s a managers welcome, beer wine soft drinks and a hot snack. The staff we`re all very friendly especially at reception were there was always a smile. Great location just back from the main road but close to some great restaurants: Bahama breeze, race rock and my fav cafe tu tu tango. The amount of great reviews say it all, awesome....

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Bebes
Reviews.Content: We did a last minute trip to Orlando and went with Homewood Suites based on reviews - what an EXCELLENT choice for us. Super convenient to everything, clean, friendly and helpful service, free breakfast, free cocktail hours on certain nights - you definitely get your money's worth here. Highly recommended for travelers who is looking for a decent place to stay without having to spend an arm and a leg.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for tasting everything”
Reviews.Author: LagerLout
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Homewood I-drive with my girlfriend for 2 weeks 16-30 Sept 06. The room was great. Really comfy bed which made getting over the jet lag tough! The lounge/dining room had its own TV so that was good for when i wanted to watch telly and she wanted to sleep off the day at the parks. Breakfast was really good. Cleanliness was superb. They were having new carpets fitted while we were there (though the old ones seemed fine to me). They are obviously looking to keep their high visitor rating intact. The lady on the parks information desk was wonderful. Toasy was her name and she was just right. Enthusiastic, knowledgeable and helpful but not pushy. You needed anything or were unsure of what to do, then she'd sort you out. We already had all our tickets pre-booked with the holiday and I'd done lots of planning but still found Toasy's help invaluable. Manager's special in the evening was fine but we liked to eat out and this hotel is smack bang in the middle of restaurant city! I mean 2 wks just wasn't enough to try them all. Bahama Breeze was great (and right next door). Tony Roma's was nice too. Charley's steakhouse was upmarket steak of the very best quality. Loads more, see my forum trip review for details if you're interested. All in all this place was perfect for our needs: access to all parks, restaurant variety, value for money, shopping, comfort and cleanliness. Only weak point is the pool area getting shaded too early, but they let you use a sister hotel if you ask at reception.

Reviews.Title: “A great location, pity about the pool”
Reviews.Author: Pandaf
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the reviews , on Tripadvisor. The only travel agent, in UK, that I found that offered this hotel was Travel city direct. Anyway the hotel is in a good location, with several restaurants within walking distance. Its at the quieter end of International Drive, with good access to all the parks. So If you drive its a good hotel. The room is a good size with a door between the bedroom and sitting room. There is a huge fridge/freezer, microwave,dishwasher, toaster amd two electric rings. All the pots, pans and dishes you need are provided. There is also a iron & ironingboard, hairdryer and in-room safe. There is a breakast provided every morning, which is OK, and on Monday to Thursday there is a themed meal provided, with beer ,wine and soft drinks. The pool is in the middle of the hotel so it's shaded most of the day, but thats not the problem. The pool is about 3 foot at the shallowest, so could be a problem for young kids. So, so to sum up, this is the best hotel we have stayed in International drive, our 7th vist.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it so much I came back after our New York trip”
Reviews.Author: Vik123
Reviews.Content: Very very nice hotel. Myself, my wife and my 1 year old son have just come back from Orlando. We booked flights but didn't have any accomodation booked. Having reseached many many web sites and confusing ourselves with the vast range of hotels we decided to book this one. And what an excellant choice we made. We spent 4 nights at the hotel and the rooms were fantastic and very clean. They just starting to renew all carpets in all rooms at the hotel this week - the old ones looked fine to me! The service was the best! We used the free transport to get to Disney, but there was some confusion over our return trip. As a result we were stranded at Disney. We phoned the hotel and they said jump in a taxi and we'll pay for the fare ($35). It transpired that the error was actually of my wife's making and she didn't book the return coach travel - never-the-less the hotel didn't argue they just wantred us back safely. After our trip we took an internal transfer to New York to spend some time with relatives. We would then come back to Orlando for 5 nights before coming back to England. I decided to save a bit of money and book a different hotel. I booked La Quinta. When we arrived back to Orlando, the taxi took us to the hotel. What an absolute disapointment. All I can say is that I checking in at 2pm and checked out at 3pm. The rooms were horrible, they were clean but not of the "Homewood" standard We phoned Homewood Suites and they sorted us out a room that day. I can honestly say that for the sake of a few pounds I nearly spoit the whole holiday. Plus points - onsite laundry - fantastic bed - good kitchen for storing milk/water/left overs - staff were very friendly - they even stored our luggae whiole we were at New York!! Minus points - only two PCs in the internet cafe room, usually taken most of the time - area around the pool is a little limited Book this you will not be disapointed if you want a good location, and a very clean room for a comfortable nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “first class once again”
Reviews.Author: postboy
Reviews.Content: just come back from this great hotel after a second stay there.i have never slept in a more comfortable bed than the one we had this year. staff excellent and will do any thing for u .special mention to joe the maintenance man who fixed our a/c unit.sadly cant make it next year but we will booking for 2008.cant wait for new water park to be built at seaworld and to have the baby back ribs at bahama breeze. tip on entering the parks when they take your photo ask them to take one with your camera you will get the same photo and u wont have to pay for it .

Reviews.Title: “Great Value / Great Service”
Reviews.Author: rm2006
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on it's excellent location and the reviews it had already received on Trip Advisor. We made the perfect choice. The hotel isn't glamorous, it doesn't have a bar or a flashy reception area nor does it have a restaurant located on site. What it does have however is fantastically efficient and friendly staff, a very convenient location, oversized rooms which are kept spotlessly clean (akin to the rest of the hotel) and useful room amenities such as a full sized fridge freezer, microwave oven and dishwasher. Now I certainly don't go on holiday to cook meals in my room but the fridge was great for keeping our water, wine and beer cold and it was great to be able to heat up a mug of milk if I wanted in the evening and then put the mug in the dishwasher rather than have to wash it up! The bed is the most comfortable thing I have ever slept in and I am still struggling to re-adjust to my own bed 5 days after returning, a bed I once considered to be pretty comfortable! My husband and I are 32 and 27 respectively and don't have any children however we both felt that this would be the perfect hotel to come back to when we do have children partly due to the amount of space you have but also because of the free breakfast buffet which saved us a fortune compared to the previous year's Orlando hotel! Okay so there isn't as much choice as you'd get if you went out for your breakfast which we did a couple of times for variety but there are cereals and toast, muffins, pancakes, danish pastries waffles, sausages, eggs, tea, coffee, orange juice etc and it is FREE! On occasion we also took advantage of the free wine and beer served Monday to Thursday at the Managers reception and although we didn't eat it, the food looked pretty good and there were certainly more than a few people (most families and conferencers) who were using this as the source of their main evening meal - another great money saver for families. The only reason we didn't eat there is because our evening meal out is one of the main events of the day for us as we like a few drinks but if you had children this would be ideal after a long and tiring day at the parks! Talking of nights out! The hotel is set far enough back to be quiet and traffic noise is minimal. However it is only a two minute walk onto International Drive and within a ten minute walk from the hotel you would find Bahama Breeze, TGI Fridays, Race Rock, Charleys Steak House, The Mercado, Ponderosa and many more so there is something for every taste and budget! Howl at the Moon (great dueling piano club!) is less than five minutes from the hotel so if you want a good night out this is a great place to go! We used the hotel taxi once and paid $14 for a taxi to Universal City Walk for a night out. Coming back cost us $8 including tip so we rang Diamond Cabs or Checker Cabs for all future transport needs as they were around half the price of the Hotel Taxi! It costs around $25 - $30 to get to Downtown Disney for a night out which we didn't mind as we were on holiday with another couple but only went once as we preferred City Walk anyway! Back to the hotel, the pool was in the shade but this didn't bother us at all, (the pool was never busy often empty) - it was a welcome retreat from the sun after a day at the parks and we took full advantage of it most evenings! Would definitely stay at this hotel again and can not recommend it enough. Incidentally we booked and flew with Travel City Direct as we have done for most of our trips to Orlando. Don't hesitate to use them, we have never had a problem and they are considerably cheaper than Virgin who I didn't feel were any better in the service / comfort. Also you can upgrade to First Class or Sunshine Upper and still pay less than Virgin Economy! We flew on sunshine upper this time and it was great! No queues to check in, you get on and off first, you get a pre take off drink (bar is also free all the way too but this is standard with all flights to Orlando with Travel City) , upgraded meal service and best of all no young children screaming all the way! If anyone wants any info on the hotel / area / parks / restaurants or bars, we've been a few times so don;t hesitate to ask!

Reviews.Title: “going downhill”
Reviews.Author: tel1664
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at this hotel 3 times before and it appears that things are starting to go downhill. the general decor is starting to look tired and our room had a major problem with bed bugs which despite our various efforts could not be sorted. The pool area was always dirty in the mornings with beer cans left prom the previous nights parties. I dont think we will be going back. We did look at the sister hotel near universal which looked much better.

Reviews.Title: “STANLEYS HOME!”
Reviews.Author: sheboo
Reviews.Content: My 11 year old daughter and I stayed here in August. I booked this Hotel after reading the reviews on this website and what a good choice I made. This hotel was great. It was set back slightly from International Drive so there was no noise. The breadfasts were excellant and there were even entertainers on in the mornings for the kids. We didnt really stay for the managers special but the restaurant was always packed. The suite was great with a huge kingside bed. The pool was shaded for most of the day but we didnt go to Florida to sit round a pool. But we were told we could use the pool next door if we wanted. What made it for us was the staff. They all had badges on with WIT we asked what it meant and was told "Whatever it takes" and that is what they did NOTHING was too much trouble and every query was answered with a smile. All the staff spoke to us every time they passed us their manners were impeccable. Being on our own we felt really safe and comfortable in this hotel. On our return I discovered to my horror that I had left my daughters favourite teddy bear "Stanley" in the hotel (anyone with kids will know this sinking feeling). After lots of tears I rang the hotel and explained what had happened sure enough Stanley was still there. I asked how much it would cost to have him posted back via DHL we were quoted approx $100 I asked how much it would cost by ordinary post and left my home address. Yesterday my daughter arrived home to find a parcel and inside was Stanley the hotel had paid $25 to have him sent back to us. We cant thank them enough. We dont have any negative points and all the other guests we spoke to didnt either. This was not a expensive hotel and we couldnt recommend it enough to any one else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place!”
Reviews.Author: Stuart_J_T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites between 9/8-22/8 and had a very enjoyable stay. When I booked the property was ranked #2 in the TA rankings for Orlando hotels and subsequently had slipped to #10 after some negative reviews. This concerned me a little but I shouldn't have worried as we had a fantastic time. The staff at this property are superb, extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was excellent and even the Manager's special evening meals were acceptable (nothing too special but hey, they are free, and great when returning really tired after a day at the parks). The free wine and beer went down very well too! The suite was split into two rooms, the bedroom area with a huge King size bed and the other room with a sofa bed. There is a large TV in each room, so when we were occassionally in the room there was no arguing with the kids over what to watch. There is a huge fridge in the room, perfect for stocking up on a variety of drinks from the Walgreen's around the corner. The only real negative is the pool which has restricted sun during the day as overshadowed by the property, but some days even this was a blessing due to the exceptional heat! The previous review to mine has mentioned the decor being a bit drab and I suppose this is also a reasonable criticism, but I certainly didn't go to Orlando to look at the interior of the hotel! Anyway, whilst we were there, they had started the process of replacing the carpets in rooms on the ground floor, never saw the results though. Summing up, an excellent location, clean property/rooms, good value with friendly/helpful staff. I can only imagine the negative reviews are from people with extremely high standards expecting 5 star quality just because this property is towards the top of the TA ratings. If you are not one of these people and want a great location for your Orlando holiday you can't get much better!

Reviews.Title: “Good value good service but decor a little dull and oppressive”
Reviews.Author: mjpeng
Reviews.Content: I am very fussy when it comes to hotels so here is my honest review . This place was OK but not fantastic, the main problem is the decor, its so dull and oppressive. The complementary breakfast was good and the staff very helpfull. The gym equipment is in need of repair / replacement. Pool is shaded but only used it once. Good restaurants, Cafe du tango, Bahama Breeze, TGI Fridays are all walking distance. Overall it was what I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: lovedisney
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 2 week stay at Homewood Suites. When we arrived there was a problem with our booking the problem was nothing to do with the hotel it was a problem caused by the travel agent here in the UK. The staff were fantastic they sorted the problem within 10 minutes and we were in our room. The rooms were very spacious plenty of room for 4 adults. All staff were friendly at all times, hotel shuttle to parks was useful~ only used disney shuttle. Complimentary breakfast was fine, did not get back in time for evening reception. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Honeymoon Dream”
Reviews.Author: Deus_Regula
Reviews.Content: Homewood Suites was the best hotel we've stayed at in a LONG time. The staff was super friendly and were happy to do whatever it took right then and there, no questions asked. The rooms were spacious and clean. The maids even cleaned the dishes in the sink! We had a lovely stay there for our Honeymoon. It was quiet and it was wonderful to come back to after a long day in the parks. Even though it is on busy I-drive, you would never know it because it stills back off of the road a bit. We WILL go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BigJM
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a lovely 2 week stay at the Homewood Suites near the Convention Center on International Drive with my wife and two kids (9&6). It's in a great location, near quite a few restaurants (the kids loved Friendlys) and shops and still quiet in its off road location. Getting to all parks was easy and convenient. The room provided all we needed and more with its huge fridge/freezer a real bonus, and the separate bedroom giving a bit of extra space. The complimentary breakfast was great and if you went hungry it was your own fault. The Managers special was available although we only took advantage of it on Wednesdays when there was an excellent compere who kept the children and adults amused. The pool although not Olympic size was sufficient and served its purpose, but anyway I was not in Orlando to sit beside a pool all day. I must mention all the staff who were very helpful and friendly and certainly deserved their W.I.T. (whatever it takes) badges they wore. Overall, this is a great hotel for everyone, especially for families visiting the theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok - Not for couples”
Reviews.Author: vmh1015
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the weekend of July 4th. It was a mad house! The rooms were fine - nothing above and beyond - kind of a waste for $125/night, we used the refrigerator and that was about it. The room was clean enough, but the shower had some mildew. We walked to a close-by Walgreens for some groceries and carried them all of the way up to the room to find out our key locked us out. We just checked in and hour before! I left my husband and groceries in the hallway and went to the front. He gave me a hard time because I didn't have ID. He was the same idiot that checked me in not 1 hour earlier! I refused to go back upstairs for my purse and he fixed it. If you are looking to get away with a spouse or partner, this is not the place to do it. It was overrun with unruly children who had no supervision. We couldn't even get out of the elevator without be trampled first. No one even waited until we got out. If you are going to the pool, we went first thing in the am, and no one was in it. The jacuzzi was too disgusting to even step foot in. It was covered in sand or dirt! I mainly booked this place for the breakfast. There is a lot of variety, but the hot breakfast isn't worth the morning chaos. 2 out of the 3 mornings we couldn't find a table to eat at, and that was at 8:30. The eggs were disgusting! The bacon and sausage were ok. My husband just ended up with a banana and a bagel each day. Not a bad place if you have kids...but you definitely want to spend the extra $$ for a nice hotel like the Lowes hotel if you're looking for some romance. And definitely don't go on a holiday weekend - what a waste of $$ - the lines were too long at the parks and really limited how many things you can do.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've been to orlando six times and stayed in many hotels on i-drive but this was the best. The rooms were large with living and bedroom area they were always kept clean, there was lots of chioce at breakfast time and between 5-7 mon-thur theres a welcome home buffet with free food and drinks. The trasport to the parks is free and was always on time. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Pir8guy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many Homewood Suites, and there are some that are nicer than this. However, this one was perfectly nice. The suite layout is always a welcome sight to the business traveler (my pet peeve # 1 is having to sit on the bed to watch TV). The breakfast was good and the staff was outstanding and helpful in every way. Two small shortcomings: I returned one day after 3pm tired from a conference to find the room not made up. They said something about "they clean up to 6pm" but, sorry, that's not acceptable. On the plus side, they sent someone right away and it was cleaned in 15 minutes. The only other thing is that the place is popular with families (and rightfully so) and can be quite, uh, chaotic most of the day. For the businessperson, there may be better choices in the Convention Center area, I don't know. But really, this is a really good place (and walking distance to multiple restaurants and easy access to the trolley).

Reviews.Title: “join the hotel loyalty club”
Reviews.Author: canadabound
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel a few years ago but would always recommend it to family and friends.It has ample room for a family with extra living space and self catering facilities.The location is quiet but convenient and for budget minded travellers it is fantastic value.
