A previous reviewer said they were having difficulty booking for next year from the UK-my tip is join the hotel group-Hilton's loyalty programme.You can usually get as good or better rate than your UK travel agent and any stays build up points towards free stays in the future. In fact it was after a stay at this hotel that I gave up on package holidays .I usually book a fly drive through the travel agent and arrange my own accommodation.The big hotel groups-Hilton,Holiday Inn,Marriott,Hyatt etc all have their own loyalty clubs where you can book direct.Check regularly on trip advisor website for reviews on your shortlisted hotels and you can't go far wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTraveling
Reviews.Content: Stayed last weekend at Homewood Suites next to the Convention Center to attend a business function. As a business traveler you expect a certain level of quality and service from a hotel, and on top of that I am a very picky person. Well Homewood Suites met and exceeded my expectations. The hotel is beautiful. My room had a kitchen and livingroom area and an attached bedroom with a large bath. The room was meticulously clean well maintained and the best part "smoke free"! In the morning a full free breakfast and during the week a full free dinner. Incredible! My next trip to Orlando I am staying here agin!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alkel2325
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel once myself on the recommendation from my parents who have been 4 times. The hotel was luxurious, clean and the staff were very good. The rooms were well equipped, the location excellent, and the free breakfast and happy hours were well worth a visit. One of the major things that sets this hotel apart from many others is the fact that you get complimentory transport to Disney, Seaworld and Universal, not many other hotels do this. I have been to Orlando 14 times and have stayed in hotels rated 3* through to full 5* hotels, and the Homewood suites, I really believe takes the good parts of the best hotels, with the uncomplicated nature of the lower star hotels and is a perfect base for any one visiting Orlando. Its suitable for any age (my partner and I are in our 20's and my parents are in their 50's). The only critisism I have is its quite hard to book from the UK, as I'm finding now, trying to book for next year!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: MrCBedfordshire
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 14 night stay at the Homewood Suites I-Drive (2 adults and 1 child). I would agree with most of the positive comments about this hotel and we enjoyed our stay. The hotel has a good location between I-Drive and Universal Way. We used Universal Way a lot to avoid the busy I-Drive section around Sandlake Road. Checking in and out took no time at all and the suite we had was adequate for our needs. All staff we encountered were polite and helpful. Our suite was on floor 3 and looked out on to the central courtyard containing the pool. This did make the room a bit dark and dingy at times, but nothing to complain about. We couldnt detect any noise from the pool when it was busy. We had a few minor problems with the room upon our arrival, but these were fixed promptly by maintenance and the general standard of decor and cleanliness were fine throughout. The main bed was a king-size and was very comfortable. The sofa bed which our daughter slept on had seen better days, but did the job. Like others, we found the breakfast offered to be excellent, with plenty of choice. With the exception of the pasta night, we did not enjoy the evening snacks and tended to eat out a fair bit - they aren't advertised as main meals and they are complimentary, so who's complaining! The free beer was great! The swimming pool and hot tub were good - we used them everyday, although it is only completely open to the sun during the middle part of the day. We quite liked the shade as the temp was up in the 90s. However on the less humid days when the wind was up a bit, it was noticeably chilly. There were plenty of towels. The few negatives I would note were: the noise from the combined air-con units. Even with our unit switched off overnight, the constant hum rebounding in the courtyard from other rooms and the big fan units, which I assume cool the corridors, was initially disturbing, but we got used to it after a few nights. the counter-tops in the kitchen and bathroom were being upgraded whilst we were there and we had a note passed under our door saying that the work would be done whilst we were out. As we were within 2 nights of leaving and would be spending more time in the room, we opted to decline this (as offered on the note). However, we came back during the afternoon to find the work was being done anyway - during the last couple of days, the sink started to leak, resulting in maintenance men coming in and out to fix it. More a niggle than an encumberance. Other than that, a great place to stay in Orlando and we would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star Quality”
Reviews.Author: JLONTOOSH
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Orlando and the homewood suites intr'l drive. We read various reviews about this hotel before we left and having been, we fail to see how anyone can critisize this place. Lets not forget this is a 3star hotel and for what you get with the rooms, the free breakfast, free dinner(mon.-thurs), free tea, coffee, popcorn and u.s.a today newspaper, toiletries, etc, etc....., great location, very friendly staff, huge comfy beds, free towel use by the pool, hairdryer, iron and ironing board......... need i go on. Sure the food isn't as good as eating out at all the terrific nearby restaurants, but it's FREE and for free food it WAS good. The pool is surrounded by four walls, but between 12 and 2p.m the high sun floods the whole area and the rest of the time the shaded areas can be a cool respite from the sun (great if you have kids and are worried about them getting burnt). Our room only got the sunshine in the morning and it was great to throw open the curtains to glorious sun, and after all day in the sun it was good to come back to a cool shaded room. All rooms vary of course. The air-con is a wee bit noisy in the rooms and at thepool, but a small price to pay for the glorious weather. The location is great as well, the nicer end of international drive, tree lined paths with great eating places, a Walgreens that sells your pharmacies and much, much more, a cinema to catch the latest realeses, gift shops, etc...We recommend Bahama Breeze, Houllihans, Race Rock and the Olive Garden for great food at great prices. All this within walking distance. Trust me, for 3 star accomodation, a suite as opposed to a room, this place really cannot be faulted. As Mr. Schwarzenegger says.....I'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Shame About the Pool”
Reviews.Author: plmhs
Reviews.Content: Hotel - The rooms were rather small but adequate for the three of us. The air conditioning was permanently noisy. The complimentary breakfast and evening reception were very good - not gourmet food but plenty of it and a good selection so eating out is not always necessary and can be a big saving. The standard of cleanliness was excellent. Pool - The pool is surrounded on all four sides by the six storey hotel so consequently only gets the sun for a few hours when the sun is at its highest. It is also very noisy due to the constant hum of the air conditioning. We like to spend most of the day out then return to the hotel at about 3pm for a few hours in the sun but by this time the pool is in total shade. However, there is another Hilton Hotel just across the car park and we were invited to use their pool which was in sun all day. Eating out - Don Pablo's mexican is on the doorstep and the food is superb. There is also a Thai restaurant just down the road which is very good. plus any number of steak houses, burger bars and pizza places. Shopping - several supermarkets and gift shops within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here, free buffet breakfasts with most foods you could think of and a lot we wouldn't have expected . Large, clean spacious rooms with dishwasher, microwave fridge freezer and cooking rings if you wanted them. The pool area was only small but the pool was heated and clean and great for a dip after long days at the parks as it was open until 10pm . Mon-Thurs evenings a welcome home buffet with diffent themes every night and free drinks. The drinks were welcome but we often ate out as most resturants were only a few minutes walk away. The staff were very friendly and always ready to help, rooms were cleaned every day and clean towels left. We hired a car with my husband and dad sharing the driving and not getting lost to our amazement. There was a shuttle service and a family we met there used it every day for the Disney parks and said it was a good service. All in all a fantastic time was had by us all including my parents and I have booked to go back next year. Can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great for Families or Conventioneers”
Reviews.Author: retro1959
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the second time as a Convention Center visitor. On both occasions a large number from our company stayed, as well, and found the large dining area to be a useful place to convene, eat breakfast or have a glass of wine (both complimentary), and have small meetings. The location is close enough for a 10-min. walk to the Convention Center, and is surrounded by similar hotels and the I-Drive collection of restaurants and "ways to burn family dollars" (ie, retail and amusements). Our staff loved that Bahama Breeze with its large veranda bar is directly behind the hotel. (By the way, the best nearby business restaurant is Vito's Chop House, a premium-level steak house.) Ice cream fiends would love that Friendly's is also adjacent. At a $135 rate, the hotel is a very good value, since it includes a "suite" type room, full breakfast buffet of acceptable quality (don't expect fine food), and evening reception with enough food to make a supper. The room quality is quite good; furnishings and bedding were in good condition, and of average quality for the price range. Cleanliness and building condition overall were very good. The staff is all young and generally helpful, though the "cream of the crop" of Orlando's hospitality employees obviously gravitate toward the larger, better paying properties. As long as you understand this, you won't be unsatisfied. Amenties include free wireless internet in both the lobby and rooms, and although the speed can be quite slow, the service was reliable and useful for email and light surfing. Just don't try to download huge files. Tip: Get to breakfast well before the 9 to 10 hour, when it is hard to find seating. I can recommend the hotel to any business traveler, and certainly to families who can benefit from the kitchenette, sleeper sofa, two TVs, pool, big breakfast, and free shuttle to attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Number One In Customer Service!!”
Reviews.Author: 1northstar26
Reviews.Content: An Amazing Customer Service Suite Hotel! This hotel exceeded my expectations, and the pictures do not do it justice! The rooms are spacious, functional, and Clean! The bed was actually comfy and they give you not 2 pillows, but 4! The staff was over the top helpful when their in room grocery delivery service failed...the staff actually drove me to the store, waited for me to shop, then reimbursed me for 1/2 the bill! They call you to check on your stay, ask if they can do anything for you, and when our room didn't have the popcorn, they sent someone right up with it!! Made my daughters day! The close proximity to the convention center made it Ideal for our cheerleading team to stay and it is easy to take the trolley to many places along Intl dr. The hot breakfast that was complimentary every morning was substantial and the overall atmosphere of this hotel is everyday luxury. The one drawback is the pool is not too large, though they do have a hot tub as well. Stay here, you will love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to Disney and chose Homewood Suites based on previous reviews. We were not dissappointed. The two bedroom, two bathroom suite was very comfortable, spacious and looked newly refurbished. Granite counter-tops and all. Beds were comfortable and pillows and towels clean, fluffy white,and adequate in number. The only negative factor was that our room was never cleaned before 2:00pm on each of the four days we were there. We left for the parks very early in the morning and always came back around 2:00pm for an afternoon rest. The room was either not yet cleaned, or being cleaned. This was sort of inconvenient. Anyway once it was done, it was spotless. Another drawback, - the elevators were very slow. The hotel definately needs another on either side. The wait is long and the lift jerks alot at each floor stop. Staff was very friendly and helpfull, and the breakfast was good, although crowded at times. The property is near to restuarants, although we found the prices higher than the average. In summary a good place to stay if you have kids, since there is a kitchennette in the suite. Oh yes,... don't rely on the free shuttle if you want to reach the parks at opening time, you will be late !!

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: cam405
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in these suites 4 times. We have never been let down by the standard of accomodation or level of service. This hotel is a very friendly hotel which is why we return time and again. There are bigger hotels but I think this makes it more special. The complimentary breakfast is excellent and the managers reception with complimentary wine beer and plentiful snacks make this really good value particularly for families.The location is excellent too with resturants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “i expected much more”
Reviews.Author: floridamad
Reviews.Content: after reading reviews on this hotel i had high expectations.we booked this hotel because of the reviews and wont make the same mistake again.dont get me wrong its not an awful place by any means but its not the hotel we expected.the rooms are small and really nothing out of the ordinary,we stayed for 3weeks and after phoning home for a couple of minutes got a $30 bill,when we checked it out we were being charged $2 aday for the safe which works out alot if your there as long as we were,we told the staff that the safe was stated as free and they explained it was safe insurance,we said we had our own insurance and they took it off.the free breakfast was ok and the evening meal a strange mix that after a couple of trys decided to miss.the hotel was ok,the shuttles were awful,we dont drive in florida and always choose a hotel with free shuttles to all the parks,not easy to find but this one sounded so great.what they dont tell you is that the shuttles to disney only go to epcot then you have to transfer to disney buses to get to the other parks and the same coming home.the 8.30 bus would get you to epcot at 9 then if you are going to mgm say you would have to get a disney bus giong to mgm,we didnt get into the park till 10.15 along time wasted in the morning.and if you wanted to go to typhoon lagoon you would have to go to epcot then a disney hotel then typhoon lagoon not getting there till 11.also there always seemed to be too many people for the buses and one nite we were crammed in with our children on our laps(not good if your child is a heavy 12 year old!!)and you always seemed to have to fight with everyone to get a place even though we had to book the shuttles and tell them in the morning what time we needed picking up,6.15 8.30 and 9.45.the disney fireworks are at 10 so theres no chance to get a shuttle back and a cab was $50.sorry to go on but i feel that if id have known this info i would have stuck to my original hotel comfort inn lbv which has direct shuttles at any time loads of spaces.a lesson learned for me i lost Â£50 changing from the comfort inn after bad reviews on here to a hotel that cost me Â£300 more.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, my first trip advisor disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: lewishogs
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and were not impressed. Upon checking in, I had to sign something agreeing to pay $50 if we checked out early. Made me feel trapped, and also made me feel like there was going to be a reason to want to leave early. I can't remember when we have not stayed the whole time we planned to stay in a hotel, but I had an urge to check out and go somewhere else the whole time. I think it was just knowing that we would be out fifty bucks to do so (call me crazy). The staff were all very friendly, and we got phone calls and notes from management welcoming us and telling us to call with any complaints. The rooms were very small and nothing special. Breakfast was typical, very well stocked. The first night we stayed in a room with an air conditioner that rattled and shook, so we asked to be moved. The second two nights were in an identical room, but the A/C was quiet. However, in both rooms, the air vent blew directly onto our faces - I woke up with a sore throat every morning. We would not choose this hotel again; would most likely stay at a downtown disney or disney hotel. Sounds like a lot of whining, but I was really disappointed because of the high trip advisor ranking. We are Hilton Honors gold members and therefore try to stay at Hilton properties. We chose it because it was the highest rated Hilton property in the Disney area. In the past we have always been thrilled with highly rated trip advisor properties.

Reviews.Title: “Very Overrated!!”
Reviews.Author: wutsnext
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the Homewood Suites International Drive. I really feel TA should categorize the hotels differently maybe by price or stars as this hotel is ok for a "chain" hotel but comes no where close to the Portofino Bay or the Grand Floridian and I am sure many other "luxury hotels". The suite is very small ok for 1 or two people. The furniture was worn and tattered. The bed was fine but nothing special. The carpet was soiled. My door lock was broken which I realized when I returned after a short trip on I-Drive to find the door unlocked even though it closed behind me. Then one of the windows would not close all the way with no screen but the wonderful maintenance men fixed that. They gave me a free movie and popcorn. Big deal! My next hotel actually gave me a free night for their inconveniences. The a/c in the room was ok but in the lobby and hallways was barely on. The pool was beyond horrible. I felt I was on the Spiderman ride looking up at concrete buildings. One person could carefully walk on each side around loungers and the sun only appeared for 3.5 hours during the hottest time of the day. They have a hot tub but I saw one couple in it for hours! If you have children or a large group the free buffets were fine especially for kids so you could save alot of money. But I would rather eat at some of the nice restaurants close by i.e. Bahama Breeze super great shrimp and Ming Court. I am sure the ratings are high for there are alot of hotels in the area with worse reviews. But I definitely would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “a nice family hotel”
Reviews.Author: pams2mum
Reviews.Content: hi all, my sister booked this has hotel as a surprise xmas and new year treat and we were not disappointed. the hotel is lovely and i think that it has a nice homely feel to it.the breakfast in the morning is very nice and there is a big selection from hot to cold selections and even making your own waffles and lots of free drinks in the morning as well. it is worth coming down early as it does get quite busy at around 8.oo in the morning and it is hard to find a table however you can take breakfast back to your room and the manager reception is nice in the evenings but if you like a good evening meal than you have to eat out. we had the one-bed suite i.e. one queen and sofabed. there were two rooms with two rooms. the laundry facility is good so is the pool when we were there the pool was not used much and there was not enough sun maybe it is different in the summer. there is also a barbeque near the pool and you can cook and eat outside by the pool not bad. there was enough parking when we were there and we would like to stay here next time i come to florida. it is much quiter and peaceful here and it is right behing bahama breeze. thanks pam.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for sometimes”
Reviews.Author: pureshot
Reviews.Content: Took the family for a weekend stay. After reading all the reviews I expected more. This cannot be a top 10 rated place to stay in Orlando? The Suite was smallish. The furnishing were old and tired. The lobby and hallway AC was poor. The pool was ok. Waking up to the trash pick up was not that wonderful. One positive was the beds were good. I would not stay here again. I wonder how this location can get such high ratings. It makes me wonder if someone is gaming the rating systems. The service was good, and they made an effort to make up for making us wait 45 minutes on checking in. That said in my opinion this is not the best stay in Orlando and should not be rated so highly.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic, we stayed there the first time we went to Florida, The location is ideal, we had chosen this hotel because we didnt want to drive, we were still worried about getting about though, really no need. Free shuttle takes you to all the parks and there's the I Ride Trolley on the main road for going elsewhere. The rooms are fantastic, when we checked in, we were given a 2 bed room suite for the first night (we needed a smoking room), it was huge, 3 massive tv's, huge microwave and a dishwasher! We were moved the next morning to a one bed suite, this was more than sufficient. Staff are so friendly and informative as we were there during a hurricaine. The breakfast is great, i loved being able to make the waffles myself, good selection of other stuff too. They encourage you to take your breakfast to your room which is great and unlike other hotels. The hotel is spotless, always being cleaned and the maids even load up and start your dishwasher if there's anything in the sink, fresh supplies of shampoor, body lotion(smells lovely) everyday plus fresh towels. Loads or lovely places to eat close by, Olive Garden & Bahama Breeze being our favorites. We went back to Florida last year and stayed in the Springhill Suites (HWS were all booked up!) just beside the HWS, the hotel was fine but just wasn't the same, we were really dissapointed but we've just booked up for this year, back to HWS, so excited, I can't wait. They promote it as a 'home from home', it really is!!

Reviews.Title: “What more could you want???”
Reviews.Author: SunnyDee3
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Homewood Suites. What a treat! The rooms were big, 2 TV's, kitchen area with appliances, even a toaster. Also including dishes and utensils. The breakfast was fantastic. Much more than I expected. Pancakes. Frenchtoast, eggs, potatoes, pastrys, meat, yogurt, waffles, fruit, and much more. You save a fortune with the free breakfast. Also there is the evening reception, we were never there for that. Maid service excellent, staff excellent. Pool was great, hot tub great. The pool does get sun, you just have to sit in that area. It was not crowded at all when we were there. There is tons of stores, places to eat in walking distance. We took their shuttle to Magic Kingdom, with a return time of 10:15, which was nice, plenty of time to see the fireworks. I will be staying at the Homewood Suites from now on. You just can't go wrong staying here!!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel i have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: utterley brilliant cant wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: cuarenty
Reviews.Content: I don't understand what the other reviewers see in this hotel...staff loves to say "no". Rooms are okay, but there are many other okay rooms in Orlando with better service.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I have stayed at in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After seeing all the brilliant reviews on this site I booked this hotel and we were not disappointed at all. The staff are very friendly and on our first day a message was left on the phone checking that everything was ok. We had no trouble at all booking the shuttles for the parks, but it was January and not busy anyway. Having two rooms with a kitchen was luxury, I always wake up earlier than my daughter and it was great to be able to go into the other room to make a coffee and put the light on to read without having to disturb her. The breakfast was great, make your own waffles, cereal, french toast, fruit toast, bacon, eggs etc, we never got bored with it. I would not hesitate to stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Info about shuttle and tickets on the premesis could have been made clearer”
Reviews.Author: southernstyle
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located on International Drive near Universal Studios in an area with many shops and restaurants. The hotel was comfortable and our room was well appointed. We enjoyed the breakfast and the staff was friendly. The only complaint that I have was that the free shuttle, that was advertised on-line and one of the factors that we based the reservation on, left at 8:00 AM and you had to have made prior arrangements to ride it. Arriving on a Friday night, we were't aware of this until after the fact the next day. Also, the tickets to the theme parks that were sold in the lobby, weren't available after a certain time during the day. Since we hadn't been to Orlando for several years, it would have been nice to have known this in advance for the purpose of planning. Fortunately, The Visitors Center is nearby and we purchased our advanced tickets from there.

Reviews.Title: “It has everything”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is EXCELLENT. Free breakfast, nighttime snack. Free shuttle service to Disney, Sea World, and Universal. Within walking distance to many restaurants. What a great place to stay- especially for those who do not want to rent a car. I had originally booked with Embassy Suites, but after reading reviews on Tripadvisor, switched to Homewood. Would definately stay here again. My only problem was with some food we had delivered from the TGI Fridays (who is the recommended restaurant by homewood). Just be careful you get what you order/pay for before the deliveryman leaves- but this is NOT homewoods fault.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a handy location”
Reviews.Author: Cartman88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites late Oct 2005 and enjoyed everything about the hotel. The staff were extremely helpful. The rooms were spacious/clean with a separate bedroom and living room - there was also complimentary wireless internet access. The hot breakfast was incredible and very popular with all guests â€“ you have the option of eating in the dining area or taking the food back to your room. The location on International Drive is close to a number of major attractions and plenty of good shopping centres and factory outlets. Must also mention that the management were excellent at keeping the guests up to date with any activities relating to Hurricane Wilma. Overall very good value for money and we would highly recommend the Homewood Suites to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast. Different hot dishes each day with staff constantly cleaning up and refueling. Rooms are very clean, although maybe a bit small for a suite. Staff is excellent and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “pleasure was all ours”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my third time to visit Orlando.Last twice my wife and my ten year old son stayed at Sierra suites,just across from Homewood.Boys were we in for some surprise.We thought that all the hotels on Idrive would treat us similarly because they see so many tourists.They weren't rude or anything like,but they didn't seem to care less if we were happy or not.they seemed to just abide us so long as we didn't disturb them. This time we arrived with some trepidation.We were so surprised with the helpful and smiling welcome we received at reception.This pleasantness continued for the duration of our stay.I hurt my ankle two days before coming home.We were on our way to see if I could buy some crutches when the doorman approached me and asked if he could help.I told him my quest.No problem he replied .I have a friend who has some.Within minutes he returned with a set of crutches.altogether the staff were excellent.The level of comfort in the room and the efficiency of the cleaning staff leave nothing to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week from 1st October along with my husband and 5 year old son. We paid $119 a night.We had spent the previous week at the Homewood Suites in Lake Beuna which were excellent and only $79 a night. We had only chosen two different locations to cut down on travelling and the fact the most hotels in LBV didn't offer shuttle services to Universal. Firstly, the appearence of the hotel and the rooms were excellent. The breakfast was great if not a little crowded. However you could take food back to your room and keep going back for more. The Managers reception from Monday to Thursday was also very good and again you were able to take beer, wine, soft drinks and food back to your room if you wanted. We used the shuttle service to the parks every day and they were always there on time. It would have been great if there had been a late afternoon shuttle to the parks so you could have just gone for the night parades and fireworks. The pool was nice but no childrens pool which means you really have to be in there with young children. It was nice that you were in the shade as you don't have to worry about sun block all the time. The only downside of the hotel (and the reason I haven't given it 5 stars) is that it had the noisiest air conditioning I have ever heard. The first night we were there we turned our air conditioning off because it was so loud. However, it didn't seem to make any difference so we thought there was a problem. We called maintenance who arrived very promptly. They said the noise was from other peoples air conditioning because there was one channel that went from the top of the building to the bottom. Also the air condition units were mounted on the outside by the windows. Our room was literally vibrating. The maintenance man said it was a common complaint, so I was very surprised never to have read anyone else mention it on the reviews. He found us a room on the ground floor on the corner next to a store cupboard. He said it would be the quietest room he had and it was fine. We were moved that night and allowed to leave our stuff in our old room overnight and collect in the morning. There is no way I would have been able to spend a week in the old room. The noise would have driven me crazy. I guess if you are use to air conditioning then you probably wouldn't notice it so much. We hadn't had this problem the previous week. When you turned the aircon off there, it was completely silent. The location of the hotel is good. Lots of restaurants in walking distance. There is an I Ride Trolly stop five minutes from the hotel. All in all a lovely hotel but I don't think I would risk staying there again incase I ended up with a noisy room. Would probably stay at the one in LBV which also happened to be $40 a night cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Homewood for 2wks 24 Sep - 8 Oct. The hotel is homely, friendly and immaculate and we are very fussy about cleanliness. We had a one bed suite and really could not fault it. Maid was in every day with clean towels, shampoo, body lotion etc. Even though you have full kitchen facilities there's a complimentary breakfast with hot & cold food every morning & the managers buffet with free wine & beer Mon - Thu really is an added bonus. You can even take as much of it to your room and come back for more if you wish and if you read about anyone complaining that there's not enough choice IT'S COMPLIMENTARY!! Check out the buffet first with a few free drinks and eat elsewhere if nothing takes your fancy. We had a great holiday and would certainly stay at the Homewood again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janet75
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week at this hotel (15 - 22 September) and from walking in the door the staff couldn't do enough for you. Arrived late in the evening and were given a smoking room, when we went back to the desk this was instantly changed by the Night Manager. The next day he even asked if there was anything else he could help us with. The breakfasts were of a high standard and was hot and plentiful and the place was kept exceptionally clean. The rooms were also cleaned to a high standard. The only down side was that the pool was being renovated (due to open again on the 26th September), but we were told that we could have the use of the hotels next door, just across the car park, which we did, or to another one of the same chain. This hotel is in an ideal position - on I-Drive but set well back from the road so it is very quiet. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value and location”
Reviews.Author: karmic24
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very convenient, just off I-Drive so it's close enough to walk to numerous restaurants but away from traffic noise. Our 1 bed suite was a good size, with a well equipped kitchen, plenty of storage space and very clean. The free buffet breakfast was superb with a great choice (I'd never made my own waffle before!) and the evening drinks/snacks were equally good. It was great to return from a theme park and be able to grab a beer/coffee. The only slight negative during our trip was that the pool was closed for refurbishment for a week, but the pool next door was available for use which was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: typist58
Reviews.Content: This hotel is superb. The Manager of this hotel should be extremely proud of himself and all of his staff. The cleaners do a fantastic job of keeping the rooms clean. They even wash your dishes for you if there is even a single cup hanging around. We left our personal belongings hanging around and nothing at all was touched. We also had a 'do not disturb' sign to put on our door if we didn't want the cleaners disturbing us. The hotel lay shuttles on every single day of the week and may I also add that these shuttles were free. One day the shuttle was full so the hotel even laid a taxi on for the extra people. The free breakfast is so varied. The snacks of an evening are also plentiful and free wine and beer. I cannot fault this hotel at all. The hotel itself is pristine. This hotel is also in a superb position. It is just off International Drive and is very quiet. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody!!

Reviews.Title: “This Place Is Awful”
Reviews.Author: KandyKane
Reviews.Content: After reading all the positive reviews on this site, I thought I would have no problems. How wrong I was. I have been to Florida twice and can honestly say this is the worst hotel I have stayed in. We arrived on a Saturday and drove to the hotel. We got at front desk and was greeted by an ignorant women. When my husband politely said "hello" we just got a grunted reply of "name". When we booked, we requested a non smoking room. She told us that the room was a smoking room, and when we told her that we booked a non smoking room, she replied "not my problem, ask your rep"!! We thought this was very rude. So without an argument, we trudged up to our suite through a damp smelling corridor which was filled with bins full of rubbish. We discovered that the room 2 doors down were playing loud music. This was at 11:15!! We entered our suite to be greeted with damp smells, dirty carpets, unmade beds, unemptied bins, thread bare curtains hanging of the rail and when closed they had huge holes in them. The bathroom wasnâ€™t much better. Mould on the tiles, broken shower head that was no more than a drizzle, leaking toilet, and the mirror was missing. We turned on the air conditioning to find it didnâ€™t work. But because it was so late we decided to wait till the morning till we informed the front desk. We went to be at about 12am. It had been 20 minutes and the loud music was still playing. In the end my husband called front desk to tell them. It was the same woman as before and she just said the hotel policy was that music can be played until 01:30 hours at the weekends!! We told her we couldnâ€™t sleep and she said there was nothing she could do about it and hung up on us!! We were kept awake till 1:45am and called front desk again and told her that the time limit was up and asked for someone to come up and tell them to turn the music down. She said she couldnâ€™t as the hotel security was on vacation and that she or other members of staff couldnâ€™t because it was â€œhotel policyâ€�. It seemed she liked saying that. We eventually got to sleep but were woken by someone banging on our door at 6:30am. It was a maid wanting to clean our room!! I said we are still in bed and she practically ordered us to be out the room by 7:30!!! We couldnâ€™t believe the attitude. We decided to go to Magic Kingdom and take advantage of the free Disney transport. We went to front desk and, yes you guessed it, greeted by the same receptionist as before. We asked for the free coach and she informed us that the free shuttle was only available on certain days and that today we would have to pay!! We were disgusted. It is what I would call false advertisement. So off we went to the theme park and before we left we asked for maintenance to fix the leaky toilet and the air conditioner. We got back and found the toilet NOT fixed and neither had the air conditioner!! Again called front desk who told us maintenance only worked nine till six!! We also discovered the room HADNâ€™T been cleaned by the maid who had made us exit our room to clean it. So at this point we were getting annoyed. We have: Ignorant staff, dirty rooms, loud music, woken up by the maids, poor service and basically being ripped off. The next incident took place 5 days later. We got back from the theme park to discover a watch of my husbandâ€™s had gone missing. We reported it to front desk who said in so many words nothing could be done and blamed us by saying we had mislaid it!! We decided to move hotels but were told we couldnâ€™t by our rep. We put up with this dire place for the rest of the holiday. During this time rooms were not cleaned well or simply not cleaned at all, the broken electrical things were never fixed or replaced, loud music and noise went on till all hours with nothing being done. And to add insult to injury on the last day, we went to get our deposit back and were told we couldnâ€™t have it because of the maintenance work that had been done on our room!!!! Not only had NO work been done but should WE pay for that anyway??!!?! We were disgusted with this hotel and would advise people to avoid. Pick the Embassey Suites or The Quality Inn Plaza Suites. These are so much better and better price as well.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From start to finish our hoilday was beyond our wildest dreams. The reception staff as with all the other staff were brilliant. Nothing was too much trouble for them. The rooms were fantastic with everything we needed for a perfect hoilday. The managers Welcome Home Reception on an evening was fantastic as was the breakfast. I would recomend this hotel to anyone without hesitation. We couldn't believe what a lovely hotel had been picked for us

Reviews.Title: “Providing Added Value”
Reviews.Author: Andrea1958
Reviews.Content: We have now had two vacations at this hotel and there is no need to add to all other comments about this hotel, as all confirm the excellent value and service. We will not hestiate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel when I was in Orlando for trade shows in January 2005 & January 2004. Both times were perfect. The suites were beautiful, the staff friendly and the food...WOW! The free continental breakfast served every morning was more generous than I've seen in any hotel before. And every night brought had a "manager's reception" with food and drink--practically a full dinner, free! Like I said, I've been there twice and LOVED IT! If I went back for another trade show I wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: goldy71
Reviews.Content: The Homewood Suites on International Drive in Orlando is great for families. Excellent service, clean rooms, free breakfast and snacks and an ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked holiday through TravelCityDirect and were not disappointed! Arrived late at hotel as plane delayed, great welcome by hotel staff, very welcoming. Was well impressed with room - large living area & bedroom with very large bed. Room was cleaned on a daily basis. If returning to Orlando we would definately stay here again great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed at the homewood suites june 11-25.Read all the positive reviews and booked through travelcity direct, we were not dissapointed hotel is a gem rooms spacious and clean and the staff so friendly and canot do enough for you.It realy is a home from home thats how it feels. free breakfast was good and free food and drink monday-thursday if you are around for it which we never were.Its on the best side of international drive,near wonderworks so its quiet so no trouble sleeping.would stay here agian, and recomend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault the place!!!”
Reviews.Author: stevetvs
Reviews.Content: We went here( June 8 thro 11) after reading previous Trip Advisor reports and were not disappointed. All staff very polite, helpful and friendly Large clean room with lounge/kitchen/diner separate bedroom with dressing area and bathroom Excellent hot and cold breakfast buffet (free) Monday to Thurs evenings Free beer/wine with hot and cold buffet ( this is the U.S. and there is lots of it!) Nice location close to shops and places to eat and I-Ride trolley service stop close by. Pity the weather wasn't the normal Florida sunshine ( thanks to Arlene ) We couldn't find a fault at all and they tell you if you aren't satisfied "you don't pay" can't be fairer than that !

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Place --- Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: samgraham
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the opportunity to stay at the Homewood Suites on International Drive in Orlando, Florida for five nights during tourist season. We were impressed with the following: POSITIVES: -- Rooms were large, clean and well appointed. Televisions had more channels than you could shake your fist at. The suites have kitchenettes which were useful as well. -- Best free breakfast I've been to. We get around quite often and this morning breakfast was the best. Well stocked, plentiful, and good. -- Staff ... really considerate. Everyone said hello, good morning, and went out of their way to be helpful. -- Extremely good location. Talk about centrally located, it doesn't get any better than this place. NEGATIVES: -- The elevators were extremely slow. There were several, but be prepared for a wait. -- The convenience store was outlandishly priced. $2.25 for a 16 oz Coke in the store was outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Homewood Suites for 5 nights Memorial Day Weekend for a conference. This hotel is not a luxury hotel. It is a great extended stay with a kitchen, refrigerator, stove top and microwave. It was also nice that the hotel offered complimentary breakfast daily (waffles, muffins, hot breakfast and coffee). On weeknights, they also offer social hour with complimentary food and beer /wine. The hotel is very clean and comfortable and relatively new (maybe 3 years old). The rooms have separate living areas. Check in was great, and the staff was very helpful. The only reason I am not giving this hotel an excellent, it that when i asked for a metered cab.. they gave me a limo/towncare company with set rates...no meter! And when I took the same ride with a metered cab it was almost half the difference. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to the Convention Center Area. I got a great rate on this hotel on Priceline for $65/night. I would say the same for Disney travelers, except I would advise to rent a car. Rental rates are so reasonable, and much less than you will pay for taxi service. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Superb place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week whilst in Orlando with my family. Hotel staff very friendly, rooms spotlessly clean, pool ideal, a really great place to stay. We decided to stay here as a result of the good reviews on trip advisor and they were very accurate. Would stay here again definately!!

Reviews.Title: “Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: nice2011
Reviews.Content: I just got back from spending 6 nights with this hotel. The hotel was very clean, and housekeeping comes later in the day, so you can get your rest from spending so much time at the amusements parks. The hotel is very roomy, and includes your own kitchenette with dishes, Plus your own living room area, and separate bedroom area. Staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful in making your stay comfortable. I will definitely be back at this hotel again! Great service...Friendly Staff...Absolutely Outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Homewood Suites were fantastic. All the staff made you feel welcome and it was very good value for money as well, considering the breakfasts that you could eat there. The rooms were very clean and tidy as well. We were in our hotel for 2 days when the hurricane hit, but the staff kept us up to date with what was happening and they fed us. When the water leaked in which was not the hotels fault, the weather was bad! They came and cleaned the carpet, used air freshener and checked the windows and made sure no more rain would come in. The most attentive staff yet. Homewood Suites is like being at home!

Reviews.Title: “Hooray for Homewood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I originally chose this hotel after much internet research based on excellent reviews I had read on this website and others. I have not been disappointed, the Homewood was excellent especially as it was not an expensive hotel, amongst the cheapest options in the travel brochure we chose from. Free breakfast was great, wide range of choices, we did not have any problems with the plastic cutlery and paper plates, they were quite sturdy, not the really flimsy ones. There is a safe in the wardrobe and there are decent hairdryers which I had wondered about myself beforehand. Proper iron and board also. In fact the only addition I would have liked (and would never expect anyway in an American hotel) is a kettle, as I like my cuppa:-) I just used microwave to boil water for tea. We did not use the pool, but as others said it is in the shady courtyard, it looked nice though (also the jacuzzi), our room overlooked pool area. We did not go to the evening buffet either as we were never there around that time. A great selection of recommended restaurants within a few minutes walk, Race Rock and Olive Garden were our favourites. 24 hr Walgreens also within 5 min walk. An easy quiet drive to Disney straight down I Drive turn right onto 536 and straight into Disney, about 8 miles but not complicated. We used rental car not shuttles, plenty of parking. Would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone. Comfy bed, plenty of room, big fridge freezer and microwave. Great housekeeper (thank you Cielo) friendly staff. We used laundry room one night with no problems ($1.75 for washer, same for dryer).

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Mallogal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last year when hurricane frances hit & they were great. Great breakfast & they also put on some evening snacks a few nights a week. The only things I would complain about are the pool (it is in the shade) & the gym which didn't have much equipment. Overall it was great value, great service & very clean.

Reviews.Title: “We will come back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Compared to the rate (about 100 $/ night) this hotel was a good one. Clean, spacious, quiet, worth money... Location is excellent, right off I-drive, but not noisy at night time. I stayed here with my husband and two little kids (3 years old and 7 months old) for two nigths in April 21-22, 2005. For our family there was everything we needed. Two televisions, fridge, microwave oven, quiet and efficient a/c (not adjustable though?) in suite... Pool was heated (our 3 years old loved it), although the pool is in inner courtyard so it was bit shady. Breakfast was good hot/cold. (Highchairs available.) We also enjoyed the managers reception for ten minutes on thursday evening as we arrived (it ends at 7 p.m.). We ended up skipping the dinner for evening. So for being free it was really great. The shuttle to Sea World only went once or twice a day and it comes back only once at evening time. Not very flexible for our family with two little kids. We used rental car. This Homewood Suites was just what we wanted for our hotel. There was everything we needed and for the price that was worth paying. We would most definitely be back to this hotel if visiting Orlando again.

Reviews.Title: “absolutley fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one week in may. This is by far the best place i have ever stayed. My room was spotless and the staff excellent. Some of the fancy five star hotels could learn a thing or two from the excellent homewood suites. I would highly recommend anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend the Homewood”
Reviews.Author: Anniepan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week here (23-30 April 05) and our apartment was spotless, staff very helpful and friendly, cleaning was non-intrusive and position was central. On the I-Drive tram 75c fare anywhere along the line, all the shuttles laid on to Disney, Sea World and Universal worked well which saved us hiring a car and paying $8 a day to park it! The breakfast saved some dollars (shame about the paper plates etc though) and the nibbles at the Managers Reception we had to start us off for the evening a couple of times with a free glass of vino were a nice touch. Only disadvantages were that the pool was in shade and there was nowhere for us Brits to sunbathe as we love to do. But the hotel was within easy walking distance of Pointe Orlando for shops and bars etc, right next door to the Official Visitors Center which was handy and the Reebok Outlet. Good bar we enjoyed was Bahama Breeze - always popular and we sat outside a few nights with huge appetizers and desserts to accompany our drinks whilst listening to some apt caribbean/reggae style music, full meals are taken inside. Everything went like clockwork and nothing was too much trouble - wouldn't hesitate to recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed here june 2004 and loved it. free beer, free food and the rooms were excellent. would definately go back. my party consisted of 4 adults and 2 teenagers and everybody praised the suites. well done homewood/hilton.

Reviews.Title: “perfect will go back.”
Reviews.Author: teddyeddy
Reviews.Content: Hotel was just perfect, room clean and tidy, staff always pleasant and ready to help. I especially loved the free buffett(tues-thurs) you did not need to go out afterwards to dine. I congratulated the manager on such a lovely hotel. Will definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: martdm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Homewood Suites location both the day before and the day we returned from a cruise out of Port Canaveral. The location is excellent - right on International Drive but set back off the road so it is quiet. We had both a one room and a two room suite, both of which were clean, spacious and well tended. Especially in the two room suite, there is plenty of room for a family to hang out and sleep and the full kitchen facilities would make eating in a breeze. We didn't partake of the complimentary breakfast except to grab some coffee to go but it seemed to by a typical hot/cold breakfast buffet and everything looked and smelled good. I'd recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “would stay here EVERY time!!!!”
Reviews.Author: wooguin
Reviews.Content: Absolutely outstanding!!!! Words fail me to describe how wonderful this place is.... Room cleanliness 5***** Room facilities 5***** Food 5***** Pool 5***** Jaquzzi 5***** Staff 5***** Maids 5***** Location 5***** Just Perfect! Now we have discovered the Homewood suites, we would NEVER stay anywhere else....

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Homewood Suites in January 2005. After arriving the first day from the airport, a delicious meal was awaiting us with Turkey, Rice, Vegetables, Salad, Rolls, Drinks, and desert. It was a blessing to have this meal after traveling and feeling very hungry upon arrival. Also, each night there was a great menu and each morning at breakfast there was plenty to eat. The suites were modern and clean. The staff was very courteous and called me in the room to make sure everything was fine. I certainly will come again.

Reviews.Title: “Full marks - excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Picked up a voucher front the Tourist Information (about 200m away) and stayed in one of their excellent suites (apparently their smallest!) for a mere $79 plus taxes etc, per night. Staff were very friendly, accommodation was excellent and just wait 'till you see the complimentary breakfast. Can't say enough good things about this place - will I stay again? Definately, if I get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “impeccable service!”
Reviews.Author: p&sshea
Reviews.Content: We have travelled more than the average couple staying in B & B's, and hotels alike. Some of the top of the line hotels could learn a thing or two about guest relations from these folks. Absolutely every detail is looked after and every staff member you meet is concerned about your satisfaction. We never met the hotel manager, but I can tell you his name is Scott because there is communication EVERYWHERE telling guests to speak directly to him if they are in any way disatisfied with the hotel...and it is apparent that he means it! A lovely hotel at a great price and spotlessly clean. Service is superb. We'd go back anytime!

HotelInfo.Name: Homewood Suites Orlando/International Drive/Convention Center
HotelInfo.Address: 8745 International Drive, Orlando, FL 32819
